loans.name: Ecelina Ginoca

texts.pt:
Elina da Ginoca nasceu na cidade de Maputo, capital de Moçambique, tem 31 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 3 e 11 anos, os dois mais crescidos frequentam escola. Elina continua a estudar estando neste momento a frequentar 10 classe. Vive na casa própria no bairro Campoane, no distrito de Boane, com o seu marido professor e sem ninguém mais por sustentar.

Saiu da cidade de Maputo para Matola, onde cresceu em casa dos seus familiares e mais tarde casou se com o professor. Faz comercialização de caprinos que os adquire na província de Gaza e vende na província de Maputo há mais de 2 anos. Com os rendimentos provenientes desta actividade ajuda o marido nas despesas familiares, assim como na construção da casa de alvenaria.

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através das amigas e outros vizinhos, tendo depois decidido aproximar. Já levantou 2 empréstimos para a mesma actividade de construção de casa de alvenaria nos valores de 10.000,00mt e 12.000,00mt.
Com o presente empréstimo de 15.000,00mt pretende comprar cimento, areia e outros materiais, para dar continuidade com a obra.

Propõe se a pagar o empréstimo sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com o objectivo de terminar a construção da casa de alvenaria.
texts.en:
Elina da Ginoca was born in the city of maputo, the Capital of Mozambique. She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children with ages between 3 and 11 years old. The two oldest are in school. Elina is continuing her schooling and is, at this moment, attending the 10th grade. She lives in her own home in the Campoane neighborhood in the district of Boane with her husband who is a teacher. They do not support any other people. She left the city of Maputo for Matola where she grew up in the home of her family, and later she married a teacher. She has a business selling goats which she acquires in Gaza and sells in Maputo. She has done this for more than 2 years now. With the earnings provided by this activity she helps her husband with the family expenses as well as with the construction of a brick home. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through friends and other neighbors, and afterward decided to inquire. She has already had 2 loans for the same purpose of constructing a brick home in the amounts of 10,000MT and 12,000MT. With this current loan of 15,000MT she intends to purchase cement, sand, and other materials to continue the work. She is committed to pay off the loan without problems so that she can receive more credit with the objective of completing her brick home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials (cement, stone, and others)

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is a 57-year-old married woman and mother of five children. In 2005, she opened a mini-market to earn income to help her husband in the household. Today, Fatmeh is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen sells diesel at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo State. She is married with seven children. She is 42 years old. She has been in this business for two years. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more diesel to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more diesel to sell

loans.name: Khoury

texts.fr: Khoury D. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est marié et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis un an et demi. Avec son crédit elle vend des produits cosmétiques, des bijoux, des sacs à main pour dames et et d'autres effets pour femmes. Elle a une expérience de son activité pour l'avoir exercée depuis plusieurs années. Les bénéfices réalisés seront réinjectés pour l'achat de marchandises afin de renforcer sa boutique. Elle soutien également son mari pour la prise en charge de leur famille.
texts.en:
Khoury D. is a 45 year old woman, married, and a mother of four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageous [village bank] for the last 1.5 years. She uses the loans she receives to sell cosmetics, jewelry, hand bags for women and other products. She has been involved in this type of activity for a number of years and is very experienced. Profits from the sales are used to purchase additional merchandise in order to improve her store. She also support her husband in taking care of their family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her retail store

loans.name: Tarlan

texts.en: Tarlan Z. is 23 years old. He is married and has one daughter who means everything in his life. Tarlan sells school supplies and has been in this business for 6 years already. This activity generates the main income for Tarlan's family. Tarlan is very popular in the market by selling school supplies, and he tries to maintain a wide range of items. Thus, today he requests 1606 AZN for increasing the variety of supplies that he sells. With your help, Tarlan will be able to make his business succeed and in the nearest future to make his own family.

loans.use: purchase a larger variety of items to sell

loans.name: Maria Ivone

texts.pt:
Maria T. nasceu no distrito da Manhiça, Província de Maputo, tem 55 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 1 filho de 20 anos de idade. Fez o magistério primário e ainda tenciona continuar para o ano seguinte, vive numa casa cedida pelos familiares, porque alugou a sua antiga casa. Sustenta a sua neta e mãe, enviando mensalmente géneros alimentícios e dinheiro para o pagamento de água e luz.

Saiu de manhiça ainda jovem, para Matola rio, na cidade de do mesmo nome, com seus pais, quando estes foram transferidos pelos serviços. Trabalhou nas Linhas aéreas de Moçambique durante 27 anos e reformou ha 2 anos.
Tem uma pensão mensal de 5.850.00mt mais 12.000.00mt provenientes da renda de casa. Poupa algum valor mensalmente no banco comercial BARCLAYS.

Já teve um empréstimo no NOVO BANCO, para a compra de material de construção e depois de terminar, decidiu não continuar devido a vários motivos. 
Conheceu a Hluvuku através de uma amiga vizinha que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tijoleiras, portas e chapas de zinco) para continuar com a sua obra.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo, afim de poder aceder a mais empréstimos. No futuro deseja solicitar mais empréstimos para a conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
Maria T. was born in the district of Manhiça, in the Province of Maputo. She is 55 years old, a widow, and mother of one 20 year old son. She completed the first year of her elementary teaching credential, and intends to continue through next year. She lives in a house lent to her by relations, since she rented out her old house. She supports her granddaughter and mother, sending them food and money to pay the water and light.

She left Manhiça for the city of Matola with her parents when they were transferred there for work. She worked for the Mozambique National Airlines for 27 years, and retired two years ago. She has a monthly pension of 5,850 MZN, plus 12,000 MZN from renting out her house. She saves something every month at the Barclay's commercial bank.

She received a previous loan from Novo Banco to purchase construction material and after finishing the loan she decided not to continue for various reasons. She learned about Hluvuku through a nearby friend who is also a client of the organization. With this first loan of 25,000 MZN from Hluvuku, she plans to buy construction material (tiles, doors and galvanized sheets) to finish her home.

She intends to pay back this loan promptly, in order to be able to receive further loans. She would like to apply for additional loans in the future to complete the work on her house.

Translated from Portuguese by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials (cement and others)

loans.name: Sharavjamst

texts.en: O. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her son, 19, attends university; her oldest daughter, 17, attends a local secondary school; and her youngest daughter, 4, attends a local kindergarten. Her husband works as a miner during the summer months and helps O. with her business during the winter months. O. operates an electronic appliances business in a shipping container in the local market. She began her business in 2006 with working capital of 6,000,000 tugrugs (about $4,200) and over the years, her business has grown. It now has a working capital of 10,000,000 tugrugs ( about $7,000). She also operates a second business at night making ger covers. With her business success, she has managed to buy a car for her family and hopes to continue paying her children’s tuition fees in order to give them a brighter future. O. is requesting a 3,500,000 tugrug loan in order to import electronic appliances and ger materials from China. XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest micro-finance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save. To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team. To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To import electronic appliances and ger materials from China

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 38 years old and married with two children. She sells both foodstuffs and groceries at the front of her house, combining these businesses to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her immediate family members. She has been in this business for a long time.

This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette D. est une femme de 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants. Son crédit lui permet de développer une activité commerciale en vendant des légumes (carottes, manioc, aubergine etc.) et du poisson. elle soutien son mari pour les charges familiales à partir des bénéfices qu'elle réalise
texts.en:
Maguette DIOUFis a 26 year old woman, married, and a mother of 3 children. Her loan permits her to develop a commercial activity of selling vegetables (carrots, cassava root, eggplant, etc) and fish. Profits from the store are used to support her husband in taking care of their family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her retail activity

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Isabel S. nasceu no distrito da Namaacha, província de Maputo, tem 58 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 07 filhos dos quais 05 já são maiores de idade e os dois últimos de 14 e 12 anos de idade ainda vão a escola. Não estudou porque não tinha condições pois perdeu os pais ainda criança. Vive na casa própria e para alem dos filhos sustenta os netos que vivem com ela.

Saiu de Namaacha para Boane quando casou-se em 1967, É comerciante e dona do negócio há 07 anos trabalha das 12h as 20h pois, no período de manha, tem estado sempre na machamba da família com o seu marido.
Aprendeu a fazer negócio por iniciativa própria por causa das dificuldades financeiras que estava a atravessar na altura. O seu rendimento semanal é de 750,00mt e para alem deste conta com uma pensão mensal de 4.250,00mt totalizando assim um rendimento mensal de 7.250,00mt com o qual consegue poupar na sua conta bancária.
 
Já trabalhou com outra instituição financeira denominada Tchuma onde beneficiou de um empréstimo no valor de 3.500,mt destinado a actividade Agropecuária.
Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000,00mt com o qual pretende comprar materiais de construção (barrotes, chapas de zinco, cimento, areia, pedra e ferro) para melhorar as condições da sua residência.

Os seus primeiros empréstimos foram de 6.000,00mt e 12.000,00mt ambos destinados a actividade agropecuária. Compromete-se a pagar bem este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros empréstimos para terminar a sua obra e mobilar a casa.
texts.en:
Isabel S. was born in the distric of Namaacha, province of Maputo. She is 58 years old, married and mother of 7 children. Five of her children are adults and the younger, who are attending school, are 14 and 12 years old. She has not studied because she had no conditions to do so since she lost her parents when she was still a child. She lives in her own house and, beyond her children, she supports her grandchildren who live with her.

She left Namaacha to Boane when she got married, in 1967. She is a trader, and owns her business for 7 years. She works from 12:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m. In the mornings, she has been working at the family's vegetable garden with her husband.

She has learned to do business by herself, because of financial difficulties she was facing in the past. Her weekly earnings are of MZN 750.00 and, beyond that, she earns a monthly pension of MZN 4,250.00, which totals MZN 7,250 of monthly earnings. She is able to save some money in her bank account.

She has worked with another financial institution before, called Tchuma, where she got a loan of MZN 3,500.00 which was applied to agricultural activity. This is her third loan with Hluvuku, of MZN 20,000.00, with which she intends to buy construction materials (beams, zinc sheets, cement, sand, stones and iron) in order to improve her house conditions.

Her first loans were of MZN 6,000.00 and MZN 12,000.00, both applied to agriculture. She pledges to repay well this loan in order to have access to new ones so that she can conclude her construction and furnish her house.


Translated from Portuguese by Giovanna Fernandes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials (cement, iron, zinc sheets and others)

loans.name: Dagvadorj

texts.en:
Dagvadorj O. is 32 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her children, a son and two daughters, all attend a local secondary school.

O. operates a clothing trading business out of a rented stall at the local market in her town. She started her business in 2003 with capital of 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD). Over the years she has gained much business experience and has built a positive reputation amongst her customers and suppliers. She attributes her business success to her good accounting skills. Today, her working capital exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (~3500 USD).

Due to her success, O. has plans to expand her business in the near future. She works very hard to grow her business and increase her earnings as it is the only source of income for her family. She says, "My one wish is for my children to receive a good education and become good people who can lead their lives without difficulties." She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to import products from China.


About XacBank:
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To import products from China

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en:
T. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of his daughters, 10 and 7, attend a local secondary school, while T. and his wife operate a clothing retail business. He began his business in 2005 by renting a stall at a local market. Since then, the business profits have enabled him to pay for his children’s tuition fees and have improved the entire family’s quality of life. He hopes to one day open his own clothing shop so that he can increase his customer base and his profits. T. is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase and import clothing products from China.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase and import clothing products from China

loans.name: Evaristo Armando

texts.pt:
Evaristo nasceu na província de Inhambane (a 400km mais a norte de Maputo) tem 46 anos de idade, casado e pai de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre 6 e 23 anos. Não teve possibilidades de estudar cedo mas neste momento frequenta 12 classe. Vive na cidade de Maputo na casa dos serviços com sua família e sem ninguém mais por sustentar.

Saiu de Inhambane a província nortenha de Niassa para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório no ano de 1982. Continua militar no activo. Chegou a Maputo transferido para trabalhar na cidade de Maputo no ano de 2003 e ganha 17.000,00mt mensais com os quais sustenta a sua família e manda algum para sua família e inhambane.

Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 25.000,00mt para compra de material de construção (cimento, pedra, areia, chapas e outros). Os primeiros créditos foram para a mesma actividade nos valores de 15.000,00mt e 30.000,00mt, respectivamente.

Compromete se reembolsar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com objectivo de concluir a casa e depois iniciar uma actividade comercial.
texts.en:
Evaristo was born in the Inhambane province (400 km north of Maputo). He is 46 years old, married, and has 6 children ages 6 to 23. He was not able to go to school when he was young but now is attending the 12th grade. He lives in the city of Maputo in military housing with his family and does not support anyone else. He left Inhambane for the northern province of Niassa to complete his mandatory military service in 1982. He is still in the military, but inactive. He was transferred to Maputo for his job in 2003 and earns 17.000,00 MT per month, which he uses to support his family and send some money to family in Inhambane. This is his third loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 25.000,00 MT for the purchase of construction materials (cement, stones, sand, sheet metal, etc.). His other loans were for the same activity in the amounts of 15,000.00 and 30,000.00 respectively. He promises to pay back his loan without any problems in order to have access to future loans with the goal of completing his house and then starting a business.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, stones, sand, etc. )

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is married with 6 children, and she is 48 years old. She is a focused hard worker. She sells daily from 7:00 am–6:30 pm. She sells foodstuff like yam tubers and plantains at the front of her house. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuff to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Tsendjav

texts.en:
T. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two young sons in Kharhorin, the ancient Mongolian capital city. Her husband is currently unemployed and stays home with the two boys. T. operates a clothing retail business at a local market. She began her business in 2005 after working as a herder with her husband for several years. Her business has been quite successful and has allowed the family to buy land and build a house on it. She hopes to keep growing her business so that she can provide for her family in the future and improve their quality of life. T. is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug loan in order to import clothes from China for her business.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To import clothes from China for her business

loans.name: Pilatos Bernardo

texts.pt:
Pilatos nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 32 anos de idade, casado e pai de um filho de 9 anos de idade que se encontra a estudar na escola primária de Boane. Fez 12 classe e espera ingressar no ensino superior no próximo ano. Vive em Boane na casa própria com a família e mais 2 sobrinhos.

Mudou se da cidade de Maputo para Boane no bairro de Mahelane com os seus pais há 12 anos. Actualmente trabalha para uma ONG que lida com o tema de HIV e sida nas comunidades de boane e zonas afins desempenhando as funções de coordenador do projecto há mais de 4 anos e com salário mensal no valor de 8.500,00mt com os quais sustenta a família e poupa algum no Banco comercial (barclays). 

Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na hluvuku no valor de 14.400,00mt para compra de material de construção (chapas de zinco e outros). Os primeiros empréstimos foram para a mesma actividade nos valores de 8.000,00mt e 10.500,00mt, respectivamente.

Compromete se a pagar o crédito sem problemas para poder aceder a mais empréstimos com objectivo de concluir a obra e posterior apetrechamento.
texts.en:
Pilatos is a 32 year old man from Maputo, Mozambique. He's married and has a 9 year old son that goes to school. He finished 12th grade and hopes to get into college next year. He lives in his own house with his family and two nephews. He currently works as a Project Coordinator for a NGO that instructs people about HIV and AIDS in the nearby communities. He's been doing it for 4 years and makes U$290 per month, money which he uses to support his family and build his house. He is asking for a U$500 loan in order to buy construction supplies and finish building his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Mujeres De Zarecta Group

texts.es: El grupo " Mujeres de Zarecta " esta representado por la señora Elodia y conformada por 17 socias muy trabajadoras que van cursando ya su tercer ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y muchas ganas de sacar adelante sus negocios para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida. La gran mayoría de las socias se dedican a al elaboración y venta de pan de batalla, el resto en un menor porcentaje se dedican a la venta de comida, cosméticos, carne y sodas. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores son negociantes grandes pero las socias tienen sus clientes que constantemente generan el movimiento económico necesario para un ingreso diario. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra de insumos y herramientas para realizar un trabajo más eficiente y en mayor cantidad para hacer frente a ala competencia y al M. industrializado.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Zarecta group is represented by Elodia. It is comprised of 17 very hard-working members. They are in their third cycle, and they demonstrate responsibility and a great desire to get ahead in their businesses in order to give their families a better quality of life. Most of the members make and sell bread everyday. The rest, a smaller part of the group, sells food, cosmetics, meat, and soda. As far as the competition goes, their competitors are large businessmen. But, the members have their customers who always generate the necessary economic movement to get the daily income. The loan is to buy supplies and tools to do their work more efficiently and to produce a greater quantity. This way they can confront the competition in the industrialized market.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is married with a child, and she is 34 years old. She fries akara (bean cakes) to sell at the front of her house in Benin City, Edo State. She wakes up as early as 4:00 am daily to start the preparation of her akara by washing the beans. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more beans and cooking oil, to fry more akara to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Sharav

texts.en:
T. is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son, 22, works as a coach; her oldest daughter, 20, is a university student; and her youngest daughter, 17, attends a local secondary school. T. and her husband operate a grocery business out of a rented stall at a local market.

She began her business in 1991 with working capital of 100,000 tugrugs (~70 USD), and, since that time, her business has grown steadily and her working capital has now reached 4,600,000 tugrugs (~4050 USD). Not only has her business grown in terms of profits, but she has also managed to rent another grocery stall at another local market so that she can reach more customers. In the future, she plans to open her own grocery shop where she can expand the amount and types of products she sells and expand the amount of customers she attracts. She says, “My wish is to educate my children in order to make them better people.” She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase seabuckthorn berries and oil from Uvs province.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase seabuckthorn berries and oil from Uvs province

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Renacer” esta representada por la señora Yolanda y conformada por 12 miembros muy trabajadores los cuales van cursando juntos ya un tercer ciclo en el cual tuvieron algunos problemas con socias las cuales no pudieron cancelar su cuota por problemas familiares, grupo supo llevar la situación ayudando a la socias a cancelar sus cuotas mientras se volvía a recuperar y volver a juntar su capital D. trabajo demostrando la unidad y solidaridad del grupo. Las socias tienen diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, venta D. insumos médicos, servicios D. enfermería y limpieza. En cuanto al entorno competitivo es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia en su trabajo y también a sus ganas D. sacar a flote sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento diario D. su familia. El destino del crédito es para la compra D. mercadería e insumos que ayudaran a generar un mejor ingreso para que las socias puedan dar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda represents the Renacer Group, which is comprised of 12 hard-working members. They are in their third cycle. They did have some problems with members who could not make their payments due to family problems. The group knew how to handle the situation by helping the members to make their payments while they were recuperating. Then they could return to getting together their working capital, thus demonstrating the unity and solidarity of the group. The group has different commercial activities like selling food, cosmetics, groceries in neighborhood stores, and medical supplies. Some offer nursing and cleaning services. As far as the competition goes, it is high. But, the members know how to get ahead thanks to their work experience and their desire to keep their business afloat. They do this because they depend upon their businesses for their families’ daily support. The loan is to buy merchandise and supplies that will help generate better income so that the members can give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married and is 34 years old. She sells planks at retail prices to her customers in Benin City, Edo State, and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to be a distributor of planks in the future.

Victoria is requesting a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Las Creativas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Creativas” esta representado por Estenia y conformado por 13 miembros muy trabajadores que ya cumple un tercer ciclo demostrando unidad, responsabilidad, puntualidad y ganas D. seguir creciendo. Muchas D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como cosméticos, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, frutas y a los servicios D. costura D. prendas D. vestir, limpieza y a la albañilería.  En cuanto a la competencia las socias no tienen mayor problema gracias a su experiencia y al manejo D. su mercadería. El destino del financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y ene especial para herramientas como maquinas D. cocer, surf hiladoras y brocas otras herramientas que ayuden a realizar un trabajo mas rápido y en mayor cantidad que generará mayor ingreso para poder darles a sus familias un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Estenia represents the Las Creativas group, which is comprised of 13 hard-working members. They are completing their third cycle. They demonstrate unity, responsibility, punctuality, and the desire to keep growing. Many of the members sell products like cosmetics, groceries in neighborhood stores, and fruits. Some offer services such as dressmaking, cleaning, and bricklaying. Thanks to their experience and the way they manage their merchandise, the members do not have a big problem with competition. The loan is to get merchandise, supplies, and special tools like sewing machines, spinning machines, and bits. These things will help them do their work more quickly and produce greater quantities, which will generate greater income to be able to give their families a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Las Carmencitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “las Carmencitas” esta conformada por su presidenta la señora Patricia  y por 12 miembros que son muy trabajadoras y honestas como lo han demostrado en sus anteriores ciclos, son socias que se conocen desD. hace mucho tiempo y que también se han hecho mas unidas ene l tiempo que trabajan juntas por lo que confían una a la otra. En general las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como ropa, zapatos, joyas, comida al paso, frutas, cosméticos, otras atienden sus propios salones D. belleza o prestan servicios en repostería realizando masitas. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, pero las socias tienen sus clientes que constantemente generan el movimiento económico que necesitan para el sustento diario D. sus familias. El destino del nuevo financiamiento es para la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas pera realizar un trabajo con más rendimiento y en mayor cantidad que permita abaratar los costos del producto o del servicio.
texts.en:
The Carmencitos Group is comprised of the president, Patricia, and 12 very hard-working and honest members. They have demonstrated this in their previous cycles. The members have known each other for a long time. Also, they have become very united in the time that they have worked together, and they trust each other. In general, the members sell products like clothes, shoes, jewelry, fast food, fruit, and cosmetics. Other members run their own hair salons or proviD. bakery services making pastries. As far as competition goes, it is present in the neighborhood. But, the members have their customers who constantly generate enough economic movement for the daily support of the members’ families. The new loan is to get merchandise, supplies, and tools to do their work more efficiently and to produce a greater quantity of products. This will allow them to lower the prices of their products or their services.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Poderosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Poderosas” esta representado por la señora Ana y conformada por 13 miembros son muy activos debido a que esta formado por gente joven y muy capaz. En general los integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades D. índole comercial como la venta D. cosméticos, comida, abarrotes en tiendas D. Barrio, zapatos, empanadas y al servicio D. soldadura mecánica.  Dentro del ámbito comercial la competencia es siempre alta pero gracias a su experiencia las socias ya cuentan con clientes fieles que confían en sus productos y cuando las ventas descienden buscan mercados como ferias vecinales. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso y una mejor calidad D. sus productos. En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
Ana represents the Poderosas Group, which is comprised of 13 members. The members are very active because they are young, very capable people. Generally, the members of the group are engaged in commercial activities such as selling cosmetics, food, groceries in neighborhood stores, shoes, and empanadas. Some proviD. mechanical soldering services. Competition is always high in the commercial field. Thanks to their experience, the members have their loyal customers who have trust in their products. When sales fall, the members look for markets like neighborhood fairs. The loan is to get merchandise, supplies, and tools to help generate greater income and a better quality in their products. As far as their credit history goes, the members have experience thanks to similar financial institutions. But, this is the first time they have worked with an institution that offers them confidence and economic support. That is why they wish to continue growing with us.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a 50-year-old married woman with three children. She works as a farmer to provide for, along with her husband, the living conditions of her family. She has been involved in the agriculture sector for more than thirteen years.

Today, Mirna is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase agricultural tools.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural tools

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate is 42 years old and is married with seven children. She sells loaves of bread at the market in Benin City, Edo State, and has been in this business for a long time. She is a friendly woman and she uses this skill to attract more customers to her stall to purchase loaves of bread. 

Kate hopes for a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell

loans.name: Las Lideres Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Lideres” esta representado por señora Piedades y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales van cumpliendo ya su cuarto ciclo demostrando capacidad, responsabilidad y ganas D. trabajar. Todas las socias se dedican al comercio D. productos como cosméticos por catalogo, vidrio, ropa, pan y zapatos. Dentro del ámbito comercial la competencia es siempre alta pero gracias a su experiencia las socias ya cuentan con clientes fieles que confían en sus productos y cuando las ventas descienden buscan mercados como ferias vecinales. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar más ingresos para seguir creciendo para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida con formación D. un futuro para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Piedades represents the Las Lideres Group, which is comprised of 12 members. They are completing their fourth cycle; they demonstrate capability, responsibility, and the desire to work. The members sell products like cosmetics by catalog, glass, clothes, bread, and shoes. Competition is always high in the commercial field. But, thanks to their experience, the members have loyal customers who trust their products. When sales are down, the members look for other markets like neighborhood fairs. The loan is to get merchandise, supplies, and tools to help generate more income to keep growing. They want to give their families a better quality of life by building a future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali has had his own business as a builder since 2007 and has five years of experience in this field. Two years after beginning his business, he has become well-known in this market and he is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy a fast car to facilitate his business travel.

loans.use: To buy a fast car for his business travel

loans.name: Siempre Unidos Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, viven en la ciudad del Cusco, la mayoría de ellos comparte un stand en su centro de trabajo, y tiene actividades similares.   

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades con el comercio minorista en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” en la ciudad Cusco. Una gran parte se dedica a la venta de ropas, frutas, papas, etc. Otros socios varones tienen carros que hace el servicio de transportes (taxi). Una de las socias de este banco se dedican a la venta loceria (cubiertos, tenedores, cuchillos , etc.). Otras tiene sus tiendas de abarrotes donde venden arroz, azúcar, aceite ,etc. Un socio es técnico electricista y repara radios, televisores, y muchos más artefactos. Una socia tiene un restaurante donde vende comida (desayuno, almuerzo y cena). 

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(las socias mirian y gladis no estan en la foto por que pidieron permiso)
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Siempre Unidos” (Always United). They live in the city of Cusco. The majority of them share vending posts at the places where they work and are involved in similar business activities.

The members divide their time among various activities associated with their retail businesses at the Virgen Asunta Market in Cusco. The majority of the group sells clothing, fruit, potatoes, etc. Other male members, with the use of their motorcycle taxis, offer transportation services. One member sells flatware (knives, forks, spoons, etc.). Others have grocery stores where they sell rice, sugar, oil, etc. Another member is an electrician who repairs radios, televisions, and other appliances. One member has a restaurant and offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

The members are requesting a loan to use as working capital for increasing their inventory. As a result, they hope to increase their sales and improve the quality of life for their families.

The members value and appreciate the loan that has been provided to them. They agree to make their payments on the established due dates.

(Group members Mirian and Gladis requested permission not to appear in the photo.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 53-year-old married man with four children. He has been working as a taxi driver for 20 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs.

Today, Mahmoud is asking for a loan of $1,000 to perform maintenance on his car to be able to continue his work properly.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Guapay Sur Group

texts.es: El grupo “Guapay Sur” esta representado por la señora Ana Barbara y conformada por 13 miembros D. amigas y socias muy unidas, activas, emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades para confraternizar y así unirse mas como grupo. La actividad principal D. todas las socias es la venta D. ropa, pero también venden comida, empanadas, zapatos, juegos, queso y cosméticos por catalogo en sus tiempos libres. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, las socias tienen sus clientes fieles que constantemente  generan el movimiento económico necesario para la subsistencia D. sus familias, en caso D. que no les vaya bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugar o diversifican su actividad económica D. forma que puedan cumplir con las necesidades D. sus hijos. El crédito esta destinado a la compra D. mercadería en desaguadero y la adquisición D. insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor producto y una mejor ganancia para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida D. vida.  En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
The group "Guapay Sur" is represented by Mrs. Ana Barbara and maD. up of 13 members, who are very close friends and partners. They are very active and enterprising people that desire to perform activities in order to become closer friends and therefore more united as a group. The main activity of these partners is the sale of clothing, but they also sell food, empanadas, shoes, games, and cosmetics by catalogue in their free time. In regard to the competitive environment, we can mention that although competitors are present in their neighborhood, our partners have faithful clients that constantly generate the necessary economic activity for the subsistence of their families. In the case that things aren't going well in their neighborhood, they direct themselves to another place or they diversify their economic activity in a way that they can fulfill their childrens' needs. This credit will be used for the purchase of merchandise in the city of Desaguadero and the acquisition of materials and tools that will help them generate a better product and greater earnings to be able to proviD. their families a higher quality of life. As for experience with credit, our partners have received financing from similar institutions, but this is the first time they have worked with an institution that provides them confidence and economic support, for which they desire to continue growing together with us.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and merchandise

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef has owned an electrical repair shop in his town since 2006. He's 25 years old and single. He is the only provider for the family.

Today, Youssef is applying for a loan of $1,200 to purchase additional tools in order to develop and expand his shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional tools

loans.name: Rosa Avelina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está ubicado  en la parroquia el Valle al  suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur del país, esta región  es conocida por su mayor  producción de maíz, fréjol, papas, etc., también por los atractivos turísticos como son los sitios arqueológicos de Gullanzhapa y Pedernales, su gente es muy cordial y amable con el turista nacional y extranjero.

La señora Rosa Avelina  D. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, ella vive en la  parroquia el Valle en la comunidad Santa Catalina, tiene 43 años de edad, enviudó hace dos años su esposo murió producto del exceso de ingerir alcohol, fruto de su unión matrimonial concibió cinco hijos de 21, 19, 18, 16, 14 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja  y le ayuda un poco con los gastos de la casa, sus tres siguientes hijos aún son estudiantes de secundaria en el colegio Guillermo Mensi, su última hija trabaja como niñera para sus gastos personales;  no tienen casa propia viven en una casa de herederos cuidándola.

Rosa trabaja haciendo  la limpieza de una escuela, fue contratada por la conserje y lleva dos años en ésta actividad  percibe un ingreso mensual, también se dedica a la cría de pollos.

Nuestra socia lleva cuatro ciclos trabajando con los préstamos de la fundación con ellos compró crías de pollos y para cubrir el estudio de sus hijos, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR  le entregue va a compra  alimento y vitaminas para sus pollos.

Su sueño es llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The Heart of Jesus Communal Bank is located in El Valle Parrish, which is southwest of the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. This region is primarily known for its production of corn, beans, potatoes, and other crops. It also has tourist attractions, such as the archeological sites in Gullanzhapa and Pedernales. The people are very friendly and kind to domestic and foreign tourists.

Sra. Rosa Avelina D. is a member of the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Santa Catalina in El Valle Parrish. She is 43 years old and has been widowed for two years as a result of her husband’s alcoholism. Her five children range in age from 14 to 21. Rosa’s oldest son works and is able to make a small contribution toward the household expenses. Her next three children are students at Guillermo Mensi High School. The youngest daughter works as a nanny in order to cover her personal expenses; she does not live at home because she stays at the home of her employer.

Rosa works as a school janitor. She has been at this job for two years and receives a monthly salary. She also raises chickens and has taken out four previous loans to purchase chicks and pay for her children’s educational expenses. With her new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy chicken feed and vitamins. Rosa’s dream is to eventually own a home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed & vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en: Abbas is a 28-year-old single man who lives with his parents. He has owned a barber shop since 2004. He is requesting to borrow for the second time a loan of $1,200 to add new decor to his shop in order to attract new clients.

loans.use: To add new decor to his shop

loans.name: Las Mariposas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las Mariposas” esta representado por la señora Blanca  y conformada por 12 miembros de amigas y socias muy unidas, activas, emprendedoras que desean realizar actividades para confraternizar y así unirse mas como grupo. La actividad principal de todas las socias es la venta de productos como comida, venta de lácteos, shampoo, cosméticos y la mayoría de los socios se dedican a la construcción de viviendas. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, las socias tienen sus clientes fieles que constantemente  generan el movimiento económico necesario para la subsistencia de sus familias, en caso de que no les vaya bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugar o diversifican su actividad económica de forma que puedan cumplir con las necesidades de sus hijos. El crédito esta destinado a la compra de mercadería en desaguadero y la adquisición de insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor producto y una mejor ganancia para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida de vida.  En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
The group "Las Mariposas" is represented by Mrs. Blanca and consists of 12 members, who are very close friends and partners. These active and enterprising people desire to perform activities to bring them closer together and therefore become more united as a group. The main activity of all of the partners is the sale of products, such as food, dairy products, shampoo, and cosmetics. Additionally, the majority of our partners work in the construction of homes. In regard to the competitive environment, we can mention that although competitors are present in their neighborhood, our partners have faithful clients that constantly generate the necessary economic activity for the subsistence of their families. In the case that things are not going well for them in their neighborhood, they direct themselves to another place or diversify their economic activity in a way that they are able to fulfill their childrens' needs. This credit will be used for the purchase of merchandise in Desaguadero and the acquisition of materials and tools that will help them generate better products and greater earnings in order to provide their families a higher quality of life. As for experience with credit, our partners have received financing from similar institutions, but this is the first time they have worked with an institution that provides them with confidence and economic support, for which they hope to continue growing together with us.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and merchandise

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 38-year-old married woman with five children aged between 9 and 17 years. All of her children go to school. She resides in and owns a five-roomed house where she lives with seven people. She also takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day.

Ruth owns a wooden store selling firewood in Masanafu. She sells to all categories of people, both retail and wholesale. Ruth works seven days a week and receives an average of ten customers a day. Her major business challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing price of firewood. She incurs additional transport costs to and from shopping for her firewood from the villages of Kiboga. She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home.

Ruth has been in this business for over four years and with MCDT for three years. She is servicing her seventh loan working with the same group members. Ruth joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because it was giving loans to poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more firewood.

Ruth is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start selling on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to sell

loans.name: Mosbah

texts.en:
Mosbah has worked as a taxi driver since 1977 servicing the neighboring villages. Thanks to his business income, he was able to raise his four children.

Today, Mosbah is asking for a loan of $600 to repair his car after being in bad circumstances.

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Maria Evangelina

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está ubicado  en la parroquia el Valle al  suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur del país, esta región  es conocida por su mayor  producción de maíz, fréjol, papas, etc., también por los atractivos turísticos como son los sitios arqueológicos de Gullanzhapa y Pedernales, su gente es muy cordial y amable con el turista nacional y extranjero.

La señora  María Evangelina T. es socia del banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, vive en la parroquia el Valle en la comunidad de Poloma; tiene 48 años de edad y está divorciada hace cinco años por problemas en su hogar  y por la falta de  comprensión con su esposo, fruto de su unión conyugal procreó cinco  hijos de 25, 23, 18, 14, 12 años; sus tres primeros hijos ya son casados,  de los cuales la menor vive en su casa y comparten los gastos del hogar,  su penúltimo hijo trabaja en una carpintería y lo poco que gana también aporta para el hogar mientras que su último hijo aún es estudiante de  secundaria, su casa es propia fruto de su esfuerzo y de todos sus hijos.

María trabaja como empleada domestica eventualmente cuando sus vecinas o conocidas le avisan, también se dedica a la crianza de pollos, chanchos, cuyes, pavos y una vaca lechera entregando a sus vecinos de la comunidad la leche obtenida mientras que  sus animales vende en la comunidad o en las ferias.

Este es su segundo ciclo trabajando con  la institución y los créditos obtenidos ha invertido en la compra de sus animales, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue  lo va a invertir en la compra mas animalitos como pollos, cuyes,  así como comida y vitaminas para su crianza y, otra parte de dinero recibido va a invertir en su hogar.

Su sueño es de poder construir una casa para sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
The Heart of Jesus Communal Bank is located in El Valle Parrish, which is southwest of the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. This region is primarily known for its production of corn, beans, potatoes, and other crops. It also has tourist attractions, such as the archeological sites in Gullanzhapa and Pedernales. The people are very friendly and kind to domestic and foreign tourists.

Sra. María Evangelina T. is a member of the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Poloma in El Valle Parrish. She is 48 years old and divorced from her husband 5 years ago because of domestic and marital problems. She has five children ranging in age from 12 to 25. Her first three children are married, with one of them living at home and contributing toward the household expenses. The fourth child works as a carpenter and also helps around the house. The youngest child is a high school student. María’s home is a by-product of her hard work and that of all of her children.

She works as a housekeeper whenever her neighbors and acquaintances are in need of cleaning services. María also raises chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and turkeys to sell within the community or at fairs. In addition, she has a dairy cow that produces milk that she sells to neighbors.

This is her second cycle working with the Institution. Her previous loans were used to purchase her animals. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy more animals such as chickens and guinea pigs, as well as feed and vitamins. Part of the money will be used for some household expenses.

María’s dream is to build a house for her younger children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed, vitamins, and additional animals

loans.name: Luz Coral Group

texts.es: El  banco comunal  “Luz coral” esta representada por la señora Sara Maritza y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican en su mayoría a la venta de mercadería de temporada como CD´s, juegos electrónicos, ropa, trabas, libros y comida al paso ya sea en tiendas, en puestos en los mercados y otros viajan constantemente en ferias ocasionales, principalmente para poder lograr mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtener un márgenes de ganancias mas elevado para sustentas a sus familias. En cuanto al entorno competitivo podemos mencionar que sus competidores si bien están presentes en el barrio, las socias tienen sus clientes fieles que constantemente  generan el movimiento económico necesario para la subsistencia de sus familias, en caso de que no les vaya bien el barrio se dirigen a otro lugar o diversifican su actividad económica de forma que puedan cumplir con las necesidades de sus hijos. El crédito esta destinado a la compra de mercadería, adquisición de insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor producto y una mejor ganancia para poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calida de vida.  En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Luz Coral" is represented by Mrs. Sara Maritza and consists of 12 members, the majority of whom work in the sale of merchandise, such as CD's, electronic games, clothing, books, and food, whether in stores, market stands, or traveling in temporary fairs. Their principal goal is to achieve a greater volume of sales and therefore obtain greater earnings to support their families. In regard in the competitive environment, we can mention that although competition exists in their neighborhood, our partners have faithful clients that consistently generate the necessary economic activity for the subsistence of their families. In the case that things are not going well for them in their neighborhood, they may move to another place or diversify their economic activity in a way that they can fulfill their childrens' needs. This credit will be used for the purchase of merchandise and the acquisition of materials and tools that will help them generate better products and greater earnings to be able to provide their families a higher quality of life. As for experience with credit, our partners have received financing from similar institutions, but this is the first time they have worked with an institution that provides them with confidence and economic support, for which they hope to continue growing together with us.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital and merchandise

loans.name: Mariette

texts.es:
Mariette, tiene una pensión familiar y su esposo trabaja distribuyendo refrescos en la empresa Pepsi tiene tres hijos
Vive en la zona de villa san Antonio Bajo de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de insumos para la pensión y ayudarle en capital de trabajo para la distribución de refrescos)
Es la séptima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Mariette runs a family boarding house. Her husband works for Pepsi as a distributor of soft drinks. The couple has three children. They live in the Villa San Antonio Bajo district of the city of La Paz in the home of Mariette’s parents.

The loan will be used as operating capital to buy supplies for the boarding house. Part of the loan will also be used for her husband’s soft drink distribution business.

This is Mariette’s seventh loan with IMPRO. Her credit history qualifies her with a client rating of “1”, which indicates she has been very good at completing her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her boarding house & beverages for her husband's distribution business

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está ubicado  en la parroquia el Valle al  suroeste de la ciudad de Cuenca en el sur del país, esta región  es conocida por su mayor  producción de maíz, fréjol, papas, etc., también por los atractivos turísticos como son los sitios arqueológicos de Gullanzhapa y Pedernales, su gente es muy cordial y amable con el turista nacional y extranjero.

La señora Luz  María C. es una de las socias activas del  banco comunal Corazón de Jesús, vive en la parroquia el Valle en la comunidad Corazón de Jesús, tiene 56 años de edad, enviudó  hace quince  años ya que su esposo tenia  problemas de alcohol, es madre de cinco hijos de 35, 30, 28, 25, 12 años, sus cuatro hijos mayores ya son casados y tienen su hogar independiente, sólo le acompaña  su último hijo  que aún es estudiante de secundaria en el  colegio Benigno Malo de la localidad, no tiene casa propia vive en una casa prestada por su sobrino.

 Luz nos cuenta que antes trabajaba elaborando estucos pero por problemas en su columna dejo de hacerlo ahora se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y a la crianza de pollos y cuyes tanto para el consumo en casa como para la venta a sus vecinos de la comunidad o en los mercados de la localidad.

Nuestra socia  lleva dos años trabajando con los prestamos que la institución le ha hecho entrega  y éstos ha invertido en la  compra de pollos y cuyes para montar su criadero,  con el préstamo que la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR le entregue va a comprar el alimento y vitaminas para sus pollos y cuyes, así como para cubrir unas necesidades de su hogar

Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia
texts.en:
The Heart of Jesus Communal Bank is located in El Valle Parrish, which is southwest of the city of Cuenca in southern Ecuador. This region is primarily known for its production of corn, beans, potatoes, and other crops. It also has tourist attractions, such as the archeological sites in Gullanzhapa and Pedernales. The people are very friendly and kind to domestic and foreign tourists.

Sra. Luz María C. is a member of the Heart of Jesus Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Corazón de Jesús in El Valle Parrish. She is 56 years old and has been widowed for 15 years as a result of her husband’s alcoholism. Her five children range in age from 12 to 35. The four oldest children are married and have their own families. The youngest child is a student at Benigno Malo High School, but he does not live at home. Instead, he stays at the home of her nephew.

Luz told us that she previously worked preparing stucco but she started developing spinal problems. This forced her to spend her time doing housework and raising chickens and guinea pigs. Some of the animals are reserved for personal consumption, but most of them are sold to neighbors in the community or at the local markets.

Luz has been working with the Institution for two years and used her previous loans to buy chickens and guinea pigs for breeding. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy feed and vitamins for her animals. A portion of the loan will be used to pay for some household expenses. Luz dreams of owning a home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed & vitamins for her animals

loans.name: Stefany

texts.es:
Stefany trabaja como secretaria en una clínica es independiente y la única que solventa sus gastos 
Vive en la zona de miraflores de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión compra edredones y ropa para dar a crédito.
Es segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, las ganas de superarse le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Stefany works as a secretary at a clinic, is independent and responsible for her own expenses. She lives in the Miraflores zone of Cuidad de La Paz, in a rented house. Her loan will go towards investment capital in the purchase of bedspreads and clothing to sell on credit. This is the second time she’s requested a loan from Impro. Her willingness to improve herself has earned the opportunity to obtain this loan

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bedspreads and clothing to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 63 years old and married with 5 children. Her greatest joy is the high season for her business. She is happy because the demands for her tubers of yam will increase and she hopes to make more profits. She sells tubers of yam at retail prices to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting for a loan amount of 70,000 NGN to purchase more tubers of yam to sell. She says "Thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tubers of yams to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a 35-year-old divorcee with two children aged 8 and 16. Both her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she lives with two other people. Juliet takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity, but no piped water, and they get three meals a day. She incurs additional expenses for transportation to and from Kampala City for shopping.

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a ladies' salon in Nakulabye Kiyaye Zone. She sells cosmetics and hair extensions, both at retail and wholesale, and sells to all classes women. Juliet works seven days a week. She receives an average of 20 customers a day. Her major business challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of creams and hair extensions.

Her home serves as her business premises. She has been in this business for over fifteen years and with MCDT for five years. She is servicing her thirteenth loan, working with the same group-mates. Juliet joined MCDT because it was near her home and was giving loans to poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more creams and hair extensions. She is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and start a beauty shop.

loans.use: To buy more creams and hair extensions

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas A. is married and has four children. She has no educational background.  Dorcas sells cooked beans with fried plantains at St. Johns near Shama junction, which she has been doing since 1989. Dorcas uses her income to assist her husband in paying for water, electricity, and other utilities, and in feeding the family.  Dorcas will use the loan to purchase raw beans and plantains to prepare for sale. With any new profits, Dorcas plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase raw beans and plantains to prepare for sale.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 28-year-old engaged man. He has owned a phone shop called "Mahmoud Groupe" since 2007 where he buys and repair phones. Today, Mahmoud is requesting to borrow $1,200 to add new decor and renovate his shop in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: Add new decor and renovate his shop

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, realiza labores de casa, su esposo es jubilado de la Aduana.
Vive en la zona de Villa San Antonio de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa en anticrético.
El crédito será destinado para Salud para pagar el costo de un tratamiento Médico completo que ella necesita.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su necesidad de poder hacer ese tratamiento le dan la oportunidad de obtener este crédito.
texts.en:
Silvia does housework, and her husband is retired from Customs. She lives in the Villa San Antonio region of the city of La Paz in a house in “anticredito” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). The loan is to pay for the cost of the complete medical treatment that she needs. This is the first time she has asked Impro for a loan. Her need to be able to have this treatment gives her the opportunity to get this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of complete medical treatment for her health

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 28-year-old married man with 4 children. He has owned a bakery since 1993 where he services the neighboring villages. Today, Mahmoud is requesting to borrow $800 to add new decor and renovate his bakery in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: add new decor

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo trabaja como albañil en construcción y reparación de casas y la esposa es comerciante de pantalones para varones; así complementan sus fuentes de ingreso con las que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que dependen de la pareja. Tiene su casa propia ubicada en la  Zona de Chamoco Chico de la Ciudad de La Paz.
 
El crédito lo destinará para la compra de Material de construcción para refaccionar su vivienda que tiene deterioros y poder ofrecer mejor calidad al hábitat a sus hijos.

Es el quinto crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Pablo.
texts.en:
Pablo works as a bricklayer in building and repairing houses. His wife sells men’s pants. Together these sources of income cover the support of their three dependent children. He has his own house in the Chamoco Chico region of the city of La Paz. The loan is to buy construction material to refurbish his house, which has damage. This way he will be able to give his children a better quality home. This is his fifth loan with IMPRO. The completed evaluation qualifies Pablo for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction material to refurbish his house

loans.name: Sabadell Group

texts.es: El grupo “Sabadell” esta representado por la señora Felicidad y conformada por 14 socias que se con conocen desD. hace tiempo por que viven en la misma zona y saben como trabajar en equipo. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la comercialización D. productos como edredones, sabanas, ropa, madera, pollos, cosméticos, recipientes desechables, atención en fotocopiadora, transporte público D. pasajeros  y a la fabricación D. muebles D. madera. La competencia que les rodea es alta pero gracias a su experiencia y a sus ganas D. salir adelante luchan para sacar a flote sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del financiamiento pes para la adquisición D. mercadería, herramientas para sus carpinterías, para cortar madera, también para repuesto D. sus vehículos. En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
The "Sabadell" group is maD. up of 14 members from the same neighborhood who have known each other for a long time and know how to work in a group. They are represented by Felicidad. The majority of the members sell products like comforters, sheets, clothing, lumber, chickens, cosmetics, disposable containers, run a photo copying service, public transportation of passengers, and the manufacture of wood furniture. They are surrounded by a high degree of competition but, thanks to their experience and willingness to get ahead, they make the effort to have their businesses succeed since this is what produces support for their families. The financing will be used to purchase merchandise, carpentry tools to saw lumber, and replacement parts for their vehicles. They have credit management experience since they have had financing from similar institutions but this is the first time they wave worked with an institution that offers them trust and economic support. For this reason they wish to continue to grow with us.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary E. sells baked bread at Essuman near Shama Junction. Mary has received a senior high school education. She is married and has four children. Mary has been selling baked bread since 2000. She asists her husband in the paying of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more flour and other baking ingredients to improve and increase her baking business. She hopes to save the new profits to invest in her business.

loans.use: Buy more flour and other baking ingredients to improve and increase her baking business.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal is a single woman living with her parents. She works as a private teacher since 1989 to provide, along with her sister, better living conditions for the family. Today, Nawal is requesting a loan of $900 to purchase an encyclopedia for her work.

loans.use: Purchase an encyclopedia

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela de ocupación Rentista y comerciante de golosinas vive en casa propia la misma que esta en construcción, ubicada en la zona Huayna Potosí de la Ciudad de El Alto, es viuda y tiene 5 hijos.

El crédito lo destinará en la compra de materiales de construcción para las habitaciones que esta construyendo en su domicilio así tener mejor comodidad para ella y sus hijos.
 
Es el tercer crédito con IMPRO, los anteriores créditos fueron cancelados puntualmente, la evaluación realizada  califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Carmela.
texts.en:
Carmela is a landlord and she sells sweets. She lives in her own house, which is under construction. It is located in the Huayna Potosí region of the city of El Alto. She is a widow, and she has five children. This loan will be used to buy construction material for the rooms that she is building in her home. That way she and her children will be more comfortable. This is her third loan from Impro. Her previous loans were paid back punctually. The completed evaluation allows her to be approved for this loan that she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials like sand, cement, stones, and bricks for the rooms she wishes to build

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 44-year-old married man with 4 children. He has owned an oil changing shop since 2006. He has a great demand for his services and thus he wants to borrow $1,000 to buy more oil and renovate his shop in order to serve his clients.

loans.use: Buy more oils and renovate his shop

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia M. is divorced and has three children. She has received a junior high school education. Cecilia sells clothing, cosmetics and bread near Shama Junction as a hawker, which she has been doing since 1999. Cecilia uses her income to pay school fees and utility bills.  Cecilia will use the loan to buy clothing and cosmetics to improve her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: Buy clothing and cosmetics to improve her business.

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en:
Flavia is a 23-year-old married woman with two children, aged 3 and 10. Both her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she lives with four people. Flavia takes care of additional family members.The family has access to electricity, but no piped water, and they get three meals a day. She incurs additional transportation expenses to and from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda.

She works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a stall selling passion fruits in Nakulabye Kiyaye Zone. She sells both at retail and wholesale. Flavia works seven days a week. She has an average of 20 customers a day. Her major business challenges include defaulters and the ever-increasing price of passion fruits. Flavia’s monthly rent for home and work place is about 40,000 UGX. She has been in this business for over nine years and with MCDT for two years, servicing her fourth loan working with the same group-mates. Flavia joined MCDT because it was near her home and was giving loans to poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of passion fruits. She is aspires to see her business grow bigger and start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of passion fruits

loans.name: Los Pulpitos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Pulpitos” Esta representada por la señora Pastora y conformado por 12 miembros que residen en el mismo barrió y se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo teniendo amplia confianza en cada uno de sus miembros. La mayoría de las socias tiene su propio negocio como por ejemplo su presidenta se dedica a la recolección de chatarra para reciclarla y volverla a vender, el resto de las socias se dedican a la venta de zapatos, comida, rellenos, verduras, ropa de bebe y al transporte. La existencia de la competencia en el mercado es grande pero depende de cada una como salir adelante ya que de los ingresos diarios subsiste su familia. El destino del financiamiento es para incrementar su capital de trabajo con la adquisición de mercaderías, insumos y herramientas para incrementar sus ventas y generar un mejor ingreso para brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, así como un futuro más prometedor para sus hijos que son su razón de vivir. En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
The "Los Pulpitos" (Little Octopi) group is made up of 12 members from the same neighborhood who have known each other for a long time and have complete confidence in each other; they are represented by Pastora. Most of the members have their own businesses. For example, the group president salvages junk to recyle and resell. The rest of the members sell shoes, food, turnovers, vegetables, baby clothes, and provide transportation. There is a lot of competition in the marketplace but it is up to each one to find a way to get ahead since these daily funds are what provide for their families' survival. The funds will be used to increase working capital to buy merchandise, raw materials, and tools to increase sales and generate increased profits to provide their families with a better quality of life as well as a more promising future for their children, who are their reason to live.
