As far as their competence with regard to credit, the members have it thanks to loans they have managed from similar instittions although this is the first time they have worked with an institution that offers them trust and economic support; for this reason they wish to continue growing with us.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mansour

texts.en: Mansour is a 27-year-old married man with one child. He has been working as a carpenter since 2001 to earn income to satisfy his family's needs. Today, Mansour is requesting to borrow US$ 1,000 to purchase additional wood to satisfy the heavy demand of his clients.

loans.use: purchase additional wood

loans.name: Jahuer

texts.es:
El Sr. Jahuer Tiene 22 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Lizeth Zurita desde hace 2 años, juntos tienen una niña de 2 años que acude a la guarderia. Viven todavia en la casa de la madre de Lizeth.

El Sr. Jahuer trabaja como taxista, es propietario de un auto con el cual trabaja por toda la ciudad de Cochabamba, su esposa vende Carbon ecologico en una zona comercial llamada "la cancha". Juntos generan ingresos para poder sustentar a la familia.

El Sr. Jahuer necesita dinero para poder comprar un lote de terreno y asi poder independizarse y construir su casa propia. Para mjorar la calidad de vida para su hija y esposa. En el futuro quiere solicitar otro credito para poder terminar de construir su casa y seguir progresando y mejorando las condiciones de vida para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Jahuer is 22, and he has been married to Lizeth Zurita for two years. They have a two year old daughter who goes to nursery school. They still live in Lizeth’s mother’s house. Jahuer is a taxi driver. He has his own car, which he uses to work all over the city of Cochabamba. His wife sells ecological coal in La Cancha, a commercial area. Together they generate enough income to be able to support their family. Jahuer needs money to be able to buy a plot of land. That way he would be able to become independent and build his own house. This would improve the quality of life for his daughter and his wife. In the future, he wants to ask for another loan to be able to finish building his house, to keep progressing, and keep improving life conditions for all of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 28-year-old single man.  He has owned a cattle farm since 2007.  He produces milk and he provides it to his customers upon request. He is asking to borrow US$ 1,200 to prepare a suitable place for his cattle before the winter season.

loans.use: prepare a suitable place for his cattle

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet A. is married and has three children. She has no educational background.  Janet sells groceries such as biscuits, toffees, canned tomatoes, and so on opposite Shama Junction, which she has been doing since 2002. Janet uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Janet will use the loan to purchase more groceries for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Janet plans to save to invest into her business.

loans.use: purchase more groceries for sale

loans.name: Church Of God Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of one of the primary schools in Sierra Leone. Their school was built by missionaries in 1954, one of the oldest in the area. The school has a total of twenty staff members and 800 pupils.

Teachers are among the lowest paid workers in Sierra Leone. Because of this, many of them find alternative means of making a living. Some engage in business and agriculture while others organize extra classes for the pupils (a practice the government is trying to abolish). These teachers are seeking a loan in order to embark on meaningful projects. Then out of their monthly salaries, they gradually repay the loan.

This group of teacher are seeking a loan from SMT for the second time and for the first time from Kiva lenders. (Charles S. K. was not able to be present for the original photo, but an individual shot has been added in the corner of the frame).

Thomas is head teacher at the school and the leader of the group. He is forty-eight years old. Thomas is married and has 5 children, all of whom are currently attending school. With the help of this loan, he will be able to continue paying the school fees for all of his children, as will many other teachers.

loans.use: School Fees for children

loans.name: Bdec Home Economics Group

texts.en:
These women are staff members of the Primary School in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone. The school was opened to offer supplementary education in and around Makeni. The school is staffed with twelve teachers, all of whom are females. (One teacher who was unable to make the original photo has been added in the lower left corner.)

They teach older pupils who are already in classes five and six from all schools in Makeni and beyond. Each school in town will bring their pupils this school on a fixed day of the week for lessons. Among the subjects they teach are: home management; child care; Family and Life Education (F.L.E.); agriculture; clothing and textiles; food and nutrition, and so on. 

This is the second loan this school is borrowing from SMT (Kiva). With this loan, they will be able to do something meaningful. Gradually, they will repay it out of their meager monthly salaries. Teachers are among the lowest paid workers in Sierra Leone, and with such small salaries, they cannot do or buy anything great. With a loan, some of them can buy pieces of furniture;  some will pay either their children’s school fees or pay for themselves to pursue further studies; others will use theirs to either start building a house or complete the building process; and others will use theirs in business to supplement their monthly salaries. 

Hellen (second from right) is the head teacher at the school. She is forty-nine years of age, married with three children. Helen will use her loan to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: Various items for different women, school fees for leader

loans.name: Amigas Por Siempre Group

texts.es: El grupo “Amigas por Siempre” esta representado por el señora Tito y conformado por 12 miembros que van ingresando a un cuarto ciclo demostrando honestidad, gamas D. trabajar y mucho entusiasmo por salir adelante, muchos D. los que empezaron el grupo ya no están ya que a medida que pasan los ciclos se van seleccionando y quedan las más responsables, socias que ven la forma D. mejorar sus condiciones D. vida con el desarrollo D. la actividad que realizan, actividades que hoy por hoy se ven con mucha competencia, por lo que se ven en la necesidad D. realizar viajes al interior del país con su mercadería, como edredones, maletas, cosméticos y variedad D. perfumes, ropa, carne, pesticidas, chompas tejidas a mano, zapatillas deportivas y ropa en genera para tener mayor venta, lo que implica tener mayor capital D. trabajo, por ello las socias muestran mucho interés D. seguir trabajando con la institución, todo ello reconociendo que tras el tiempo transcurrido D. trabajo con nuestra institución la condición económica D. sus hogares va mejorando.
texts.en:
The “Amigas por Siempre” (Friends Forever) group is maD. up of 12 members, represented by Tito, who are in their fourth lending cycle having demonstrated honesty, willingness to work, and much enthusiasm to get ahead. Many of the original members of the group are no longer part of it since, as the cycles unfold, some are selected out and only the most responsible members remain; members who see the way to improve their lives through the activities they undertake. Presently, these activities face heavy competition which necesitates trips to the interior of the country with their merchandise such as comforters, luggage, cosmetics, a variety of perfumes, clothing, meat, pesticides, hand-knitted sweaters, athletic shoes, and clothing in general, to increase sales. This requires more working capital so the members are very interested in continuing to work with the institution since they believe that working with our institution over time leads to an improving economic condition at home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en:
Charlotte is a thirty-six-year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town but the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities.

Charlotte is a trader and trades in foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, etc. She buys the goods from nearby communities and supplies to food vendors in her community. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Marème

texts.fr: MAREME S. est une femme de 55 ans elle est mariée et a 6 enfants en charge dont les deux fréquentent l'école. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de ESCALE depuis 7 ans, elle a capitalisé une très bonne expérience par rapport à son activité pour l'avoir exercée pendant plus de 5 ans. Elle développe une activité de vente de produits de beauté et des tissus teintés. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie et de santé de la famille et à assurer aussi la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mareme S. is a 55 year old woman, married, and responsible for six children, two of whom attend school. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of the city of Escale for the past seven years. She has been selling beauty products and dyed textiles for the past five years, and has gained good experience in this activity. Profits from the sales allows her to improve the living conditions and health of her family and ensure that her children are able to receive an education.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her cash-flow operations

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 56-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, a majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as their major occupation alongside other trading activities. Sarah is a trader. She trades in cereals, and her primary good is maize. She buys the goods from nearby communities. Sarah treks to procure her supply and sells it at the local market. She has been in the business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is a 62-year-old married mother of four children, some of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, a majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as their major occupation alongside other trading activities. Augustina is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called banku, which is cooked corn dough. She sells by the side of the road in the mornings. Augustina buys her goods from nearby communities. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida is 52 years old. She is widowed and has four children. All of her children are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Vida is a trader. She trades in pastries. She fries the pastries by the side of the road in her community and sells them to retailers. Vida has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. operates a provisions store at Elmina near Ankwanda.  Victoria has received junior high education.  She is single and has four children. Victoria has been selling provisions such as Milo (cocoa drink powder), sugar,  toothbrushes, and so on since 2007.  Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: buy more provisions to sell

loans.name: Good Shepherd Group

texts.en:
Florence is forty-eight years old. She is widowed and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Florence is a petty trader. She sells printed textile goods. Florence is the leader of a trust bank group called 'Good Shepherd'. Most of the group members are either into sales or farming activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Florence, the group leader, is seated in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to one son who is currently in school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Lucy is a baker. She bakes bread for sale. She hawks her bread and also supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Lucy has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other baking ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour. etc.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 38 years old, married and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town caled Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial center, and most residents are farmers as well as traders. Dorcas makes her living selling cereals, particularly maize. She buys her goods from nearby communities and carries her supplies to Kade, where she sells in the local market to community food vendors. Dorcas has been in business for 10 years and would like a loan to buy goods in bulk so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to sell to her customers

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is 38 years old, married and has four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial center where most people make a living as traders and farmers. Augustina supports herself and her family by selling charcoal. She buys her supplies of charcoal in nearby communities and sells it in the local market to food vendors and retailers. She has been in business for over 20 years and wants a loan to buy charcoal in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca O. is married and has four children. She graduated from junior high school, and since 2005 has earned a living selling food and other provisions in the town of Elmina. Her husband is a fisherman. Rebecca uses her income to help pay her family's school fees and utility bills. She plans to use this loan to buy more provisions to sell, and will use the additional income she earns to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is the 37-year old divorced mother of four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town, and most residents earn a living by farming and trading. Mary makes a living selling cereals such as maize and other food items, including yams. She buys her goods in nearby communities and carries them to Kade's local market, where she sells them to food vendors in her community. Mary has been in business for 10 years and has applied for a loan to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to increase her income and expand her small business.

loans.use: To buy cereals and other items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 35 years old, married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming and commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Rose makes a living selling textiles and footwear. She sells her goods while traveling around town, or in the local market square. Rose has been in business for seven years and has applied for this loan to expand her business by buying goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy textiles to sell to her customers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 46 years old. She is married and has three children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Florence works hard to support her husband and to provide for their family. She is a trader. She trades in printed textiles. Florence buys the textile goods from nearby towns and she sells in a shop by the roadside in her community. She also treks to sell.

Florence has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 47 years old. She is married and has given birth to six children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the eastern region of Ghana.

Mercy is a trader. She runs a provision store by the roadside in her community.

Mercy has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock.

Mercy desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old. She is married and the mother of seven children. Five of her children are currently in school while the other two are working. She works hard to support her husband in taking care of the home.

Mary is a local supplier of palm fruits and palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm fruits. The palm fruit is processed through various stages to obtain palm oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish and pastries, as well as soaps.

She supplies palm oil to food vendors for them to prepare their meals. She also sells the palm fruits to those who need them for further processing. However, her production is on the lower side as a result of too little working capital to buy stock in bulk.

Mary wants to use her loan to buy more bags of palm fruits. She believes the loan will enable her to save more toward her children’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy palm oil and palm fruits in bulk.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa is a 42 year old married mother of 6 children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the eastern region of Ghana.

Kade is a commercial town. However, a majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation alongside other trading activities.

Adwoa is a food vendor. She prepares and sells a local dish called kenkey. It is served hot with pepper and fried fish. She sells by the roadside in the day time. Adwoa buys the goods from nearby communities.

She has been in business for 12 years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old. She is not married and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the eastern region of Ghana.

Mary works hard to provide for herself. She is a seamstress by profession. She buys fabrics from nearby towns and designs and sews dresses for female clients.

She works in a shop by the roadside in her community. According to Mary she has two apprentices.

She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy fabrics and other sewing accessories to improve the quality of her services.

loans.use: To buy fabrics.

loans.name: Jesus Lives Group

texts.en:
Eric is a 34-year-old married father of two children who are currently in school. Eric is a petty trader who sells foodstuffs like spices, vegetables, canned tomato paste, cocoa drink, etc. He gets his supplies from Accra and his vegetables from surrounding villages. He requests a loan to buy stock in bulk. He dreams of building his own house and to educate his children to the university level.

He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Jesus Lives’. He is the one in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs like spices, vegetables, canned tomato paste, cocoa drink, etc.

loans.name: St. Thomas Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Beatrice is a trader of printed textiles. She is the leader of a trust bank group called St. Thomas. Most of the group members are either into trading and or farming activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Beatrice, the group leader, is seated in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Awudu

texts.en: Awudu is married and the father of two children, who are currently in senior and junior high school respectively. He is 49 years old and lives with his family in a community in the eastern region of Ghana. He is a supplier of cola nuts, which are mostly used by the Moslems. They are used as a dowry in their marriages and are also used to welcome visitors to the home. They a good taste and its can be chewed at all times. There are two types of cola nuts in Ghana; we have the red (hard) and the white (soft) nuts. He takes delivery of stock from the surrounding villages and sometimes treks to the northern part of Ghana to buy them in bulk. He requests the loan to buy more stock as we approach the Christmas festivities.

loans.use: To buy cola nuts in bulk.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: Ernest is married and the father of three children. By God’s grace all his children attend school in the community where he lives. He works hard to support his wife in taking care of the home. He is a supplier of local palm nuts fruits. Palm nuts fruits are used to produce palm oil. The palm fruit is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil which is used to prepare many local dishes like fried fish, local soaps and pastries. He purchases the palm fruits directly from the farmers and supplies it to companies, individuals and food vendors to prepare their meals. However, his production is on the lower side as a result of low working capital to buy stock in bulk. He wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm fruits. He believes the loan will enable him to save more toward his children's education. He would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of palm oil and palm nuts fruits.

loans.name: Gaye Cissé

texts.fr: Gaye Cissé est une femme de 62 ans elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE SUD" depuis un an et demi et y a reçu 3 prêts qu'elle a remboursés sans aucune difficulté. Elle développe un petit commerce de tissu, savon, huile de palme et ballais fabriqués à partir des feuilles de palmiers. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gaye Cissé D. is a 62-year-old married woman with five children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois of "South Mountain" for a year and a half, and has received and reimbursed three previous loans without problem. She has a small business selling fabrics, soaps, palm oil and brooms which she makes from palm fronds. The proceeds of this loan will help her contribute to the financial support of her family.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: generate revenues from sale of fabric, soap, oil & hand-made brooms

loans.name: St. Patrick Group

texts.en: Patrick is fifty-three years old. He is married and has five children. All of his children are in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Patrick is a professional photographer. He is the leader of a trust bank group called St. Patrick. Most of the group members are either into trading and or farming activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Patrick, the group leader, is in the middle of the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is a businessman who trades in Dumas clothes (a brand name), linen and lace materials. He mostly sells through hawking – a personal-selling method. This, he said, makes his goods moves very fast.

Abdul is 30 years old, married, and the father of four children who are in school. He is very supportive of his family through the proceeds from his trading business.

Abdul takes delivery of goods from Accra and Togo which, he said, helps him to buy more at a reduced price. He has been in business for the last nine years. He hopes the loan will enable him to revive his business and make a more viable profit. He wants to purchase clothing materials in bulk to increase his inventory. He would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase Dumas clothes in bulk to increase his inventory

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.en:
Enyonam is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Enyonam is a baker and bakes bread for sale. She sells in the local market and also supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Enyonam has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other baking ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta is fifty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Roberta is a trader and runs a provision store by the roadside in her community. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock.

Roberta desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is forty-four years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Ama is a trader and runs a boutique shop on the street in her community. She sells clothes and shoes for both ladies and gents. She has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy ready-made clothes in bulk to increase her stock.

Ama desires to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy ready-made clothes to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 34 years old and is married with three children. Currently all her children are still schooling. Her husband has been very supportive in taking care of the children.

Stella works very hard and approaches her business with commitment. She has been a food vendor for seven years now. She prepares and serves her customers with gari (roasted cassava) and beans. Gari and cooked beans is a local food enjoyed by many Ghanaians for lunch.

Stella obtains her raw materials from the farming communities to prepare her meals. She wants to use the loan to buy gari, beans, vegetables, etc., in bulk to meet the daily demands of her customers. She hopes to use part of her profits to pay her children’s educational fees.

loans.use: To buy gari, beans, vegetables, etc., in bulk

loans.name: The Lord Group

texts.en:
Faustina is the group leader of a trust bank group called The Lord. She is seated in the photograph.

Faustina is 30 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade.

Kade is a farming and commercial town in the eastern region of Ghana. Most of the group members are either into trading and/or farming activities.

Faustina is a trader. She trades in utensils.

The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best educations they can afford.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar, soap and potatoes in bulk

loans.name: St. Theresa Group

texts.en: Ernestina is 38 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Ernestina is a trader. She runs a provision store. She is the leader of a trust bank group called St. Theresa. Most of the group members are either into trading and or farming activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Ernestina, the group leader is seated in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou D., 36 ans, mariée,05 enfants en charge est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE SUD" depuis un an et demi. Avec son crédit elle va renforcer sa cantine en marchandises, elle vend du tissu. Ses bénéfices lui permettront de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Fatou D. 36 years old, she is married and has 5 children in her care. She has been a member of the "Montagne Sud" Community Bank for the past year and a half. With this loan she plants to purchase merchandise to restock her store; she sells fabrics. The revenues will help her improve the living conditions of her family.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nyame Mmere Group

texts.en: Thomas is 30 years old. He is married and has two children. Both of his children are in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Thomas is a trader. He runs a provision store. He is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Nyame Mmere’, literally meaning God’s time. Most of the group members are either into trading and or farming activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Thomas, the group leader, stands at the back in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase rice, salt, maize flour and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more vitenge and kanga in bulk

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora is a 50-year-old married mother of seven children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town. However, the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation along side other trading activities. Dora is a trader. She trades in cereals (maize) and other food stuffs. She buys the goods from nearby communities and treks to sell. She also sells at the local market to food vendors in her community. Dora has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Méry

texts.fr: Méry W. est une femme de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Son crédit lui permet d'acheter et revendre des tissus teintés, des chaussures, des effets de toilette, des sacs à main pour dames et des bijoux. Elle participe au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mery W. is a 47-year old woman, she is married and she is the mother of 7 children. Her loan will allow her to purchase, and later resale printed fabrics, footware, bathroom supplies, ladies' handbags and jewelry. She contributes to her children's tuition expenses.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 40 years old. She is married and has three children. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Florence is a trader. She trades in printed textiles and other textile materials. She hawks to sell in her community and treks as well. Florence buys the fabrics from nearby towns. She has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to buy fabrics and other materials in bulk.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Molleccato Group

texts.en:
The members of our group, Molleccato, are clients of Asociación Arariwa.  This communal bank consists of 11 members in Urcos, (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Urcos)  a town about 1 hour from Cusco.  There are 9 women and 2 men. All the group members live in Urcos and surrounding towns.  Some are married with kids while others are single.  The members speak Quechua, a local language.

The president of the group is Augusta.  She was born in Urcos and is 48 years old.  She now lives in Andahuayllas.  She is a widow and has 6 children who live independently.  She sells dry goods such as corn and chicha (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicha) and has been doing so for the past 25 years.  She will use this loan to buy more corn to sell and to make chicha.

The other members of Molleccato are involved in various commercial activities.  Some sell goods in the local market.  One of the women has been selling corn from her house for many years and will buy more corn to sell.  Another woman raises and sells “lechon”, a young pig (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suckling_pig), and will invest in more livestock.

All of the members of Molleccato appreciate and thank you for the loan and promise to pay the monthly payments on time.

(One other Arariwa client is pictured in the photo.  She is not part of the group.)

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Tegemea A.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 27-year-old Tegemea M. from Mbeya. She is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 11. Tegemea has been running a Vitenge business since 2008. She has established a store that sells traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women, called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people. She works at her business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by her husband. Tegemea currently earns about 350USD from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vitenge in bulk. In the future, she plans to open the same business at another location. Tegemea thanks you for your support!


SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more vitenge in bulk

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya S. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est mariée et a 4 enfants en charge. Son crédit lui permet de développer un petit élevage de poulets de chaire. Elle achète des poussins, les élève jusqu'à l'âge adulte et les vend sur pied. Les bénéfices réalisés à partir de son élevage lui offrent la possibilité de participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Rokhaya S. is a 53-year old woman, she is married and she has 4 children in her care. This loan will be invested in her small chicken coop. She purchases chicks, she raises them until they reach a certain age, and then she sells them by travelling door to door. The revenues realized from her farm will allow her to contribute towards her family's support.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her small chicken coop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To open a new general store

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy S. est une femme de 60 ans, elle mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. Avec son crédit elle fait de l'embouche ovine, elle achète des moutons les engraisses et les revend. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge.
texts.en:
Amy S. is a 60-year old woman, she is married and she has 5 children in her care. With this loan she will invest in raising livestock. She purchases goats and fattens them for later resale. This business supplies her with an income that permit her to contribute towards their needs.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase items for her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more vitenge in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata N. est une femme de 29 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" depuis un an et demi. Elle a une performance remarquable en matière d'épargne. Son crédit lui permet de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises, elle vend divers produits alimentaires tels que du lait en poudre, du nescafé, des jus de fruits des sucettes, des produits ménagers etc.Elle participe beaucoup aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Aminata N. is a 29-year old woman, she is married and she is the mother of 2 children. She has been a member of the Community Bank "Montagne Nord" for the past year and a half. She has shown a remarkable record in her savings. Her loan will permit her to restock her business with merchandise, selling food products such as powdered milk, instant coffee, fruit juices, household products etc. She contributes significantly towards her family's care.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Ndiémé

texts.fr: Ndiémé D. est une femme de 52 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Depuis un an et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" et y a reçu 3 prêts qu'elle a remboursés sans difficulté. Elle est vendeuse de tissu et de vêtement pour et hommes et dames. Elle soutien son mari pour la prise en charge de leur famille à partir des bénéfices qu'elle obtient de son commerce.
texts.en:
Ndiémé D. is a 52-year-old woman who is married and the mother of seven children. For 1½ years, she has been a member Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" and has received three loans from it that she repaid without difficulty. She is a seller of fabrics and clothing for men and women. She supports her husband in meeting family expenses by the profits she obtains from her commerce.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To advance her commercial work

loans.name: Mainka

texts.en:
Mainka is 22 years old and married with a two-year-old son. He has a shop in Kitengela, a small town near Nairobi. He sells unga (flour), milk, fat, and oil. He has had his business for three years and employs two people. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to expand and restock his shop.

He describes himself as hardworking, innovative, and self-driven. He hopes to become a wholesale supplier in the future and have a full supermarket.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en: Teresiah is a business lady who is married with two children. She runs a school in Kajiado, a busy market town near Nairobi. She has run the school for five years and has three employees. She previously had a retail shop. Her loan is for 50,000 KES, and she will use the funds from this loan to develop the school. In the future, she hopes to become a leading teacher and mentor, transforming the lives of many.

loans.use: To develop the school

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Aminata S. est une femme de 37 ans, elle est marié et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" dans lequel elle s'est bien comportée, depuis un an et demi. Avec son crédit elle a monté un mini restaurant où elle vend le petit déjeuné et des œufs bouillis. cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
Aminata S. is a 37-year-old woman who is married and the mother of one child. For 1½ years, she has been a member Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" in which she has a good performance record. With her loan, she has established a mini-restaurant, where she sells breakfast and boiled eggs. This business brings in profits allowing her to help meet family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her ability to self-finance

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 63 years old and married. She runs a small eating place in Kajiado, a small town near Nairobi. She prepares and sells chapati, tea, and mandazi (a Kenyan doughnut). She has been in business for ten years and successfully completed a previous loan through Faulu for 20,000 KES. This loan is for 20,000 KES, and she will use the funds to expand her eating place and add stock.

Grace describes herself as hardworking, innovative, and self-driven. Her goal is to have the best hotel in town.

loans.use: To expand eating place & add stock

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is 41 years old and married with three children, one of whom is attending school.

She has a business selling a wide variety of fruits and vegetables in a market place in Kajiado, a small town near Nairobi. She has been in business for 15 years and says that her husband helps her when he is not working as a machine operator.

Rael successfully repaid a previous loan for 20000 KES. Her current loan is for 30000 KES and she will use the funds to expand her grocery business.

In the future Rael hopes to buy her own plot of land, build a rental property, start another business, and support her children in their education to a high level. She says that through loans from Faulu and her business they can together bring out the meaning of development.

loans.use: Expand business.

loans.name: Boye Guèye

texts.fr: Boye Guèye N. a 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" depuis un an et demi. Elle a sollicité ce prêt pour le renforcement de son activité de couture. Elle est détentrice d'une machine à coudre, soit elle fait la confection des vêtements sur mesure en fonction des commande qu'elle reçoit, soit elle coud des habits avec des tailles différentes et les vends en prêt à porter. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Boye Guèye N. is 49 years old, married, and the mother of one child. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "MONTAGNE NORD" for 1½ years. She’s requesting this loan to bolster her sewing business. She possesses a sewing machine, whether to make custom clothing by the special orders she receives or to sew outfits of different sizes to sell as ready-to-wear. She supports her husband in meeting family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her sewing business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter N. is 31 years old and married with a young daughter named Mary.

He runs a transport business and employs two people. He’s run his business for five years and also earns income from a green grocer that he operates with his wife.

Peter is requesting a loan for 20000 KES to purchase two tyres (at 4500 KES) and one windscreen (4000 KES), and to repair his car seats (7000 KES).

Peter describes himself as hardworking and determined to improve his standard of living. He would like to own more matatus (vans) for transport and also expand his grocery by the end of 2010.

loans.use: To repair vehicle.

loans.name: Pia Ilaria

texts.en:
Ms. Pia Ilaria C. C. spends 4 hours every day making bolos in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil, Ecuador. A "bolo" is like a Popsicle, but rather than on a stick, the frozen product comes inside a plastic tube.

Ms. C. makes 6 different bolo flavors: coconut, milk, chocolate, gum, tamarindo,and mulberry. She sells each bolo for 5 cents. Fortunately, there are many schools, churches and parks nearby, so she averages 200 clients daily. The treats are a favorite after-school snack for most of the neighborhood children!

Ms. C. is widow and a mother of three (one son still lives with her). She moved to Paraiso with few possessions after her home in Bastion (another town in Guayaquil) burned down.

Recently a thief broke in to Ms.C.' home/business and robbed her. Therefore, she is requesting a loan for bricks in order to secure her livelihood.

In the future Ms. C. would like to buy a mobile freezer in order to keep her bolos cold for street sales and during rolling blackouts.

loans.use: To buy bricks to secure her business.

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr: Yacine N. est une femme de 44 ans elle est veuve et vit avec ses 8 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de "ARTILLERIE" depuis 2 ans. Son crédit lui permet mener de petites activité commerciales, elle vend des céréales, des tissus et fait de l'embouche ovine. c'est avec les bénéfices générés par ses activités qu'elle entretien ses enfants et subvient à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Yacine N. is a 44-year-old woman. She is a widow and lives with her eight children whom she supports. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de "ARTILLERIE" for two years. Her loan allows her to run small commercial businesses. Yacine sells grains and cloth, and she fattens sheep. With the profits earned from her businesses, she takes care of her children and supports herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small-scale commerce

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en: Nurlan M. is a young entrepreneur of 19 years who is responsible for looking after his elderly parents.  Nurlan began working at 17, assisting his father with his father's shop.  Now Nurlan is responsible for the whole shop.  His working day starts at 8 a.m. and finishes at 10 p.m.  He sells cell phone accessories in the center of Lankaran, a city in the southern part of Azerbaijan.  Nurlan has requested a 1606 AZN loan so he can increase the number of items he sells and also purchase cell phones for resale, as they are in very high demand by the local population.

loans.use: To purchase additional cell phone accessories and cell phones for resale

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en: Parviz E., 25 years old, is a very enthusiastic man who sells electrical goods in a store he has rented for the last 8 years. His family's difficult economic situation pushed Parviz to start working at a very early age. After finishing school, Parviz started selling different kinds of goods and after doing some market research, he decided to sell electrical goods as they are in very high demand among the local people. Parviz's dream is to build his own store one day and get married. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 1,606 Azerbaijani manats to purchase vacuum cleaners and increase his stock of other items. Let's do our best to help this hardworking young man.

loans.use: Purchase vacuum cleaners and other electrical goods

loans.name: Jessica Alexandra

texts.en:
Jessica Alexandra C. R. is 22 years old and lives in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil. Paraiso is a peri-urban, marginalized zone without paved roads, water pipes, or a sewer system.

Ms C. is married with two sons, one is 6 years old and the other is 8 months. She has a mobile nail salon; her services include manicures and pedicures at $3 each.

Over the last 3 years, she has built a a base of approximately 30 clients throughout Guayaquil. Clients visit Ms. C. at her cane home or she visits client's homes by appointment.

Ms. C. is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for her nail services such as nail polish (~$7 each), brushes, and cotton pads.

In the future, Ms. C. dreams of opening her own nail shop. She is grateful for any support we can provide her business so that her family may prosper!

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Malik-Ajdar

texts.en:
Malik-Ajdar Q. is married and has 2 children. He runs a small grocery business. Malik-Ajdar has been in this business for over 14 years. He is a high achiever and a consistent entrepreneur who is very knowledgeable about the market environment. His professional skills and perseverance have helped to ensure rapid growth and success of his business.

Malik-Ajdar is requesting a loan of 1606 AZN to increase the assortment of his inventory. He is hoping that this loan will help his venture grow and generate extra profits. His dream is to save more money and build his own store one day.

loans.use: To purchase more items for his grocery

loans.name: Muruvvat

texts.en:
Muruvvat E. is 55 years old and married with 2 children. He opened his grocery 20 years ago. Muruvvat provides his neighbors and occasional clients with products like bread, rice, sugar, meat, milk, and other items. His wife actively helps Muruvvat run his business. Muruvvat is also working as a tea-room worker and in the evenings his wife works instead of him. With the help of his wife he has been able to move forward with the business.

Muruvvat wants this loan to purchase more merchandise, such as tinned products, sweets, drinks, etc. He and his family appreciate your support in helping him improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Awa Maguette

texts.fr: Awa Maguette D. a 52 ans, elle est mariée et a 6 enfants en charge. elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO depuis 7 ans et demi. Avec son crédit elle a pu développer une activité de vente de banane. Elle achète des régimes de bananes pour revendre au détail en faisant du porte à porte. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Awa Maguette D. is 52 years old. She is married and has six children to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO for 7½ years. With her loan, Awa was able to develop a business selling bananas. She buys bunches of bananas for door-to-door retail sale. She is helping to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her commercial work

loans.name: Elmaddin

texts.en: Elmaddin S. is a 27-year-old young entrepreneur who has been selling different kinds of food products in the grocery store for the last eight years. He is married and has two children. Elmaddin lives in one house with his parents and supports them financially. Being in this business for a long time, Elmaddin learned the market and his customers and he knows very well how to attract people to his store. Good location, friendly smile and accuracy on the shelves are the keys to a successful business.  Now Elmaddin requests 1606 AZN to enlarge his business and purchase more merchandise. We believe clear vision, experience and deep knowledge of the market will help Elmaddin to succeed in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es: El grupo “25 D. Julio” esta representado por la señora Albina y conformado por 13 miembros D. las cuales una gran mayoría se dedican a venta D. productos como la venta D. comida, tienda D. barrio, ropa, comida, empanadas verdura y entre los varones al servicios públicos D. transporte y la construcción D. viviendas. En cuanto a la competencia no es alta debido a la gran demanda D.  productos ya que las socias cuentan con puntos D. venta estratégicos en la zona. El  crédito esta destinado al incremento D. su capital D. trabajo con la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas que faciliten más su trabajo para lograr obtener un mayor ingreso ya que D. ello depenD. el bien estar D. sus familias.  En cuanto a informes crediticios  las socias  presentaron las referencias correspondientes  para acceder al crédito otorgado por nuestra institución por lo que cuentan con la experiencia en grupos solidarios y están muy satisfechos por la confianza D. la fundación Agrocapital y sobre todo por el apoyo económico brindado para el progreso D. cada uno D. los miembros del grupo.
texts.en:
The “25 D. Julio” (July 25th) group consists of 13 members, represented by Albina, who, for the most part, are engaged in sales of various products like prepared meals, neighborhood grocery store, clothing, food, turnovers, vegetables. Among the male members there is public transportation service and housing construction. Competition isn't too high because the products the members offer are in high demand and they are located in strategic sales points in the area. The financing will be used to purchase merchandise, raw materials, and tools that will make their work easier to obtain better earnings since their families depend on this income. The members presented the required credit reports and references to be eligible to receive financing from our institution since they have experience working in cooperative groups and are very satisfied with the trust of Fundación Agrocapital, especially the economic help offered for the progress of each and evey member of the group.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: German Armando

texts.es: Don German  Pérez de 61 años de edad, de oficio ebanista, casado, procreo cuatro hijos su esposa todos mayores de edad, tiene veinte años que tiene su negocio propio ya que cuando inicio trabajando era ayudante de taller con un salario bajo, pero con mucho deseo de aprender lo que mas tarde lo que adquirió le servio para poner su propio taller, que hasta ahora ha podido salir adelante pero con financiamiento para poder cumplir la demanda ya que las ventas están bajas, y la madera cara, los productos los tiene almacenados y eso le implica estar de brazos cruzados y no mover su dinero, con lo que se ayuda es con una pequeña tiendita en donde vende  una variedad de ropa, granos básicos, cosméticos y también sabe mecánica y eso es lo que le ha ayudado a sobresalir adelante para poder cubrir sus necesidades personales y la de su familia  ya que la sequía, las ventas bajas, la canasta básica alta en precio  han venido a desestabilizar la economía del país,   comprara ropa, zapatos para vender en esta temporada para poder reponerse con las ganancias que espera tener. Agradece a la institución por su apoyo ya que muchas familias Nicaragüenses nos beneficiamos con estos financiamientos que vienen hacer mejoras en nuestro hogar.
texts.en:
German P. is 61, cabinetmaker, married, father of four children, all of whom are adults, he’s had his own business for 20 years. When he started working he was a shop helper with a low salary, but with a lot of desire to learn, this would be useful in the future to start his own shop, which until now has been able to maintain because sales are low, wood is expensive and he has slow moving products in storage, as a result, he is not generating much cash. What helps is the small store where he sells clothing, basic grains, cosmetics, he also knows mechanics which has helped him get ahead to cover the basic family expenses, because the lack of rain, the low sales and inflation have contributed to make the economy of the country unstable. He will buy clothes and shoes to sell this season and recover with the profits expected to make. He thanks the institution for its support because many families from Nicaragua benefit with the loans that improve their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and shoes for sale

loans.name: Martha Georgina

texts.es: La  señora  Martha R. de 37 años de edad, vive en  un barrio marginal de Managua, se caso joven y procreo un hijo de 14 años de edad, el cual lo tiene estudiando la primaria, inicio un pequeño negocio de venta de frutas y verduras ambulante, y con ayuda de su esposo logro poner una mini pulpería el  cual administra desde hace tres años, también vende leña el cual su esposo la corta de sus tierra ya que es agricultor y alquila tierra para sembrar. El cultiva frijoles y tomate y con eso se defiende y ayuda a su familia en las necesidades personales. Por falta de capital no han logrado aumentar el inventario es por eso con este préstamo compraran lo básico que el cliente compra día a día para su alimentación como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, jabón, ace, queso, crema, pollo, productos de limpieza, y la venta de leña, para incrementar las ventas y poder tener un ahorro para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de poder mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Martha R. is 37 years old, she lives on the outskirts of Managua. She married young and has a 14 year old son, who is in school. She started a small mobile business selling fruits and vegetables, and with her husband's help, she was able to set up a small shop, which she has been running for 3 years. She also sells firewood, which her husband cuts down on their land. He is a farmer and rents land to cultivate. He grows beans and tomatoes and with this he supports and helps his family with their needs. Because of a lack of capital, they have not been able to increase their inventory. This loan will be used to purchase the basic goods customers purchase day to day, including rice, beans, oil, soap, cheese, cream, chicken, cleaning products, and the sale of firewood, in order to generate more sales and increase their savings, so they can improve their home. Martha thanks AFODENIC for the opportunity to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Jancuk Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase grains, dairy products, meats and cleaning products

loans.name: Azucenas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Azucenas” esta representado por la señora Hilda y conformada por 17 miembros la mayoría vecino del mismo barrio, por lo que el grupo posee con un grado alto D. confianza entre sus miembros. En general una mayoría D. las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades como la elaboración y distribución D. artesanías tejidas a mano, fabricación D. muebles, a la albañilería, soldadura, confección D. prendas D. vestir, cosméticos y comida. En la ciudad D. Tarija son bastantes personas que se dedican a esta actividad y están prosperando en sus negocios D. manera lenta, por eso es que requieren D. un nuevo capital para sacar sus productos a otros mercados mas rentables, es por esto que requieren adquirir maquinas como hiladoras cortadas y otras herramientas que ayuden a realizar un producto terminado D. mejor calidad y con buen acabado para competir en un mercado mucho mas rentable y así poder brindarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya habían trabajado bajo la modalidad D. grupos solidarios por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento D. la forma D. trabajo pero se encuentran agradecidas por el apoyo económico y la confianza que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The “Azucenas” (White Lillies) group, represented by Hilda, is maD. up of 17 members who are, for the most part, neighbors from the same neighborhood which allows the group to have a lot of trust amongst themselves. In general, most of the members are involved in various activities such as the making and distribution of hand-knitted crafts, furniture manufacturing, masonry, welding, clothing manufacturing, cosmetics and food sales. There are many persons in the city of Tarija who are involved in similar activities so their businesses are progressing slowly. Because of this they need new capital so that they can move their products to new, more profitable, markets. They need machinery like spinning machines and other tools which will allow them to produce better finished items to be able to compete in higher producing markets thereby providing their families with a better quality of life. The members have credit experience having worked under communal bank modalities so they are amply aware of the methodologies of working this way. Even so, they are grateful for the economic support and the trust which fundación Agrocapital offers them.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Claudia Estela

texts.es: Doña Claudia de 38 años de edad,  es madre soltera de dos hijos de 10 y 13 años de edad que cursan la primaria en el colegio del barrio, vive en Hialeah, y con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir su pequeña y humilde casa  la mistad de piedra y plycem lo cual espera en un futuro hacer toda de concreto  vende ropa, cosméticos desde hace diez años por encargo el cual vende al crédito y al contado. Hace dos años se fue trabajar a costa rica en las bananeras el cual cuando vino puso una venta surtida el cual le iba bien, pero los clientes comenzaron a pedirle crédito y ella le dio un boto de confianza y no le pagaron es por eso se vino a la quiebra con su pulpería y quito la venta y ahora con este sexto préstamo quiere invertir en ropa y cosméticos, perfume y otros que le ayude a recuperarse en capital como en la captación de clientes, y poder apoyar a sus hermosos hijos en su educación para que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Claudia is 38 years old and a single mother of two children, ages 10 and 13, who attend the neighborhood primary school. She lives in Hialeah and with much effort has managed to construct her small humble house, half of stone and half of cement board. She hopes in the future to make it all concrete.

Claudia has for ten years sold clothes and cosmetics for credit and cash. Two years ago she went to Costa Rica to work in the banana plantations, selling off her merchandise. The sale went well at first, but the customers began to ask for credit and she trusted them too much. Often, they didn't pay her. This is why her general store reached the brink of bankruptcy and she had to stop selling.

Now, with this 6th loan she wishes to invest in clothes, cosmetics, perfume and other items which will help her recuperate capital, gain customers, and help her beautiful children in their education, so that they may have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTHES, COSMETICS AND PERFUME TO SELL

loans.name: Las Blanquitas Group

texts.es: El  banco comunal “Las Blanquitas” están representadas por la señora Blanca A. y conformada por 14 miembros muy trabajadores que van cursando su primer ciclo con muchas expectativas. La gran mayoría D. las socias se dedican a ala comercialización D. diferentes productos como venta D. muebles, comidas rápida,  joyas D. plata, ropa abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, cosméticos, confección D. prendas típica como blusas y mantas, venta D. tarjetas telefónicas y el transporte público D. pasajeros. En cuanto a la competencia se pueD. decir que las socias se encuentran bien ubicadas en el mercado central por lo que tienen clientela a la cual le gusta mucho la mercadería que ofrecen. El destino D. financiamiento es para ampliar sus negocios con la adquisición D. mercadería más acorD. a las exigencias D. sus clientes, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a agilizar su producción para obtener un producto terminado mas acorD. a su mercado, otros D. los socios destinarán el financiamiento a la compra D. algunos repuestos para la reparación D. su vehículo. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya habían trabajado bajo la modalidad D. grupos solidaR. por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento D. la forma D. trabajo pero se encuentran agradecidas por el apoyo económico y la confianza que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The “Las Blanquitas” communal bank, represented by Blanca A., consists of 14, hard-working, members who have high expectations of their first lending cycle. Most of the members sell a variety of products like furniture, fast food, silver jewelry, clothing, groceries in neighborhood stores, cosmetics, making regional clothing like blouses and blankets, telephone service card sales, and public passenger transportation. As far as competition goes, these members are well situated in the central market so they have a client base that likes the merchandise they offer. The financing will be used to buy merchandise which is more in demand by their customers, raw materials and tools which will help them speed up production to have products that are more in tune with market demands. Other members will use the financing to buy replacement parts for their vehicles. The members have worked with communal banks in the past so are aware of the particular working modalities but, still, are grateful for the economic support and trust provided by fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es: Don Santos M. de 41 años,  de edad,  vive en Memorial Sandino su negocio ha sido la madera, compra y vende pero su profesión es ebanista, casado y con un hijo de 14 años de edad,  por falta de dinero no ha logrado comprar todas las herramientas para hacer su trabajo. Abecés tiene que prestar a otro compañero para poder realizar la fineza de madera,  su casa es pequeña y desea anexarla mas para mejor comida y privacidad con su familia. Anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa de hacer mueble pero logro el poner su propio negocio y hace bonitos muebles de todos los estilo. Este es segundo crédito que invertirá en la compra de madera, pega,  barniz, pintura para dar color a sus muebles y otro que necesita. Se siente contento por invertir en el negocio ya que todo esta caro, la canasta básica con altos costos y sus ventas se hacen a largo plazo debido ala crisis del desempleo, lo bueno es que su esposa trabaja como comerciante y ayuda con los gastos básicos de la casa y es de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Santos M., 41, lives in Memorial Sandino. His business has been wood, which he buys and sells. He is a cabinetmaker by profession. He is married and has a 14 year old son. For lack of money, he has not been able to buy all of the tools to do his work. Sometimes he has to borrow from another colleague to do quality woodwork. His house is small, and he wants to add on to it. That would improve the food and give his family privacy. He previously worked for a business making furniture. But, he was able to set up his own business and make attractive furniture of all styles. This is his second loan. He will use it to buy wood, glue, varnish, and paint to give color and other things his furniture needs. He is happy to invest in his business. Everything is expensive. The basic necessities cost a lot. His sales are made on the long term because of the unemployment crisis. The good thing is that his wife works as a businesswoman and helps with the basic household expenses. This is a great help.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood, glue, varnish, and paint to give finishings to his work

loans.name: Ruth Marina

texts.es: En la ciudad de Managua, la señora Ruth R. se esfuerza grandemente para llevar el sustento de su hogar. Se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y con muchos deseos de superación. Actualmente ella solicita un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de medicamentos para su mamá debido a que está enferma y requiere de su apoyo para proporcionarle dichos medicamento. Es por este motivo que ella espera confiadamente en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Ruth R. works hard to bring money home. She is known for being an assiduous person with big wishes to improve. Currently she requests a loan to invest it directly in the purchase of medicine for her mother, because she is sick and needs her support to provide medicine. It’s because of this that she waits while her loan is successfully approved.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicine for her mother

loans.name: Adrian José

texts.es: Comprometido con el bienestar de su familia, el señor Adrian S. ha solicitado un crédito el cual será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción para remodelar su vivienda que por mucho tiempo ha pasado en mal estado y hoy le es necesario llevar a cabo esta obra de reconstrucción para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a sus dos niños y esposa. Con este crédito se beneficiará grandemente porque hará realidad su sueño de tener un local propio que preste las condiciones necesarias para habitar.
texts.en:
In order to improve the welfare of his family, Mr. Adrian S. has applied for a loan which will be used to purchase construction materials to remodel his home, which has been in disrepair for a long time. He needs to finish this project now so that he can offer better living conditions for his two children and wife. This loan will be of a great benefit because it will fulfill his dream of having a place of his own to live in.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Materials

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Dulce Esperanza” esta representado por la señora Evelin y conformada por 12 miembros residentes del barrio San Jerónimo por lo que se conocen y confían en cada uno D. ellos. Una mayoría D. los socios se dedican a la elaboración y venta D. pan, venta D. lácteos, servicio D. albañilería, venta D. comida rápida, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y al servicio D. cocina. Sus negocios se encuentran en diferentes lugares como alguno D. los puestos D. venta son ambulantes, por lo que no tienen mucha competencia en sus rubros caso contrario mueven su negocio a otro lugar mucho mas rentable. Los socios indican que invertirán en incrementar su capital D. trabajo con la coma D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas que coadyuven a generar un mejor ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias. Las socias que se mantienen en el banco en este segundo ciclo  han demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en el pago D. sus cuotas. Según el reporte D. la  central D. riesgos  se pueD. ver que tienen buenos antecedentes crediticios en otras instituciones financieras también por lo que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda un nuevo apoyo económico para que los socios sigan trabajando juntos para salir adelante y poderle brinda una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Esperanza” (Sweet Hope) group consists of 12 members who all live in the San Jerónimo neighborhood and know and trust each other very much. They are represented by Evelin. Most of the members are involved in the making and selling of bread, the sale of dairy products, masonry services, fast food sales, grocery sales in neighborhood stores, and meal preparation. They are located in various sites. For example, some of the food sales take place from moving food stands which allows them to change location if competition is too strong in one place. The members state that they will use the financing to buy merchandise, raw materials and tools which will help them earn better profits with which to support their families. The members who remain in the bank for this second lending cycle have shown responsibility and punctuality in their repayments. According to the report from the credit bureau they have good credit histories in other financial institutions such that fundación Agrocapital offers them new financial support so that the members will continue to work together to get ahead and thus proviD. their families with better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La joven Maria A. de 21 años de edad, casada y con un hijo de 2 añitos, su esposo trabaja de mensajero en una farmacia, peligroso por que anda en una moto en todas los barrio de la capital dejando el medicamento que el cliente pide a domicilio. Ella se desempeña como atención al cliente  en pollo tip top desde hace dos años y su niña se la cuida  su mama, este es su segundo matrimonio ya que su esposo anterior murió en un accidente el cual marco una tristeza grande en su vida, y es por eso que vive con temor. Con el crédito anterior compro materiales para hacer un cuarto pero no pudo terminarlo es por eso que comprara mas piedra, zinc, cemento y otros para terminar la construcción ya que codo esta caro esta difícil construir en estos tiempos hay que esforzarse mucho para lograr lo deseado. da las gracias ala institución por el apoyo con el financiamiento ya que ha logrado tener un techo para su hija y privacidad en mi vida.
texts.en:
21 year old Maria A.,is married and has a two year old child, her husband works as a deliveryman for a pharmacy, this is a dangerous job because he is on a motor bike in all the neighborhoods of the city to drop off the medicine clients request for delivery. She has worked for two years in customer service for “pollo tip”; her mom takes care of her daughter. This is her second marriage because her first husband died in an accident; this was very sad for her and is the reason why she lives with fear. With the previous loan she bought materials to build a room but she couldn’t finish it because she needs to buy more stone, zinc, concrete and other materials to finish the construction because everything is expensive and it’s hard to build, nowadays one has to work really hard to achieve what one wants. She thanks the institution for the support with the loan because she now has a roof for her daughter and privacy in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy stone, concrete and zinc to finish building a room

loans.name: Praxedes Litardo

texts.en:
Praxedes Litardo R. A. is 42 years old and lives in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil. He is happily married with 3 grown children. Paraiso is a peri-urban, marginalized zone (between the suburbs and the countryside) without paved roads, water pipes, or a sewer system.

Mr. R. runs a tailor shop located off a quieter dirt path; his services include shoe repair, upholstery and zipper and handbag repair. He started his career by making tailor-made shirts and pants; over the years his business has expanded.

Mr. R. is requesting a loan to buy zippers (in every color), cloth and shoe soles, which would supply him with the materials necessary to take care of customer demands at a moment's notice.

With this loan he will be able to buy a larger quantity of materials from Santa Elena (a local wholesale vendor) at a discounted rate.

In the future, he would like to buy sheet metal to secure the roof of his shop. He dreams of one day being a material's distributor to other tailors in the city.

He is grateful for any support we can provide his business so that his family may prosper!

loans.use: To buy cloth, zippers and shoe soles.

loans.name: Rosa Linda Group

texts.es: El grupo “Rosa Linda” esta representado por la señora Yoyanda y conformada por 14 miembros  que van cursando ya su segundo ciclo demostrando responsabilidad y ganas D. sacar adelante a sus familias con su trabajo y esfuerzo. Una mayoría D. los integrantes se dedican a la venta D. verdura y en una menor cantidad a la venta D. comida, libros y al transporte público D. pasajeros. Sus negocios están ubicados dentro del  mercado central  que es muy concurrido por la población, teniendo todo el año un buen nivel D. venta para todo quien tenga negocio en ese lugar. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. su capital D. herbajo y especialmente para la adquisición D. mercadería parta la venta como verduras frescas en mayor cantidad los cuales ayudará a mejorar la calida D. vida y educación D. sus familias para poder brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "Rosa Linda" group is represented by Mrs. Yolanda and comprised of 14 members that are enrolled in their second loan cycle. The group is demonstrating responsibility and willingness to support their families through hard work and effort. The majority of members sell vegetables and the rest sell food, books, and proviD. public transportation services. Their businesses are located insiD. the central market that is very popular with the community. This past year all those with businesses at this market have seen a high level of sales.

The loan will be used to increase working capital and specifically to increase their merchandise so they can sell more fresh vegetables. This would help to improve the quality of life and education of their families so that they may bring a better future to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables

loans.name: Dayra Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Dayra García de 48 años de edad vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino,  procreo dos hijos ya mayores, desde hace ocho años trabaja como cocinera del ejercito de Nicaragua, por su bajos ingresos no ha logrado un crédito mayor a diez mil Córdobas lo que ha logrado ir poco a poco construyendo su vivienda, con el desembolso anterior repello paredes y embaldoso  sala.
