Con este va a terminar de repellar las paredes de afuera que le falta ya que se gasta mucho cemento y arena y no logro lo esperado en el anterior. Se siente sastifecha ya que podrá ver su casa más bonita y sólida. Todo gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado, es su noveno ciclo con la institución y se ha beneficiado en las mejoras de su vivienda  así como muchas familias Nicaragüenses logran tener una casa digna para su familia. A pesar de la economía critica del país. Los desempleos es por eso muchas familia emigran a otro país para lograr el bienestar para una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dayra García is 48 years old and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. She has two grown children and has worked as a cook for the Nicaraguan Army since she was 8 years old. Because of her low income she has not been able to receive a loan for more than 10,000 Córdobas. She has used her previous loans to improve her home little by little. With her last loan she plastered her walls and tiled her living room. With this loan she will finish plastering the outdoor walls because it required more cement and sand and she was unable to complete the job with her last loan. She is satisfied because soon her house will be more solid and look better. Many thanks to the loans that Afodenic has provided. This is her ninth loan with the institution, and she was benefitted from the improvements made on her house. Despite the financial difficulties in the country, this has allowed her and many Nicaraguan families to have a worthy house for their families. Unemployment is the major reason why many families emigrate to other countries in order to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to plaster walls

loans.name: Melia Teresa

texts.es: La señora Meliá Teresa de 39 años de edad, procreo cuatro hijos  de 2, 8,10 y 12 años de edad, los cuales los tiene estudiando para una mejor educación ya que en el barrio que habita hay mucha delincuencia, que roban a la luz del día. Lo cual se da por padre que no ayudan a sus hijos para que modelen una vida mejor. Su negocio es la venta de tortilla, nacatamales, frijoles cosidos el cual se vende por su precio que es accesible vende frijoles por cinco córdobas las tortillas a un córdobas, que es el alimento Nicaragüense lleva siete años en las ventas y por falta de capital no ha aumentado sus ingresos en la producción de inventario. Su esposo es albañil trabaja por contratos en los diferentes barios de la capital, con los ingresos de el ha ido comprando piedra, cemento, hierro, y ha ido construyendo su casa ya que le resulta fácil  por que el mismo la hace el cual se ahorran mucho dinero. La casa que habitan es sencilla forrada de zinc y muy insegura pero con la esperanza que pronto cerraran su casa hecha de concreto que ya esta avanzada y con este financiamiento lograran comprar mas piedra y cemento para terminarla que es lo que mas desea ya que en la casa que esta se le pasa mucho agua por que el zinc esta muy viejo. Da las gracias a la institución por la oportunidad de poder terminar de hacer su casa y poder ver realizado su sueño de tener una casa digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Señora Meliá Teresa is 39 years old, and is the mother of four children aged 2,8,10 and 12, who are studying to obtain a better education. In the neighborhood where they live there is a lot of delinquency and robberies occur even in the light of day; this is because many fathers do not help their children or model a better life for them. Her business is the sale of tortillas, nactatamales, and cooked beans, which she sells at very low prices. She sells cooked beans for 5 córdobas, and tortillas for 1 córdoba; this is food that is typical of Nicaragua. She has been selling food for 7 years, but because of a lack of capital she has not increased her income or production. Her husband is a bricklayer who works by contract in different neighborhoods in the capital. With his earnings he has been buying stone, cement, and steel and has been building their house. This has been easy for him as this is his trade, and it has also enabled them to save a lot of money. The house that they live in is encased only with zinc, and is very insecure, but they are hoping to soon encase it with concrete, and this is already underway. With this financing they will be able to buy more rock and cement in order to finish it. This is their greatest wish, since a lot of water gets into their house now because the zinc is very old. They are thankful to the institution for the opportunity to finish their house, and to realize their dream of having a decent house for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy stone, cement and sand to finish construction of their house

loans.name: San Placido Group

texts.es: El grupo “San Placido” esta representado por la señora Nelva y conformada por 12 miembros que cuenta con experiencia D. trabajo en grupo ya que van cursando ya su tercer ciclo demostrando en todo momento puntualidad y responsabilidad en los pagos. Cabe recalcar que  las diferentes actividades que emprenD. los miembros del grupo permite el cumplimiento D. las cuotas establecidas por la institución y el cumplimiento con cada uno D. sus hogares sacrificándose día a día por salir adelante en sus negocio D. venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, costurera, peluquerías, almacenes D. comestibles, tiendas D. ropa D. vestir y cosméticos por catálogos. Si bien existe bastante competencia en todos los rubros que desarrollan las socias, estas tienen buenos ingresos a pesar D. todo. El objetivo del crédito es para la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mejor ingreso para sus el bien estar D. sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya habían trabajado bajo la modalidad D. grupos solidarios por lo que tienen amplio conocimiento D. la forma D. trabajo pero se encuentran agradecidas por el apoyo económico y la confianza que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The “San Placido” group, represented by Nelva, consists of 12 members who have experience working in a group since they are in their third lending cycle having demonstrated always punctuality and responsibility in repayments. It's worthy of mention that the various activities the members engage in proviD. enough profits to allow the group to make their repayments in the manner specified by the institution and that their daily sacrifices to get ahead in the sales of groceries, as seamstresses, barbers, food stores, clothing sales, and cosmetic catalogue sales also allows them to meet their household expenses. Despite heavy competition in all the areas the members engage in, they make good earnings. The objective of the funding is to buy merchandise, raw materials and work tools to generate better income for their families' wellbeing. These members have already worked with communal banks so they have experience in the work methodologies involved and are grateful for the economic support and trust placed in them by fundación Agrocapital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Mario Alexander

texts.es:
El joven Mario Alexander M. es propietario de una pulpería ubicada en el departamento de Managua donde vende diferentes tipos de productos los que son comercializados por él mismo. La pulpería se encuentra ubicada en su propia vivienda que requiere de inversión porque ha estado maltratada y es de necesidad reconstruirla para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y también para darle un mejor lugar a la pulpería

Es por esta razón que solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda y de esta manera brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes en un local amplio y agradable donde atender la pulpería.
texts.en:
Mario Alexander M. owns a mini market, which is located in the Managua department. He sells different types of products. The store is located in his own house. He needs to invest in it because it is battered and needs to be rebuilt. He needs to do this in order to improve his family’s living conditions and to make his store a better place. That is the reason that he is asking for a loan to buy construction materials for his house. This way he will give his family better living conditions. He will also satisfy his customers’ needs and have a larger and more pleasant place to take care of them in the store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Simona de 49 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos,  los cual  se esfuerza para darles estudios y una buena alimentación, se dedica ala venta de ropa, zapatos desde varios años, comenzó ambulante por las calles de capital vendiendo ropa, el cual muy cansada llegaba a su casa, pero tenia que seguir adelante lo cual logro con el tiempo comprar un tramo, todo lo hizo con dinero que su ex esposo dio y con ahorro de su trabajo ya que trabajaba en servicios domestico en un tiempo. Pero su objetivo era lograr incrementar su negocio para poder dar los estudios a sus hijos. Ella va  a los departamentos a vender ropa ya que se vende bien lo cual le genera buenas ganancias, las dificultades que se le presenta es que el cliente abecés no paga en la fecha acordada y se atrasa con los pedidos y sus pagos los atrasa también pero mas difícil ya que en las instituciones no andan viendo los problemas personales del cliente. Con este crédito comprara ropa, zapatos en variedad y aprovechar la temporada de la navidad que es buena. La institución ha sido la fuente de  incrementar el inventario y de poder estar en mejores condiciones ya que con el crédito anterior hizo un cuarto para dar privacidad a sus hijos y se siente contenta por los beneficios obtenidos.
texts.en:
Simona, 49, is a single mother with four children. She puts forth great effort in order to give them an education and good food. She has been selling clothes and shoes for many years. She started selling clothes as a street vendor on the streets of the capital. She was very tired when she returned home from selling. But, she had to keep going forward. In time, she was able to buy a space to sell. She did it with money that her ex husband gave her and with savings from work. She worked for a time in domestic services. Her objective was to increase her business to be able to give her children an education. She goes to the departments to sell clothes. They sell well, which generates good earnings. The difficulty that presents itself is that sometimes the customers do not pay on the agreed upon date. The orders are late and the payments are also delayed. The most difficult thing is that the institutions do not look at the clients’ personal problems. She will use this loan to buy a variety of clothes and shoes to take advantage of the Christmas season, which is good. The institution has been the source of increasing her inventory and being able to be in better conditions. With the previous loan she built a room to give her children privacy. She is very content with the benefits she has obtained.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of clothes and shoes for this Christmas season

loans.name: Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Esmeraldas” Esta representado por la señora Nora Ana y conformado por 14 miembros los cuales van cursando su tercer ciclo demostrando puntualidad y sobre todo ganas D. trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias. Cada una D. las socias tiene su propio negocio D. venta D. diferentes productos como venta D. refrigerio, venta D. joyas, perfumes, cotillón y el servicio D. sus profesiones como policías, profesoras y chóferes. El comercio en este grupo es muy variado, su nivel D. ventas es muy bueno, teniendo buena rentabilidad y capacidad D. pago a pesar D. existir bastante competencia.  El crédito esta destinado al incremento D. su capital, esperan mejorar sus ventas  y el crédito sera invertido en la compra D. más mercadería que será utilizado para generar mayores ganancia para poder otorgarles a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y un futuro mas prometedor a sus hijos que son su razón para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Esmeraldas" (Emeralds) group, represented by Nora Ana, consists of 14 members who are in their third lending cycle demonstrating punctuality and, above all, a willingness to work to see their families get ahead. Each of the members has her own business consisting of sales of various items like: refreshments, jewelry, perfumes, party planning. Some offer professional services such as: policemen, teachers and drivers. Commerce in this group is varied and their sales levels are good so they are able to earn good profits and repay their loans despite competition. The funding will be used to buy merchandise which will increase their profits so that their families can have a better quality of life and a more promising future for their children, who are their reason to persevere.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anielka Valero

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, la señora Anielka M. se ha esforzado grandemente por llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y esta vez ha decidido iniciar a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que a raíz de los años ha venido siendo maltratada pero ahora ella ha decidido reconstruirla para así brindarle las condiciones necesarias a su familia.

Con el crédito se beneficia grandemente porque logrará comprar gran parte de los materiales de construcción para realizar la obra y de esta manera continuar buscando la manera de cómo mejorar su situación económica producto de sus esfuerzos.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua Anielka M. has worked hard to provide for her family and has now decided to start improving her home due to the fact that over the years it has be mistreated. She has decided to reconstruct it to provide her family with the necessary living conditions. She will benefit greatly from the loan because she will manage to purchase a large portion of the construction materials for the job and through this continuing to find the way to improve her economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es: La señora Carmen O. de 38 años de edad, vive en el barrio Domitila, madre soltera de una hija de 13 años de edad, el cual estudia en la escuela del barrio, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace seis años, al comienzo fue difícil el cual comenzó con poca ropa y andar vendiendo por la calle, cansada de caminar y sin vender nada, eso era bastante frustrante, pero poco a poco logro tener clientela que comenzó a dar al crédito para la quincena gente de su barrio, ahora trabaja con bastantes pedidos de las mujeres de zona franca y al crédito. También se ha afiliado con la Avon en donde compra el catalogo al gusto del cliente y también le dan crédito que se beneficia mucho ya que cuando recoge el dinero va a pagar. Con este financiamiento va a comprar ropa, zapatos, cosméticos para ofertar a sus clientes y seguir adelante con su negocio. Con las ganancias quiere repellar las paredes su casa para que se mire bonita y poder dar  a su hija mejor comodidad que lo esta logrando con la mano ayuda de Afodenic el cual agrádese por la oportunidad dada con sus prestamos.
texts.en:
Carmen O. is 38 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Domitila. She is a single mother of her 13 year old daughter, who studies in a school in the neighborhood. Carmen O. has been selling clothes for the past six years. In the beginning it was difficult because she began with few clothes to sell and sold them by walking through the streets. She was tired of walking and hadn't sold much; it was very frustrating. But little by little she began to have clients, who she extends credit to until payday (for two weeks). Now she has many orders from women in the free trade zone and those who she gives credit to. She is also affiliated with Avon, where she buys from the catalog to her clients' tastes. They also give a loan that she has already profited from. When she collects the money, she is going to pay it back. With this financing she is going to buy clothes, shoes, and cosmetics to offer her clients and continue in her business. With these profits she wants to plaster the walls of her house so it looks nicer and she can give her daughter greater comfort. She is accomplishing this with the helping hand of Afodenic. She is pleased to be given this opportunity with her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothes, shoes and cosmetics

loans.name: Edgar Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Edgar O. está comprometido con su familia por medio de la reconstrucción de su vivienda ya que ha establecido brindarle a su pequeño hijo un techo digno donde habitar y para ello se está esforzando grandemente para lograr esto.

Por tal motivo, ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así iniciar a lo inmediato la reconstrucción de la vivienda porque le es de mucha utilidad en estos momentos y así brindar a su familia entera las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Mr. Edgar Obregon is committed to his family for the reconstruction of their home, because he is determined to provide his young child with a roof where to live, and to achieve this he is working really hard. For this reason, he requested a loan to purchase construction materials to start immediately with the renovations of his home, because it would be very useful at this time and this way he can provide his family with all the necessary conditions for improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora  MARIA ISABEL S. P. , tiene 44  años, vive en el distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II. Ella presenta  estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo 1 depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la preparación de menús (alimento) en su casa que luego los lleva a repartir a  los trabajadores de diferentes fábricas cercanas a su domicilio. Con su primer crédito de 100.00 nuevos soles compró productos  alimenticios como: arroz, fideos, papas, menestras, aceite para preparar los menús.
Con este crédito de 150.00 nuevos soles comprará tapers para repartir sus menús.
Maria sueña con tener su restaurante.
texts.en:
Señora MARIA ISABEL S. P. is 44 years old and lives in the Salaverry district of Trujillo province, in the La Libertad region of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank "LAS EMPRESARIAS AL ÉXITO II." She has completed 5 years of school, lives with a partner, and has 3 children, only 1 of whom is dependent upon her economically. Maria prepares food in her house that she later takes to distribute to the people who work in the various factories located near her home. With her first loan of 100 nuevos soles she bought food products such as: rice, noodles, potatoes, dried beans and cooking oil to prepare the meals. With this loan of 150 nuevos soles she will buy containers to use in the distribution of her meals. Maria dreams of having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy food containers

loans.name: Gustavo Alejandro

texts.es:
El caballero Gustavo M. es padre de dos pequeños niños a los cuales debe de mantener y proporcionarle las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo brindándoles una vivienda digna donde puedan habitar.

El problema que por varios años ha atravesado es que su vivienda no está en buenas condiciones porque ha sido afectada por los fenómenos climatológicos y esto se puede convertir en un peligro para sus hijos así que solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción y así mejorar su vivienda para el bienestar de sus hijos y el resto de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Gustavo Mejia is the father of two small children, who he must support and provide a good home to. The problem he has had for a number of years is that his home is not in good condition because it’s been affected by the weather. This could be unsafe for his children. He is requesting this loan in order to buy construction materials to improve his home for the well being of his children and the rest of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Construction Material

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es: José Carlos es un persona que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y artículos para el hogar. El desde niño vio que sus padres para poder mantener a la familia salían a vender por las calles ropa, muebles, zapatas y otros artículos para darles una mejor calidad de vida. El a lo largo de los años y ver como estaba la situación económica, empezó con ropa y después a artículos para el hogar como mesas, sillas o pedidos de acuerdo lo que el cliente le pida. Ahora el quiere un préstamo para ir a surtir mas mercancía; por los pedidos que esta teniendo y para no quedar mal acude a nosotros para solicitar un crédito para que sus ganancias se eleven.
texts.en:
José Carlos has been selling used clothing and house wares for 15 years now. As a child, his parents would sell clothing, furniture, shoes and other items on the street in order to provide for their family. As the years went by, and looking at the economic situation, he began his business by selling clothing and then house wares, such as tables and chairs, and other items his customers ordered. Today he is asking for a loan to stock up on merchandise. To keep up with demand and to keep his customers satisfied, he is asking us for a loan to make his earnings grow.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana R. es una dama que muy esforzadamente se dedica a laborar para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así proporcionarle a su familia buenas condiciones para su desarrollo.

La señora Juana atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su vivienda y para ello ha solicitado el crédito ya que lo invertirá directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo la obra de reconstrucción de su casa porque es de mucha necesidad para ella y al recibir el crédito e invertirlo en esta obra logrará hacer realidad su sueño de ver su vivienda en perfectas condiciones.
texts.en:
Juana R. is a woman who works strenuously to bring home enough money to support her family and provide good conditions for their development. Juana needs to invest in her home. For this reason she is requesting a loan that will be invested directly in construction materials to remodel her house, because there is a great need for it. To receive this loan and carry out this work would make her dream of having a house in perfect condition become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Katy Karina

texts.es: Katy Karina es una mujer emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 29 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado, actividad que lo realiza junto con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” desde hace ocho meses, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles, que le permitió invertir en la compra de pescado fresco y seco para vender, ahora Katy necesita un crédito de 1500 soles que será utilizado para comprar redes para pesca. La meta de Katy es construir su casa y tener un galpón para dedicarse a la crianza y venta de pollos.
texts.en:
Katy Karina is a hard-working woman. She lives in the Yarinacocha district, which is in the Ucayali region, is 29 years old, and mother of 3 minor children. Her business is selling fish, which she does along with her husband. She has been a member of the Community Bank “Nuevo Edén” for 8 months. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which enabled her to invest in the purchase of fresh and dried fish to sell. Now Katy needs a loan of 1500 soles, which she will use to purchase fishing nets. Katy’s goal is to build a house and to have a coop so she can raise and sell chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Doña Rosa Amelia R. de 47 años de edad, vive en Villa Reconciliación, procreo cuatro hijos, su esposo es conductor de una empresa privada. Con ayuda del esposo logro poner una pequeña pulpería la cual no resulto ya que las ventas muy bajas y no logro superar, lo cual puso un kiosco en un mercado de la capital Israel Lewites en donde ofrece sus productos como: frescos, gaseosas, aguelada, golosinas, jugos, y una variedad accesible al bolsillo del cliente y se siente contenta ya que esta en una parada de buses donde le es posible vender, la alcaldía le cobra por estar ahí, pero no es mucho, abecés con miedo de cualquier peligro oh robo por que su pequeño tramo no es cerrado, pero como muchas madre de familia están logrando ganarse el pan de cada día ahí es su único consuelo. Con este préstamo comprara gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, pan, café para ofrecer a sus clientes. Y poder aumentar su inventario el cual espera hacer más grande, y poder pedir ayuda a la coca cola para que le den un Kiosco de los que promocionan al ver sus productos. Da las gracias Afodenic por la oportunidad de cada día por cada familia para prosperar en el negocio y mejorar la economía familiar mediante el crédito a pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa Amelia R. is 47 years old, lives in Villa Reconciliacíon, and has four children. Her husband runs a private enterprise. With his help, she opened up a small grocery store that did not work out, as sales were very low. Instead, she now operates a stand at a market in Israel Lewites, where she offers products such as fruit juices, sodas, snacks and a variety of other wallet-friendly items to her customers. She is happy there, as her stand is near a bus stop, which generates sales. The city charges her rent, but it’s not much, and sometimes she fears a robbery, since the stretch of market where her stand is located is not closed off, but like many other mothers, she is earning her daily bread, and she finds comfort in this. With this loan she will purchase sodas, juices, snacks, bread and coffee to offer to her customers, and will expand her inventory with the hope that Coca Cola will provide her with a branded stand once they see all of the products she carries. She would like to thank Afodenic on behalf of every family for the daily opportunity to prosper in business and to improve each family’s economic situation through loans to small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sodas, juices, bread and coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair the motor in his car

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, el señor Manuel R. ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción porque requiere invertir en su vivienda porque ha estado maltratada a raíz que los años han transcurrido y por tal razón anhela brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias para vivir.

Es por esto que muy sabiamente al haber solicitado el crédito espera que sea otorgado para a lo inmediato comprar los materiales de construcción y de esta manera mejorar su vivienda para beneficio propio y de su familia amada.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Manuel has turned to the microfinance organization Ceprodel to request a loan to buy construction materials. He needs to invest in his home because it has been battered as the years have passed and Manuel longs to offer his family the conditions necessary for a good life.

That is why he has very wisely requested this loan and hopes that it will be granted so that he can immediately buy the construction materials and improve his home to benefit himself and his beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Virginia Leandra

texts.es: La Sra. Virginia  es cliente desD. el año 2001, ella trabajo en grupo solidario "Olivos" durante 18 secuencias, actualmente se encuentra en su 11 ava secuencia como individual, ella se dedica la venta D. varios productos en su tienda y tambien como una sucursal en la venta D. huevos, el esposo es jardinero y albañil y muchas veces viaja, quedando ella a mando del hogar, tiene 5 hijos pero ya independientes, solo la última estudia en la Universidad, cubriendo su mamá con los gastos,la señora Virginia es una cliente muy responsable y puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Virginia has been a client since the year 2001; she has worked in the communal bank "Olivos" for 18 loan cycles. Currently she is on her 11th individual loan. She sells a variety of products from her store, and also has another business selling eggs. Her husband is a gardener and bricklayer and he often travels, leaving her in charge of the home. She has 5 children, but they are already independent except for the youngest, who studies at the University where his mother covers his expenses. Virginia is a very responsible client who makes her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Noel Adali

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua el señor Noel F. ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción los que serán invertidos en su vivienda porque ha estado en lamas condiciones y es de mucha importancia que el señor Noel la mejore para así brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.

Con la confianza en que su crédito le será otorgado satisfactoriamente, él espera confiadamente en que al recibir dicho crédito comprará a lo inmediato los materiales y así iniciará la reconstrucción de su casa de habitación ofreciendo mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Noel has turned to the organization Ceprodel for the purpose of requesting a loan to buy construction materials that will be invested in his home because it has been in bad condition. It is of great importance that Noel improves his house so that he can offer better living conditions to his family.

With confidence that this loan will be granted, he confidently expects to receive the credit and will immediately buy the construction materials and start the reconstruction of his home, in this way offering better living conditions to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Maintaining his rice paddy

loans.name: Luafulufa

texts.en:
Luafulufa L. is a 37-year-old woman living in the town of Leualesi Leauvaa. She is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Luafulufa owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Luafulufa has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 450 WST a month from these activities.

In 2005, Luafulufa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luafulufa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Luafulufa is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Luafulufa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es:
La señora  SANDRA MARGARITA C. A. tiene 30 años, vive en el distrito de MOCHE, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN BORJA. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to  de secundaria,  refiere que no continuó estudios superiores porque se caso muy joven. tiene 4 hijo quienes  depende económicamente de ella porque se encuentran estudiando. La socia se dedica a la venta de gaseosas y cervezas en su casa y con su crédito de  300 nuevos soles compró cajas de gaseosas y cervezas  al por mayor para vender.
Con este crédito de  500.00 nuevos soles también lo utilizara para comprar cajas de gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor para así obtener mayores ganancias.
SANDRA sueña con tener un bar/restaurante en su casa para poder obtener mayores ganancias y poder facilitarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandra Margarita C. A., 30, lives in the district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She belongs to the Communal Bank San Borja. She completed studies up to the 5th grade of secondary school but didn't continue to higher studies because she got married very young. She has four children who depend on her as they are studying. Sandra works selling soft drinks and beers from her house and with a previous loan of 300 new soles she bought boxes of soft drinks and beers to sell more.

With this loan of 500 new soles, she will also buy boxes of soft drinks and beers to obtain greater profits. Sandra dreams of having a bar/restaurant in her house to be able to make more income and to provide her children with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy boxes of soft drinks and beers to sell more

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Pedro V. se dedica a laborar arduamente para llevar el bienestar a su casa de habitación y para ello ha iniciado a reconstruir su vivienda con el propósito de brindarle a su familia las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Es importante destacar que a pesar de las difíciles circunstancias económicas que ha atravesado se ha comprometido en realizar esta reconstrucción de su casa de habitación. 

Espera que su crédito sea otorgado de inmediato para iniciar la tarea y de esta manera adquirir los materiales de construcción para realizar la reconstrucción de su vivienda y así tener un techo digno donde habitar junto con sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Pedro V. works arduously to bring well-being to his home and, because of this, has begun to reconstruct his house with the intention of offering his family the necessary conditions for development. It's important to emphasise and consider the difficult economic circumstances that he has gone through in undertaking the reconstruction of his house.

He hopes that the loan will be awarded shortly to begin the task and, in this way, acquire construction materials to reconstruct his house with a decent roof, where he can live together with his loved-ones.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Maximino

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Maximino R. le esta haciendo falta la terminación de un cuarta de material  ya que la demás casa es de madera y quiere mejor su vivienda para el y su esposa ya que viven solos sus hijos ya tiene su propia familia.
En este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material ya que el se encargara de la construcción en horario adicional a su trabaja. 
Don Maximino y su esposa la señora María Eugenia Anaya, se dedican al comercio de vender ropa usada y accesorios para demás, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para ellos y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito ya que desean ver su recamara terminada y más segura.
texts.en:
Mr. Maximino R.’ home has one unfinished room and is in need of building materials, as the rest of the home is made of wood, and he’d like to improve it for himself and his wife. They live alone, as their children have their own families now. Currently he does not have the money needed to purchase the materials, and he will be in charge of the construction during his off time from his job. Don Maximino and his wife, Mrs. María Eugenia Anaya, both sell used clothing and accessories. This business is their main source of income, and will be used to pay off the loan, as they would like to see their bedroom finished.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of a room

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Diotilia

texts.es:
La señora  DIOTILIA A. I. tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito de FLORENCIA DE MORA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal  LA PERBOLA . Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es casada  y tiene 4 hijos de  los cuales solo 2 dependen económicamente de ella.
La socia  se dedica a la fabricación y venta de zapatos de damas y niñas. Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró material para la fabricación de zapatos como: cuero, hebillas, tacos, plantas, hormas, terocal, etc.
Con este nuevo crédito de 600.00 nuevos soles comprará hebillas, pegamentos, hormas, plantillas, etc para fabricar su calzado.
DIOTILIA sueña con tener su propio taller de fabricación de calzado parta así poder aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
DIOTILIA A. I., 49, lives in the district of Florencia de Mora, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru, and belongs to the Communal Bank La Perbola. She studied up to the 5th grade of secondary school, is married and has four children, of which two are financially dependent on her.

She works in the manufacturing and sale of shoes for women and children. With her first loan of 300 new soles, she bought materials for manufacturing shoes such as leather, buckles, heels, soles, lasts etc. With this new loan of 600 new soles, she will buy buckles, glue, lasts, insoles etc. to make her footwear. Diotilia dreams of having her own workshop for manufacturing footwear to thereby increase her sales and obtain more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buckles, glue, lasts, insoles etc.

loans.name: Janina De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Janina de 25 años de edad, es soltera y  vive junto con sus padres el cual ayuda con los gastos de luz, agua y alimentación, por pocos recursos dejo de estudiar la universidad es uno de sus anhelo el poder concluir su carrera universitaria para lograr un mejor futuro, comenzó trabajando en una bodega en un mercado el mas visitado por los Nicaragüenses por ser el mas barato y donde se encuentran todos productos. Por gracias de Dios le ofrecieron otro trabajo donde gana mejor y lleva dos años laborando ya. Ahora que tiene mas recursos económico desea construir su cuarto propio para una mejor privacidad es por eso opta por el crédito para comprar: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc y comenzar hacer el arranque para tener un inicio y poder terminarlo poco a poco que gracias al apoyo de la institución hará posible. Estoy estudiando ingles ya que es una puerta grande hablar el idioma y así poder ir escalando y poder ganar mejor y poder terminar sus estudios, a si como ayudar a sus padres a que no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Janina is 25 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She helps them pay their electricity, water and grocery bills, which leaves her with little left over for university. Janina wants very much to finish her studies and improve her future, so she started working in a market frequented by Nicaraguans, where products are cheap and plentiful. Thankfully she found a new job with better pay, and she has been working there for two years. Now that she has a better income, Janina wants to build her own room so that she can have more privacy. She needs credit for building materials like stone, sand, cement, iron and zinc. This loan will allow her to begin her project and finish it gradually. Janina says she is studying English because language opens doors that will allow her to improve her station in life, earn a better living, and help her parents so that they'll want for nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials (stone, cement, sand, iron)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.es: El Sr. Hermógenes, trabajó con grupo solidario "La Merced" en seis secuencias, luego se individualizo siendo esta su decimatercera secuencia, el Sr. Tiene un Frial en el que se dedica a la venta de carne vacuna especialmente, el viaja por carne al altiplano, trae ganado parado y lo lleva a carnear al matadero municipal, el trabaja con varios negocioa pequeños a los que provee de ese producto, la esposa  tambien se dedica a la venta de carne pero de pollo, ellos tienen 3 hijos que  ya cursan estudios superiores, dos de ellos y el otro pequeño se encuentra en colegio, es un cliente muy responsable.
texts.en:
Señor Hermógenes was part of the group “La Merced” for six loan periods, but then he took out a loan independently. This will be his thirteenth loan. He runs a food store where he sells meat with beef as a speciality. He travels into the mountains to buy the meat. He takes the cattle to the municipal slaughterhouse where they are butchered. Hermógenes sells the meat to several small businesses. His wife sells meat also, but chicken rather than beef. They have three children, two of whom are in college, and the youngest is still in high school. He is a very responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cattle to resell as meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy "pagne" cloth

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario es una socia dinámica y optimista, vive en la ciudad de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 36 años, es madre de seis hijos. Rosario se dedica a la venta de plátano de esta región en el mercado de Yarinacocha,  trabaja junto a su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Edén” desde hace un año y cinco meses. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue utilizado en la compra de  plátanos, ahora Rosario necesita un crédito de 1500 que será utilizado en la compra de un motocar de segundo uso, el mismo que utilizará para el traslado de sus productos. La meta de Rosario es llegar a tener un motocar nuevo y seguir apoyando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Rosario is a dynamic and optimistic member. She lives in the city of Yarinacocha in the Ucayali region. She is 36 and has six children. Rosario works with her husband selling bananas from the region in the Yarinacocha market. She has been part of the Nuevo Edén communal bank for one year and five months. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy bananas. Rosario now needs a loan for 1,500 PEN, which she will use to buy a second hand “motocarro” (a three wheeled motorized vehicle). She will use it to carry her products. Rosario’s goal is to have a new motocarro and to keep helping her husband with the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a second hand motocarro

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: La joven Elizabeth de 25 años de edad,  es casada, no tiene hijo y su esposo labora en zona franca trabajando de operario, con un salario bajo pero con mucho deseo de ahorrar para hacer su propia casa, Janina se desempeña como docente en un colegio del barrio desde hace dos años, ella estudio ingeniería en sistema con computación, gracias al apoyo de su papa ya que su mama los abandono desde pequeña, a mucho sacrificio saco su secundaria tuvo que trabajar como domestica para poder pagar los estudios y estudiar los sábados, luego trabaje en zona franca para poder pagar la universidad ya que mi padre no alcanzaba por ser de pocos recursos económicos, es difícil pero lo logre hay que tener mucha voluntad y deseo de superación. Su meta es poder encontrar un mejor trabajo en donde pueda poner a práctica su carrera a si como ganar mejor para poder comenzar  hacer su casa. Con este préstamo comprara: piedra arena, hierro  para ir adelantado y tener un comienzo ya que todo esta caro y es difícil construir de una sola vez,  da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo con el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 25, is married and does not have children. Her husband is a workman for the “Zona Franca” (a governmental organization that regulates exportation from Nicaragua). His salary is low, but he has a great desire to save to build his own house. She has worked as a teacher at a neighborhood school for two years. She studied as an engineer in computer systems. Thanks to her father (her mother abandoned them when she was little), who sacrificed much, she finished high school. She had to work as a domestic employee to be able to pay for her education, and she went to school on Saturdays. Then she worked for the Zona Franca to be able to pay the university because her father had few economic resources. It is difficult, but she did it. You have to have a lot of will power and the desire to succeed. Her goal is to be able to find a better job where she will be able to practice her profession. That way she would earn more and be able to start building her house. She will use the loan to buy rocks, sand, and metal to go forward and start. Everything is expensive, and it is difficult to build all at once. She is grateful to Afodenic for the financial support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rocks, sand, cement, and iron to start building her house

loans.name: Koffi Nouwozan

texts.fr:
Koffi Nouwozan T. est un homme de 40 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants. Il habite à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, une ville située à 120  kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un conducteur de taxi-moto et avec ce crédit de Kiva, il voudrait acheter une moto en vue de faire un taxi. Koffi  prend les gens les conduit et les dépose à leur destination et à son tour prend les fais correspondant à la distance parcourue. Avec ce travail il voudrait épargner de l’argent afin de mieux subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants. 

FECECAV is a cooperative union registered in 1997. It's mission is to serve the financial needs of local people who have been excluded from the traditional financial system. It serves more than 50000 members in the Plateaux and Maritime regions of Togo. FECECAV is a non-profit organization.
texts.en:
Kossi Biova T. is a 28-year-old man, unmarried, and without children. He lives in Lomé (capital of Togo), a city located 120 km from Kpalimé. He is a retailer of second-hand clothing and the like. With this Kiva loan, he would like to buy bales of used clothing and to sell them retail. In this way, he will be able to increase his customer base and to obtain a lot of profit. With the profits, he would really like to increase his purchases and to satisfy all his customers. FECECAV is a savings union created in 1995 and approved in 1997. It covers the region of Plateaux and Maritime. Its mission is to meet the financial needs of the people in the region who are excluded from the standard financial system. Today, FECECAV has over 50,000 members and plans on extending its activities to surrounding towns in the region. FECECAV is a not-for-profit organization.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto

loans.name: Valentin Pedro

texts.es: Don Valentín R. de 34 años de edad, vive en un barrio que se llama Pablo Úbeda, casado, con una bonita Nina de 1 año de edad, que su esposa tiene, ella trabaja como docente y se ayudan a cubrir ambos los gastos ya que la canasta esta súper elevada de costo debido a la sequía de este año. El se desempeña como guarda de seguridad desde hace seis años, gana poco pero no se encuentra trabajo es por eso que esta siempre en la seguridad, su dificultad que se le presenta es cuando roban algo y tiene que pagarlo de su salario y desajusta para los gastos de su familia. Con este préstamo quiere reparar un cuarto el zinc qué esta viejo y se le pasa el agua cuando llueve y desea que su familia este bien para que no sufran ninguna enfermedad. Para esto comprara zinc nuevo.  Sus planes a futuro es poder tener su propio negocio, de granos básicos, y venta de ropa que espera lograrlo para un futuro mejor y con el financiamiento que es una fuente de inversión el cual da las gracias.
texts.en:
Valentín R., 34, lives in the Pablo Úbeda neighborhood. He is married and has a beautiful one year old daughter. His wife works as a teacher, and they both help cover the expenses. Basic grocery costs are extremely high due to the drought this year. He has worked as a security guard for six years. He earns little, but he cannot find other work. That is why he is always working security. The difficulty he encounters is that when something is stolen, he has to pay for it out of his salary. This has an ill effect on the family expenses. With this loan he wants to repair a room. The zinc is old and leaks when it rains. He wants his family to be fine so that they do not get sick. He will buy zinc to do this. His future plan is to have his own business with basic grains and selling clothes. He hopes to achieve a better future. He is grateful for the loan, which is an investment source.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new zinz to change the roof of his house so it will not leak anymore

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy used clothing

loans.name: Jorge Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Pablo Ángel está muy agradecido por su gran cooperación en el anterior crédito, el cual le ayudo mucho a que su negocio y a tenido mas ventas.
Nueva mente está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir más en comprar mercancía y que sus clientas le están pidiendo que venda en esta temporada de invierno. Pero no quiere descapitalizar el negocio es por eso que está solicitando nueva mente su cooperación para está inversión de comprar mercancía para el negocio.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene del negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge Pablo Ángel is very grateful for your great cooperation with the previous loan. The loan greatly helped his business, and he has had more sales. He is asking for a loan again to be able to buy more merchandise, which his customers are asking that he sell this winter season. He does not want to take money out of his business. That is why he is once again asking for your cooperation for the purchase of merchandise for his business. He plans to pay the loan with part of the income he gets from the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Mery Giovana

texts.es: La Sra. Mery Giovanna, es hija de una antigua cliente la Sra Elsa , ella es casada y tiene 1 hija de 5 años y otro bebe por llegar, el esposo se dedica a la carpinteria, es empleado de una Empresa que fabrica muebles, ella invirtió su capital en  compra de un punto entel(llamadas) y venta de tarjetas de teléfono, al margen de ello se dedica a trabajo administrativo en una Empresa de limpieza a medio tiempo, es una pareja joven, quienes tienen buenas referencias por la zona.
texts.en:
Mery Giovanna is the daughter of Elsa, a long time client. She is married, has a five year old daughter, and has a baby on the way. Her husband, a carpenter, works for a business that makes furniture. She invested her money in an Entel (telephone company) shop and sells telephone calling cards. Besides this, she does administrative work part time for a cleaning business. They are a young couple with good references in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy telephone calling cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora  LUCILA S. I. tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito de LA ESPERANZA, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal VIRGEN DEL SOCORRO. Ella presenta estudios hasta 5to de primaria, refiere que por falta de recursos económicos ella empezó a trabajar desde pequeña como empleada del hogar, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 3 dependen económicamente de ella.
 La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra como: papeles, cartón, plástico, latas ,etc y también a al crianza de chanchos para su posterior venta. Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de chanchos.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró chatarra para vender.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles también lo utilizará para comprar chatarra al por mayor para luego venderla a las fábricas recicladoras.
También comprará chanchos para criarlos y posteriormente venderlos.
Lucila sueña con tener un criadero de chanchos para así generar mas dinero y poder brindarle suna mejor educación y calidad de vida a  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucila S. I. is 40 years old and lives in the District of La Esperanza, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen del Socorro”. Lucila has a 5th grade education. Due to a lack of financial resources, she had to quit school and find work as a housekeeper. She has 8 children of whom 3 are still dependents.

Lucila buys and sells scrap materials such as paper, cardboard, plastic, aluminum cans, etc. At the same, she also raises pigs for sale. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought scrap materials to sell.

With this loan of 800 soles, she will buy additional scrap materials in bulk so that she can sell them to recycling factories. She also will buy pigs to raise for later resale. Lucila dreams of owning a pig farm so that she can generate more income and provide her children with a good education and a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase scrap materials in bulk & pigs for breeding

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy general food products

loans.name: Blanca Justina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Damas responsables está conformado por un grupo de mujeres  capaces y luchadoras que tienen como prioridad sacar adelante a su familia a  pesar de los obstáculos que día a día deben surfear, además han formado un excelente ambiente y equipo de trabajo velando siempre el bienestar de todas sus integrantes, este banco está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca al sur del país en la región sierra centro.

La señora Blanca I. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive en la comunidad de Visorey  en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 63 años de edad, se encuentra casada y es madre de seis hijos de 44, 42, 40, 38, 36, 28 años, todos sus hijos son casados y viven independientemente,  solo vive con su esposo y un  nieto que  quedó huérfano al nacer, su esposo tiene 67 y  trabaja en su carpintería  desde hace veinte años que es el sustento diario,  fruto de su  trabajo conyugal lograron construir su  casa propia que aun les falta por terminar.

Blanca  trabaja en la carpintería con su esposo  y también realiza las actividades del hogar, debido a sus enfermedades de presión alta e infección renal no puede hacer mucho esfuerzo por lo que no puede llevar una vida normal y solo pasa ratos en su negocio nos manifiesta que se encuentra preocupada porque el trabajo ha decaído mucho porque existen otras alternativas de la madera y más barato.
 
Lleva seis  años trabajando en su bankito y los créditos obtenidos ha invertido en  su negocio y en su hogar, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue va a  comprar  madera para elaborar camas, armarios, etc. para tener abastecido su negocio.

Su mayor sueño es continuar con su negocio, ir incrementándolo ya que es el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
The Responsible Ladies Communal Bank is comprised of a group of capable and strong-willed women who make supporting their families a high priority. Despite the obstacles that surface on a daily basis, they have been able to form an excellent working team that looks out for the welfare of its members. The Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca, which lies in a mountainous region of southern Ecuador.

Sra. Blanca I. is a member of the Responsible Ladies Communal Bank. She lives in the neighborhood of Visorey in central Cuenca. She is 63 years old, married, and the mother of 6 children ranging in age from 28 to 44. All of her children are grown and live independently. Blanca and her husband are raising a grandson who was abandoned at birth. Her husband is 67 years old and has been working at his carpentry workshop for 20 years. This business has provided for their daily needs and enabled them to build a house, although it is still unfinished.

Blanca assists her husband in his workshop and also performs the household chores. Since she suffers from high blood pressure and kidney disease, she is not able to overextend herself and lead a normal life. She is also concerned about her business because orders have declined significantly because customers are finding alternatives to wood that are less expensive.

For six years, Blanca has been working with her Communal Bank. She invested her loans into her business and her home. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy wood for making beds, cupboards, and other pieces so that she will have inventory for her business.

Blanca’s biggest dream is to continue and grow her business since this is her family’s livelihood.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood for making furniture pieces

loans.name: Lester Enrique

texts.es: El joven  Lester M. de 25 años de edad,  vive junto con sus padres, el trabaja como guarda de seguridad en su centro de trabajo el nuevo pacto, de día ya que por la noche hay otro que resguarda el colegio, el estudia la universidad  para poder tener un futuro mejor a mucho esfuerzo ya que sus padres no pueden cubrir sus estudios ya que es lo mas caro la educación. Con este préstamo lograra comprar zinc para cambiar el techo del caraje que esta en mal estado. Ya que mientras este con sus padres le ayudara ya que siempre han sido unidos. Sus planes a futuro es poder concluir sus estudios y comenzar a buscar nueva plaza. Da las gracias a la institución por promover el financiamiento a muchas familias para lograr las mejoras de su negocio como vivienda.
texts.en:
Lester M. is 25 years old and lives with his parents. He works as a security guard at the New Covenant Center during the day. At night, he works another security job at a high school. Lester is taking university classes so that he can have a better future. Despite their hard work, his parents could not afford to pay for his educational expenses.

With this loan, Lester will purchase zinc so that he can replace the roof of his house because it is in bad condition. This will be a great help to his parents because they are such a close family. In the future, Lester plans to finish his education so that he can find a new job. He thanks the Institution for providing financing to many families so that they can improve their businesses and their housing situations.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
L. señora  MANUEL. ISABEL D. L. C. G. tiene 32 años, vive en el distrito D. FLORENCIA D. MORA, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento L. Libertad – Perú. L. socia tiene estudios hasta 3º D. secundaria, dejó D. estudiar debido a que salió embarazada. Tiene 3 hijos y todos dependen económicamente D. elL..
MANUEL. se dedica a L. confección D. calzado, únicamente para damas, se ha perfeccionado en L. fabricación D. calzado sport, algunas veces cubre pedidos para caballeros, pero en menor proporción. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró material para L. fabricación D. su calzado sport, como: plantas D. goma, D. jebe, suelas, entre otros.  Con este crédito D. 400.00 nuevos soles comprará material como: cuero, plantillas, hilos, hebillas, suelas, tacos, etc., para fabricar modelos nuevos D. zapatillas y calzado sport para damas y caballeros, dado que L. socia aprovechará las fiestas naviD.ñas e incrementará sus ganancias. 
MANUEL. sueña con vender sus productos en una tienda dentro del centro comercial ubicado en el Distrito D. Trujillo
texts.en:
Sra. ManueL. Isabel D. L. C. G. is 32 years old and lives in the District of Florencia D. Mora, Trujillo Province, Department of L. Libertad – Perú. After completing her education through the 3rd year of secondary school, she dropped out upon becoming pregnant. She now has 3 dependent children.

ManueL. manufactures shoes specifically for women. She has perfected her process for making athletic shoes. Sometimes she fulfills orders for men’s shoes, but to a lesser extent. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy materials for making athletic shoes such as rubber soles.

With this loan of 400 soles, she will buy materials such as leather, stencils, thread, buckles, soles, heels, and other items for making new models of shoes for women and men. She hopes to take advantage of the Christmas season so that she can increase her earnings. ManueL. dreams of selling her products at a store located in a shopping center in Trujillo District.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Kouma

texts.fr:
Kouma N. est un homme marié et père de 4 enfants. Il habite à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, une ville située à 120  kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un mécanicien  auto et avec ce prêt de Kiva, il voudrait acheter des pièces de rechanges afin de pouvoir réparer les voitures qui sont tombés en panne. Et aussi il voudrait renouveler certains de ses outils de travail qui ne sont plus en bonne état. Avec  les bénéfices obtenus de son travail, il voudrait économiser de l’argent en vue de mieux s’occuper de sa famille. 

FECECAV est une union de caisse créée en 1995 et agréée en 1997. Elle couvre la région des plateaux et maritime. Sa mission est de satisfaire les besoins financiers des populations de la région exclues du système financier classique. Elle compte aujourd hui plus de 50000 membres et entend étendre ses activités dans les autres localités environnantes de la région. FECECAV est à but non lucratif.
texts.en:
Kouma N. is a married man and the father of four children.  He lives in Lomé (capital of Togo), a city located 120 km from Kpalimé.  He is an automobile mechanic.  With this Kiva loan, he would like to buy replacement parts in order to repair cars that have broken down.  And also, he would like to refurbish some of his work tools, which are no longer in good shape.  With the profits obtained from his work, he would like to save some money with the aim of taking better care of his family. FECECAV is a savings union created in 1995 and approved in 1997.  It covers the region of Plateaux and Maritime.  Its mission is to meet the financial needs of the people in the region who are excluded from the standard financial system.  Today, FECECAV has over 50,000 members and plans on extending its activities to surrounding towns in the region.  FECECAV is a not-for-profit organization.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for the mechanics trade

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell

loans.name: Gladys Suzana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal  Damas responsables está conformado por un grupo de mujeres  capaces y luchadoras que tienen como prioridad sacar adelante a su familia a  pesar de los obstáculos que día a día deben surfear, además han formado un excelente ambiente y equipo de trabajo velando siempre el bienestar de todas sus integrantes, este banco está ubicado en la ciudad de Cuenca al sur del país en la región sierra centro.

Gladys Pérez es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsable, vive en Visorey en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 39 años de edad  felizmente casada fruto de su unión matrimonial  concibió dos hijos de 14 y 12 años respectivamente que en la actualidad estudian en el Colegio Técnico Chiquintad; su esposo tiene como profesión tapicero y con el trabajo de los dos lograron construir su casa propia.

 Gladys  y su esposo tienen un local de tapicería propio, nuestra socia trabaja junto a su esposo trabaja desde hace diez años y demás distribuye su tiempo entre la tapicería los quehaceres del hogar, su horario de atención es de 7 a.m. a 9 p.m. de lunes  a sábado hasta el medio día.

Gladys lleva cinco años trabajando en su banco comunal y los créditos obtenidos le han permitido ir comprando las herramientas para su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue  va a comprar materia prima como esponja, tornillos, cuerina, hilos,  telas, etc. para incrementar su taller y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es ayudar a sus hijos para que puedan culminar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Responsible Ladies Communal Bank is comprised of a group of capable and strong-willed women who make supporting their families a high priority. Despite the obstacles that surface on a daily basis, they have been able to form an excellent working team that looks out for the welfare of its members. The Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca, which lies in a mountainous region of southern Ecuador.

Gladys Pérez is a member of the Responsible Ladies Communal Bank. She lives in the neighborhood of Visorey in central Cuenca. Gladys is 39 years old and happily married. Her two children, ages 14 and 12 respectively, are currently students at Chiquintad Technical High School. Her husband is an upholsterer by profession and the couple’s hard work has enabled them to build their own home.

Gladys and her husband have operated a local upholstery shop for the past 10 years. She divides her time between managing the shop and performing her household chores. Their business is open from 7am to 9pm, Monday through Saturday.

For five years, Gladys has been a member of her Communal Bank. The loans she has obtained have enabled her to purchase tools for her business. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will buy materials such as sponges, screws, synthetic leather, thread, and fabrics so that she can grow her business and provide better service to her customers. Her greatest dream is to help her children with the completion of their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & supplies for her upholstery business

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es:
La señora  R. D. S. MARIA MARLENE tiene 49 años, vive en el distrito D. FLORENCIA D. MORA, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Maria estudió hasta 6º D. primaria. La socia está casada y tiene 5 hijos, D. los cuales solo 2 dependen económicamente D. ella.
Maria se dedica a la confección D. peluches y venta D. juguetes, como carritos, camioncitos, muñecas, ositos D. peluche, muñecas D. trapo, barbies, etc. Con su primer crédito D. 300.00 nuevos soles compró material para confeccionar sus peluches, papel D. regalo para envolver sus juguetes, y una vitrina. Con este crédito D. 600.00 nuevos soles comprará mas juguetes para cubrir pedidos para la navidad, puesto que esta proximo a celebrarse la navidad en diciembre. 
Maria sueña con tener su stand D. juguetería y peluches en el Distrito D. Trujillo.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Marlene Rodríguez D. S. is 49 years old and lives in the District of Florencia D. Mora, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. Maria has a 6th graD. education. She is married and has 5 children of whom 2 are dependents.

Maria makes stuffed animals and sells toys such as cars, trucks, dolls, teddy bears, rag dolls, Barbie dolls, etc. She used her first loan of 300 soles to buy material for making stuffed animals, gift wrapping paper, and a display case.

With this loan of 600 soles, Maria will buy toys so that she can fill her orders for the Christmas season. She hopes to open a toy store in Trujillo District.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase toys

loans.name: Yawa Akoélé

texts.fr:
Yawa Akoélé M. est une dame de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle habite à Lomé, la capitale du Togo, une ville située à 120  kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est une revendeuse des produits de l’alimentation générale. Avec ce crédit de Kiva, elle voudrait se ravitailler en achetant des cartons de sardines, de laits, de savons, de bougie, de l’allumette, de pâtes alimentaires, de détergents, de l’huile et autres. Avec ces bénéfices, elle aimerait s’occuper de ses 6 enfants sur le plan sanitaire qu’éducatif. 

FECECAV est une union de caisse créée en 1995 et agréée en 1997. Elle couvre la région des plateaux et maritime. Sa mission est de satisfaire les besoins financiers des populations de la région exclues du système financier classique. Elle compte aujourd hui plus de 50000 membres et entend étendre ses activités dans les autres localités environnantes de la région. FECECAV est à but non lucratif.
texts.en:
Yawa Akoélé M. is a 43-year-old woman, married, and the mother of six children.  She lives in Lomé (capital of Togo), a city located 120 km from Kpalimé.  She is a retailer of grocery items.  With this Kiva loan, she would like to resupply herself by buying boxes of the following:  sardines, milk, soaps, candles, matches, pasta, detergents, oil, and more.  With the profits, she would really like to take care of her six children with regard to sanitation and education. FECECAV is a savings union created in 1995 and approved in 1997.  It covers the region of Plateaux and Maritime.  Its mission is to meet the financial needs of the people in the region who are excluded from the standard financial system.  Today, FECECAV has over 50,000 members and plans on extending its activities to surrounding towns in the region.  FECECAV is a not-for-profit organization.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food items

loans.name: Jose Ruben

texts.es: El señor José Rubén de 39 años de edad, es director  del colegio nuevo pacto, se recibió en agronomía el cual su madre a mucho esfuerzo ayudo palmeando tortilla, pero luego se enfermo de los pulmones y murió, es por eso da gracias Adios por haber encontrado un trabajo estable pues lleva quince años laborando para el colegio, hoy en día vive con su esposa y dos hijos  los cuales espera dar una buena educación,  esta estudiando licenciatura en Pedagogía para obtener mejor conocimiento como mejor ingreso ya que por cada diploma es mejor pagada la plaza. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción  para hacer mejoras a su casa como cambiar el techo, y embaldosar enfrente de su casa ya que en el invierno se le hace difícil por el lodo para entrar es por eso ve la necesidad de hacer la mejora que gracias al apoyo de Afodenic hará posible estas mejora a su casa.
texts.en:
Sr. José Rubén is 39 years old and the director of New Covenant High School. He received a degree in agronomy, which was earned with the help of his mother who made tortillas by hand. She later passed away after developing a pulmonary illness, so he is thankful that he was able to say his final goodbyes. José eventually found steady work and has now been working at the school for 15 years. Today he lives with his wife and two children, whom he hopes to provide with a good education. He is studying for a teaching degree so that he can earn a better salary since additional credentials means an increase in pay.

With this loan, José will purchase construction materials for making home improvements such as replacing the roof and tiling the entrance to his house. With winter approaching, it will become more difficult to keep from tracking mud into the house. For this reason, he needs to make these improvements and thanks AFODENIC for providing the support to make this possible.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for replacing the roof & tiling the entrance of his house

loans.name: Vegaspamba (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Vegaspamba se formó  en la ciudad de Cuenca  en la comunidad del mismo nombre,  su gente se dedica a la agricultura principalmente  de maíz y hortalizas; este es un lugar muy famoso por sus coloridas fiestas, la música tradicional y costumbres como el palo encebado entre otras y los fuegos  artificiales son atractivos que atraen al turista nacional y extranjero. Los integrantes de este banco son en su mayoría familiares que se agruparon para buscar nuevas alternativas de producción y generar ingresos económicos para sus familias y conseguir una mejor calidad de vida.

La señora  Flor F. D. es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, ella  vive en la parroquia de San Joaquín a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 32 años de edad se separó de su esposo hace cuatro años por la incomprensión y falta de comunicación con su cónyuge, es madre de siete hijos de: 17, 12, 10, 9, 8, 6, 3 años, su primera hija trabaja como empleada domestica y le ayuda con los gastos de la casa,  sus otros hijos son estudiantes de primaria y secundaria, solo su hijo de nueve años vive con su abuela en la comunidad Vegaspamba, su casa es propia construida sólo de tablas y hojas de zinc.

Flor se dedica a la agricultura, siembra toda clase de  verduras que luego las vende en la feria libre o en los mercados de Cuenca,  esta actividad la vienen realizando por muchos años hereda de sus padres, sus laborares empiezan a las 4 de la mañana  todos los miércoles y sábado que son días de feria

Este es su cuarto ciclo trabajando con la institución y nos asegura que los créditos recibidos han invertido en la compra de semillas para sus cultivos y también ha recibido educación de cómo ahorrar; con el nuevo préstamo solicitado a la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR va  a comprar semillas de otras legumbres de ciclo rápido como lechuga, tomate, acelga, zanahoria,brócoli, etc.  y para la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos.

Su meta es incrementar sus cultivos y mejorar su situación económica para darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

La señora Rosa D. es socia del banco comunal Vegaspamba, vive en la comunidad del mismo nombre, tiene 57 años de edad, se encuentra separada hace 18 años que su  esposo la abandono con sus seis hijos, todos quienes ellos son  casados, su casa es propia fruto del duro trabajo de su juventud ahí vive con su  nieto que estudia en la  escuela de Vegaspamba, siendo única compañía.

Rosa se dedica a la artesanía teje chompas, y  hace seis años comenzó a tejer sogas y fueron sus compañeras de la comunidad quienes le enseñaron y ahora ella enseña a otras mujeres para que monten este tipo de negocio  en la comunidad, siendo el material principal los sacos de nylon.

Este es  su  cuarto ciclo trabajando con los prestamos que la fundación entrega y con ellos ha logrado mantener sus negocios y  nos comenta que le han ayudado en su negocio, con el nuevo préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR, le hace entrega lo va a invertir en la compra de sacos para su negocio y un poco para la comida de su hogar.

Su sueño es de tratar de estabilizarse económicamente.
texts.en:
The Vegaspamba Communal Bank was established in the community of the same name within the city of Cuenca. The residents engage in agriculture, primarily the cultivation of corn and vegetables. The area is well-known for its colorful festivals, traditional music, local customs (such as climbing the grease pole), fireworks, and numerous attractions that bring in domestic and foreign tourists. The Communal Bank consists of members who are related to one another. They are looking for new ways to be productive and generate income so that their families can have a better quality of life.

Sra. Flor F. D. is a member of the Vegaspamba Communal Bank. She lives in the San Joaquin Parrish located on the outskirts of Cuenca. She is 32 years old and has been separated from her husband for four years as a result of misunderstandings and a lack of communication. Flor is the mother of seven children ranging in age from 3 to 17. Her oldest daughter works as a housekeeper in order to help with the household expenses. The other children are students in either elementary or secondary school. Only her nine year old son lives with his grandmother in the community of Vegaspamba. Flor’s house is made only of boards and sheets of zinc.

Flor is engaged in agriculture, planting all types of vegetables so that she can sell them at the open fair or in the markets of Cuenca. She has been farming for many years since she learned the trade from her parents. Her work begins every day at 4am. On Wednesdays and Saturdays, she travels to the fair.

This is her fourth cycle working with the Institution. She used her previous loans to purchase seeds for planting crops. Flor also received training on how to save money. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will purchase seeds for growing lettuce, tomatoes, spinach, carrots, broccoli, and other vegetables. Part of the money will be used to buy school supplies for her children.

Her goal is to increase her crop output and improve her financial situation so that her children can have a better future.

Sra. Rosa D. is also a member of the Vegaspamba Communal Bank and lives in the community of the same name. She is 57 years old and has been separated for 18 years when her husband abandoned the family. Rosa has six children, all of whom are married. Her home is a result of all the hard work she has performed since she was a young woman. Rosa currently lives with her grandson, who attends school in Vegaspamba. He is the only person who provides her company.

Rosa produces handmade sweaters. She took up weaving six years ago when friends from the neighborhood taught her this skill. Rosa now instructs other women how to start this type of business in their own communities. The women she teaches produce mainly nylon bags.
