Rosa is participating in her fourth cycle with the Foundation. She says that her previous loans were a great help because they enabled her to maintain her business. With this new loan from Fundación ESPOIR, she will purchase bags for her business and some food for household consumption.

Rosa hopes to remain financially stable.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their various business activities

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es: La cliente Noelia  trabaja en esta actividad desde hace tres años, su esposo se dedica a trabajos de publicidad, forman una pareja joven, aún no tienen hijos,por el momento necesita mayor capital ya que por las fiestas de fin de año ella tiene varios pedidos de electrodomesticos, con el credito anterior ella compro licuadoras y zumidoras; con este, ella pretende comprar DVDs, sandwicheras y otros artefactos que le piden sus clientes. La Sra. vive en la zona los rosales, ubicado aproximadamente a 20 Km de la ciudad de La Paz
texts.en:
Our client Noelia has been in the retail business for three years, while her husband works as a publicist. This young couple does not have any children yet.

At the moment, she needs additional capital in time for the year-end holidays. She has several orders for various electrical appliances. Noelia used her previous loan to buy blenders and juicers. With this loan, she intends to buy DVDs, sandwich makers, and other devices requested by her customers. Noelia lives in Los Rosales district, which is located approximately 20 km from the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy gynecological equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grocery items

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La señora P. C. FLORENCIA, tiene  48 años, vive en el distrito de El Porvenir, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal ESFUERZO DE MUJERES II. Ella presenta estudios hasta 6º de primaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de desayunos, gelatinas, sanguches y gracias a los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, pudo poner un locutorio. Ella tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, los cuales no dependen económicamente de ella.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles compró baldes para transportar su leche, avena, quinua para vender sus desayunos. Con este préstamos de 800.00 nuevos soles, comprará una fotocopiadora.
FLORENCIA, sueña con incrementar su negocio y poder tener una bodega bien surtida.
texts.en:
Sra. Florencia C. P. is 48 years old and lives in the district of El Porvenir, Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad – Perú. She is a member of Communal Bank “Esfuerzo de Mujeres II”. Florencia has a sixth grade education and is the mother of two adult children.

She sells breakfasts, gelatin, and sandwiches. Thanks to her loans from Manuela Ramos, she was able to open a call center. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought milk, oatmeal, and quinoa for preparing and selling breakfasts. With her new loan of 800 soles, she will buy a photocopier.

Florencia dreams of growing her business and opening a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
La señora EDELMIRA S. A., tiene 51 años, vive en el distrito de Las Delicias, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal LUIS ALBERTO S.. Presenta estudios hasta 5to de secundaria, es casada y tiene 6 hijos  de los cuales solo 1 depende económicamente de ella.
La socia se dedica a la preparación de menú (comida), ella lleva sus productos a repartir a sus comensales que trabajan en las fábricas cercanas. Con su primer crédito compró arroz, papas, fideos, atún, menestras, aceite,  pollo, carne de res,  etc. para preparar sus menús.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará también productos alimenticios como: arroz, papas, azúcar, fideos, menestras, atún, aceite, etc., también comprará tapers  para a servir los menús. Edelmira sueña con tener un restaurante para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edelmira S. A. is 51 years old and lives in the Las Delicias district of the Trujillo province in La Libertad, Peru. She is a member of the Community Bank “Luis Alberto S.”. She has a high school education, is married and has six children, of whom only one is economically dependent on her. Her business is food preparation, and she sells her products to nearby factory workers. With her first loan, she purchased rice, potatoes, noodles, tuna, soup, oil, chicken, beef, etc with which to prepare her dishes. With this new loan of 800 nuevos soles, she will purchase more food products such as rice, potatoes, sugar, noodles, soup, tuna, and oil, as well as containers in which to serve the food. Edelmira dreams of having her own restaurant and earning more profits.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase food ingredients and containers

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: Gisela es una socia emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Yarinacocha región de Ucayali, tiene 30 años, es madre de D. hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica al alquiler de motocar, actividad que realiza junto con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuevo  edén” desde hace un año, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo utilizó para el mantenimiento de su motocar. En la actualidad, Gisela necesita un crédito de 1200 soles, que será utilizado en la compra de un motocar de segundo uso. La meta de Gisela es tener  un terreno propio para construir su casa.
texts.en:
Gisela is an enterprising and hardworking woman who lives in the city of Yarinacocha in the Ucayali region. She is 30 years old and is the mother of two minor children. She rents motocars, (3-wheeled, light vehicles), in a business that she runs with her husband. She has been a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Eden" for a year. For her first loan she received 300 soles, which she used to maintain her motocar. Currently she needs a loan of 1200 soles, which will be used to buy a used motocar. Gisela's goal is to have her own land where she can build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a used motocar

loans.name: Grover Alberto

texts.es: El señor Grover es un cliente antiguo que trabajo con el Grupo solidario "Angeles" desde el año 2002 y desde el 2006 comenzo a trabajar con credito individual en cuatro secuencias, hoy el cliente vuelve despues de 2 años de descanso. Hace un par de años el señor Grover se dedicaba a la peluqueria pero como el negocio no iba muy bien decidio cambiar de aires y comenzo un nuevo trabajo, por recomendacion de un amigo en una empresa que se dedica a la jardineria, paisajismo y mantenimiento de ambientes. Tras dos años trabajando con esa empresa el señor Grover vio en este rubro una gran oportunidad y que con sacrificio y su creatividad este podria llegar a ser una buena fuente de ingresos para su familia, ya van 7 meses que Grover se independizo y hoy cuenta con cuatro clientes fijos, tiene un contrato con un Hotel  y este mes de noviembre comenzo a trabajar por recomendacion de uno de sus jefes en otro Hotel de cinco estrellas, es por eso que el cliente vino a solicitar un prestamo para invertir en herramientas y maquinaria que le serviran para agilizar sus servicios y asi poder atender mas clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Grover is a former client who has worked with the communal bank "Angeles" since 2002. Also, since 2006 he began to take out loans on an individual basis and he completed 4 loan cycles; today he returns after an interval of two years. For 2 years Señor Grover worked as a hairdresser but since that business was not doing well he decided on a change of pace and started a new job on the recommendation of a friend, in a company that does gardening, landscaping and other outdoor maintenance. After 2 years working with this firm Señor Grover saw a great opportunity in this line of work, and that with some sacrifice and creativity this could end up being a good source of income for his family. It's now been 7 months that Grover has been working independently, and today he has 4 regular customers. He has a contract with a hotel, and in this month of November he started to work for another five star hotel, based on the recommendation of one of his former bosses. For this reason he has come to request a loan to invest in tools and machinery that will help to speed up his services so that he can serve more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy machinery and tools for his trade as a gardener

loans.name: Dione Cecilia

texts.es: Dione Cecilia es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 28 años, es madre soltera de un niño, Diana se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, pues tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Flor de la Canela II” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue 300 soles que lo utilizó en la compra de telas. En la actualidad Diana necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de una remalladora  con el fin de obtener buenos acabados de las prendas que confecciona. La meta de Diana es llegar a tener un taller de costura bien implementado.
texts.en:
Dione Cecilia is a hard working and dynamic woman. She lives in Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region, is 28 years old, and is a single mother of one child. Diana is a tailor and has a small workshop in her home. She has been a member of the Community Bank “Flor de la Canela II” for one year, and the first loan she took out was for 300 soles and was used for purchasing fabric. Currently, Diana needs a loan of 1000 soles, which she will use to purchase a sewing machine so the garments she makes will be better produced. Diana’s goal is to have a well established tailor shop.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical supplies

loans.name: Faalagilagi

texts.en:
Faalagilagi T. is a 36-year-old woman living in the town of Samalaeulu Leauvaa. She is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Faalagilagi owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Faalagilagi has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 350 WST a month from these activities.

In 2007, Faalagilagi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Faalagilagi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Faalagilagi is now requesting a new loan of 1,500 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Faalagilagi plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Mario Alejandro

texts.es: El señor Mario Alejandro es padre de 2 hijos, el trabaja en maquiladora desde hace 6 años, su esposa se queda al cuidado de sus hijos y al hogar. Mario siempre se preocupa por el bienestar de la familia es por ello que hay veces que trabaja tiempo extra para tener un ingreso mas y darles una mejor calidad de vida. Ahora se viene la temporada de frío el cual observa que su hijos están mas grandes y las prendas del año pasado les queda muy pequeña. Mario no quiere que su familia se vea afectada con el virus que hoy en día esta surgiendo en el mundo, es por ello que requiere un préstamo para comprar vitaminas que prevengan las enfermedades de las vías respiratorias y ropa de invierno con el fin de que sus hijos tengan buena salud.
texts.en:
Mr. Mario Alejandro is the father of 2 children. He has worked in an assembly plant for the past 6 years. His wife looks after their children and the home. Mario has always worried about the wellbeing of his family. There are times that he works overtime to augment his income and give them a better quality of life. Now the cold weather is coming and he has noticed that his children have grown and last year’s clothing is too small. Mario does not want his family to be infected with the virus that is currently appearing in the world and, for this reason, is requesting a loan to buy winter clothing for his children to help keep them in good health.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ropa de Invierno

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy supplies for the creation of lollipops

loans.name: Ynelsa

texts.es:
La señora Ynelsa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Ynelsa, es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, así que decidió poner su propio negocio de ventas de bebidas gasificadas, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa. Es ella quien administra su negocio, sin tener un horario y un jefe. Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 50.00 y empezó comprando 03 paquetes de gaseosas,  vio que le iba muy bien y que le falto sus gaseosas, poco a poco fue invirtiendo mas.

En la Actualidad, continua con el mismo negocio y ya es conocida por sus clientes que son sus vecinos, familiares y amigos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará más bebidas como: paquetes de gaseosas en diferentes sabores, tamaños y marcas, como también agua mineral con gas y sin gas.
 
Ynelsa, tiene muchas metas por delante y se siente muy motivada, así poder hacer realidad  sus sueños y lo que se propone. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla cuando mas lo necesitaba, es responsable con sus cuotas de pago y piensa seguir así.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ynelsa belongs to the “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda” (Banda Women in Action) Community Bank which is in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, in the San Martín province and administrative district. She is 34 years old, in a common-law relationship and has 2 children who are still dependent on her. Ynelsa is a woman who likes to work and thus decided to start her own business selling soft drinks in well air-conditioned area located in her own home. She manages her business without having a schedule or a boss. She began with 50 Nuevo soles that bought her three cases of sodas. Seeing that she was so well situated she ran out of drinks, little by little she began investing more. Today, she is still in the same business and is well known by her customers, most of whom are her neighbors, family and friends. With this loan of 800 Nuevo soles, she will buy more soft drinks in different flavors, sizes and brands, as well as carbonated and uncarbonated mineral water. Ynelsa has many goals and feels very motivated to make her dreams come true. She is thankful to the “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” for helping her when she most needed it. She is responsible with her payments and plans to continue in this way.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Saria

texts.es:
La señora Saria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 34 años y madre de 02  hijos, los 02 que aun depende de ella.

Saria, es una mujer perseverante y capaz. Se dedica a la venta de ropas, en un lugar muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa y nos cuenta que le esta yendo muy bien, cuenta con clientes que ya la conocen y saben de su negocio. 
La fortaleza y la perseverancia que le caracteriza, le ayudo a crecer como mujer independientemente y esta muy orgullosa con lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará  más mercadería de ropas para surtir su stock como: pantalones, shorts, blusas en todas las tallas y modelos, polos y vestidos para adultos y niñas. 

Se siente una mujer establecida y trabajadora y agradece la oportunidad que el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  la ha ofrecido, para así desarrollarse como mujer y pequeña empresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Saria is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, located in the Banda de Shilcayo district, in the San Martin province and department. She is 34 years old and lives with her domestic partner and two children who still depend on her.
Saria is a very capable and determined woman. She sells clothes from a room in her house. She tells us that her business is going well due to her loyal clientele. Her strength and perseverance has helped her grow as an independent woman and she is very proud of her accomplishments.
The loan she is requesting (S/. 1,200.00) will be used to buy clothes, such as, pants, shorts, shirts, sweaters and dresses, to stock her inventory.
Saria is an established and hard working woman. She is thankful for the opportunity that Movimiento Manuela Ramos has given her to grow as a woman and as a small entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La señora Enith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 49 años y 07 hijos, 03 que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su bodega a comprar porque en ella encuentran, todo los productos  que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Enith, se siente con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando y muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Sra. Enith is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres en Acción de la Banda”, which is located in the District of Banda de Shilcayo, San Martín Province, Department of San Martín. She is 49 years old, married, and has 7 children of whom 3 are school-aged dependents.

Her personality and desire to fulfill her dreams are the reasons that motivated to start her own grocery store. With the proceeds from her business, she is able to contribute to the household expenses. She has been steadily gaining customers since the start of her business. Today she has a fixed clientele who come to her store to shop because she has all the necessities one could ever need. Enith welcomes each customer with her charming personality.

With this loan of 1200 soles, she will purchase sacks of rice and sugar, cookies, packaged noodles, salt, milk, various brands of canned fish, crates of eggs, and toiletries so that she can provide better service to her customers. Enith looks forward to continuing working. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping women like her and providing them with opportunities to develop in the communities where they operate.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy groceries to increase her stock.

loans.name: Prak

texts.en: Mrs. Prak T. is 42 years old and a resident of Kampong Chhnang province. Prak T. currently works sewing clothes for a garment factory and gets a specific salary of $90 per month. She is married with two children. Her husband’s name is Mr. Nhem Sitha, age 52, and he is a retired soldier (he is pictured here). He is a disabled person from the civil war. Because Prak T.’s husband doesn’t have a job, Prak T. would like to borrow the money from Kiva through HKL which she will use to buy piglets for her husband to raise and buy charcoal to sell and earn extra profit.

loans.use: To buy piglets for her husband to raise and buy charcoal to sell for extra profits

loans.name: Zaldy

texts.en: Zaldy Q. is from the city of Oroquieta. He is 49 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Zaldy owns and operates a business selling rice in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2001, Zaldy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Zaldy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 6th from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Po

texts.en: Po S. is a 29-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. Po S. is married to Koung Noeun, age 30. This couple work together in the farming business, and have been married for many years, but do not yet have children. Due to the coming rice farming season, Po S. wants to purchase a rice cultivating machine which she will use to improve the farming business. As she is not enough money to buy one, Po S. has decided to request a loan of USD$500 to add along with her savings to buy a machine. She proposes to rent the new machine out to other farmers to earn rental fees.

loans.use: To purchase a rice cultivating machine

loans.name: Thai

texts.en: Thai S., 26, is married with two children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, her husband is involved in a business of repairing electronic equipment such as stereos, televisions, and radios. He earns an income of US $6 per day and is the primary source of income for the family to help cover the family expenses. Mrs. S. is a housewife who stays at home, looking after the two young children and the household chores. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Mrs. S. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more electronic spare parts to expand her husbands business.

loans.use: To buy electronic spare parts

loans.name: Rad

texts.en: Rad S., 33, is married with three school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she and her husband are engaged in a business of selling fish at the market, earning collectively an income of US $10 per day to help cover the family expenses. They help each other in the business to ensure that their new and existing customers are satisfied with their services. Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. S. is asking for a loan of US $700 to purchase a kind of Cambodian food (Pror Huk) made from fish to stock and resell at retail for a higher price.

loans.use: To buy supplies of fish  (Pror Huk) for resale

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn S., 31, is a widow with two school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in the business of selling hand-made products (bags and small flat baskets), earning approximately an income of US $6 per day. She is  the primary source of income for the family to help cover the family expenses.  

Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $900 to purchase Cambodian hand-made products for resale.

loans.use: To buy supplies of Cambodian hand-made products for resale

loans.name: So

texts.en: So Y., 42 years old, is a widow and mother of five children. Four of the children are married and live away from the family home, while otherchild, a single daughter, helps the family by working in the garment factory. So Y. is currently working on the farm and is planting a rice crop. Recently, her house has required frequent repairs and this has had an effect on her living situation. Therefore, So Y. needs to borrow a loan to purchase materials to repair her house.

loans.use: To purchase materials to repair her house

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita N. is from the village of Makawa. She is 37 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Angelita owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling nipa huts (the native house constructed out of bamboo with a thatched roof using leaves of the nipa palm) to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month. In 2005, Angelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. Angelita is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Rech

texts.en:
Rech P., 49, is married with nine children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. Mrs. P. is a housewife who stays at home and looks after the children and household chores. Both Mrs. P. and her husband’s living depend on the support of their four children who are currently employed at various workplaces. Most of them are construction workers who are able to earn enough for their living and to help cover the family expenses.

Mrs. P. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. This is her third loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. P. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her children to commute to work easily. By doing so, she will be able to cut back on public transportation expenses. (Rech P. is pictured with two of her children.)

loans.use: buy a motorbike

loans.name: Hourn

texts.en:
Hourn E., 32, is marriE. with two school-agE. children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engagE. in a business of Cambodian traditional cakes and grinding tamarinds as food to sell, earning approximately an income of US$ 3 per day.

This is her third loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her husband is employE. as a construction worker, earning an income of US$ 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Mrs. E. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, E. is asking for a loan of US$ 800 to purchase pigs to raise and sell when the price is good enough to make a reasonable profit.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Hong S., 29, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she and her husband are engaged in a business of raising pigs for sale, earning collectively an income of US$ 10 per day as a primary source of income for the family. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more pigs to raise for sale.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Prem

texts.en:
Prem B. is 26 years old and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap province. Since 2006, she has been raising pigs to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 3 per day, while her husband, pictured here, is a fisherman who makes around US$ 6 every day. The two children are in school.

Prem B. told to a loan officer that she typically spends about US$ 40 on food and US$ 5 on utilities. To make more investments in order to allow her husband more money, she has requested a loan of US$ 800 which her husband needs to purchase a wooden boat and fishing tools.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat and fishing tools.

loans.name: Yi

texts.en:
Yi S., 27, is married with a school-aged child. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband (pictured) and child. To make a living, she and her husband are engaged in a business of buying cows from the local farmers in the province and selling beef at a local market in the town, earning collectively an income of US$15 per day. This primary source of income helps cover the family expenses and support the child’s studies.

This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Sareth and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, Sareth is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase more cows to expand her current business.

loans.use: buy more cows

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal S., age 40 and her husband, Mr. Phally Sam, age 40, have been married since 1992 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. They are living in a small village along National Road number 2, about 20 kilometers of Phnom Penh City.

Sophal has operated a grocery store from in front of her house for 10 years. Her husband has been a construction contractor for 17 years. She is asking for her first loan of $800 in order to landscape her property and build a fence around of her house.

loans.use: To landscape her property and build a fence around of her house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Mrs. Gloria L. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, is married, and is blessed with five adult children. Gloria owns and operates a banana plantation. She has been engaged in this business for more than eight years and earns Php 2,000 monthly net income from her business. In 2001, Gloria joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 11th loan in the amount of Php 6,000 which will be used as additional capital for her plantation. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann H. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and four of her children in the Siem Reap province. She is a good house wife who stays at home looks after her children and cooks for the family. Her husband, pictured here, has a business as a moto-taxi driver. He typically makes about US$8 a day. Three of the children are in school and one is at home. Vann H. would like to take out a loan of US$300 as her husband needs to repair his broken moto.

loans.use: To repair a broken moto-taxi

loans.name: Chhom

texts.en:
Chhom S., 36, is married with five children. She resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. She is a housewife. To make a living, her husband operates his own business as an electronics repairman. He repairs some electronic devices such as speakers and microphones, earning an income of US $8 per day to help cover the family expenses.

This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $400 to purchase a qualified loud speaker to rent for any special ceremony in the province.

loans.use: To buy speakers to rent

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Vending vegetables is the business of Carmelita G.. She is married to Arcenio G. and they are blessed with three children: Melicio, 26 years old, who is a college undergraduate; Rolando, 23 years old; and the youngest is Marieta, 21 years old, who is a college graduate.

Carmelita would like to buy additional kinds of vegetables so that she could also generate a bigger income.  But the income she generates is not enough to purchase more vegetables, so that’s why she is requesting a loan amount of Php 5,000 from Kiva lenders allowing her to buy more vegetables. She hopes that lenders will approve her requested loan as it is a big help for the productivity of her business.

loans.use: Additional capital for business improvement

loans.name: Nuon

texts.en:
Nuon Y. is 30 years old and lives with her husband and three of her children in the Siem Reap province. She is a good housewife who stays at home, looks after the children and cooks for the family members.

Her husband, pictured here, has a business as a fisherman. He typically makes about US $5 a day. Two of the children are in school and one is too young to attend. Nuon Y. would like to take out a loan of US $400 which her husband needs to purchase materials to make fishing traps.

loans.use: Make fishing traps.

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Savoeun P., age 22 and his wife, Mrs. Sokna Aun, age 21, (shown in the photo ) live in a small village along the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2006 and just have a young son.

Savoeun and his wife are silk weavers. They sell their finished products to the middleman in the village who then distributes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. In addition, Savoeun also grows rice.

Savoeun is requesting his third loan of $500 to purchase silk materials to continue his weaving business. He will also use part of the loan for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for his weaving business and to use for growing rice

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Ham S., 48, is a widowed farmer who lives in Siem Reap with six of her children. She grows and sells rice. On average, she is able to make US$ 2 each day. She is also supported by four of the children; three are construction workers and one is a chef in a hotel.

Ham S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Kimsean

texts.en:
Mr. Kimsean T., age 52, and his wife, Mrs. Chamroeun Chan, age 46, live in a small village along National Road Number Three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1983 and have three sons. One of them is married, one is a construction worker and the other one is in school.

Kimsean has been a soldier since 1981, while his wife is a cleaner. He is applying for his first loan of US$ 1,000 in order to purchase a shop for his daughter-in-law to sell grocery items.

loans.use: To buy a shop for his daughter in-law to sell grocery items

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Huon S., 43, is married and lives with four of her children in Siem Reap province. She and her husband are fish sellers who typically make about US$ 5 each day and are supported by one child working on a construction site.

Huon S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase fish for sale. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: buying fish to sell

loans.name: Peat

texts.en:
Peat S. is 30 years old and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She sells porridge and rice noodles to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 6 in profit each day, while her husband works on a construction site and is able to make US$ 5 per day. This couple has four children, three of whom are in school while one is too young to attend school.

Peat S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 500 to fix her leaking roof.

loans.use: Fix leaking roof

loans.name: May

texts.en:
Mr. May M. is 38 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been operating a workshop next to his house for a long time, providing a service repairing motorbikes and bicycles. He currently makes an income of US$ 4 per day to support his family.

May M. is married to Pheap, 22, who is a good housewife and who makes a living planting a little vegetable patch on her own farmland. May M. is applying for his second loan to buy more vehicle accessories to better meet the needs of his customers.

Note: May M. was busy at his business activities, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy more vehicle accessories to better meet the needs of his customers

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok C., 37, is married with three children. She resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, with her husband (pictured) and children.

C. is engaged in a business sewing and designing clothes for her new and existing customers, earning an income of approximately US$5 per day.

This is C.’s fifth loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her husband is a construction foreman and has to travel all over the province for his work, earning an income of US$7 per day to help cover the family expenses. Mrs. C. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US$1,000 to purchase more construction supplies to aid her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for her husband's business

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Samoeun T., age 39, and his wife, Mrs. Pisethy Kosal, age 25, have been married for five years. They have one son and one daughter. The family lives in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Samoeun has been an electrician for one year, while his wife has been selling roast beef in front of her house for one year as well. Samoeun is requesting his first loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana A. was born in the village of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. She is happily married to Antonio A. who is a farmer in their village. They are blessed with two children, namely: Abigail, 16, a first year college student taking Information Technology; and Claribel, 15 years old and a senior high school student.

Dressmaking or sewing is the main source of income for Damiana and she has been engaged in this business for almost thirty years now. She shared that her desire to help her husband support their financial needs motivated her to venture in her business. Through her dedication and commitment to her business she has earned income to support the education of her children.

But her income is not enough, especially now that one of her children is already in college. Thus, she wants to obtain a loan of Php 20,000 from Kiva lenders to buy more cloth for her to make more dresses to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cloth to make more dresses to sell

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Run S., 38, is married and lives with her four children in Siem Reap province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$ 6 each day, while her husband works as a construction worker. Her husband makes about US$ 5 each day.

Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also been a factor in making the price of rice very high.

Run S. is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 to make a new investment. She wants to open a wash moto garage. She is confident that this will be a good business venture and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: Open wash moto garage.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Kan S., 28, is married with three children. She resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business producing rice wine, earning approximately an income of US$ 3 per day. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

Her husband operates his motorbike as a motor taxi driver in the province, earning an income of US$ 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Mrs. S. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US$ 900 to purchase pigs to raise for sale.

loans.use: buy pigs to raise

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mr. Moeun N., 57, and his wife, Mrs. Yen Teav, 55, live along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1971 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home and the other one attends school.

Moeun and his wife have been selling fruit for 2 years. They hope to expand their business; it will be better for them to manage income for supporting their family. So, Moeun is asking for his first loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase fruit on contract for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruit on contract for resale

loans.name: Kleung

texts.en:
Kleung Y. is 40 years old and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province. She works in a massage club to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 2.50 per day, while her husband, pictured here, is a construction worker who makes an average of around US$ 4 each day. This couple has three children, two of whom are in school and one is a chef.

Kleung Y. would like to take out a loan of US$ 800 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita P. is from the village of Canubay. She is 58 years old. Anita is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Anita owns and operates a "sari-sari" store viand-vending business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In the year 2000, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Anita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Nun K. is 22 years old and resides with her husband and two young children in Siem Reap province. Since 2004, she has been raising pigs and chickens to earn a living and is able to make about US$ 1 per day, while her husband has a business selling firewood and typically makes US$ 3 every day.

Nun K. told to a loan officer that she typically spends about US$ 23 on food and US$ 2 on utilities. Nun K. is asking for a loan of US$ 700 which her husband needs to purchase a motorbike trailer to transport wood.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike a trailer to transport wood

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal C., 35, and her husband, Mr. Ran Lun, 40, married in 1991 and have one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. They are living on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sophal has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village where she lives, and the middleman then takes take them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

Mr. Ran Lun has been selling cows, oxen and horses since he was married. He hopes to buy more cows, oxen and horses for resale; he will be able to generate much income at the same time. 

Hence Sophal is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to provide capital for her husband to expand his business.

loans.use: provide capital for her husband to purchase more cows, etc.

loans.name: Peuk

texts.en:
Peuk S. is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two school-aged children in Siem Reap province. She is a good housewife who stays at home and looks after the children and cooks for the family members. Her husband is a construction worker building houses. He typically makes about US$ 10 a day.

Peuk S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 for her husband who needs to purchase construction tools.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools

loans.name: Snguon

texts.en:
Mrs. Snguon S. is 51 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province. She has given birth to four children, who are married and live in their own homes. For many years, she has serviced her neighbors by grinding their rice for flour with her flouring machine. She typically earns a profit of approximately $4 a day.

Her husband, Phout Choum, is 53 years old. Since 2007, he's been making a living by repairing and washing vehicles at his home. He normally earns about $3 a day. Snguon S. has used her machine for a long time, and recently it has often broken during the processing.

Snguon S. would like a loan of $1200 in order to buy a new grinding machine.

loans.use: To buy a new grinding machine

loans.name: Percival

texts.en:
Percival has been a hog raiser for two years.  However, her income is not enough to meet the needs of her family.  Because of this, she is asking for financial capital amounting to PHP 7,000 that she needs to purchase a supply of feed and additional piglets to raise.  She is also planning to renovate her pig pens after one year. 

Percival is married to Miguel, a carpenter and a farmer.  The couple were blessed with four children: Victorino, Jerry, Mary Grace, and Visitacion.  Three of them are already married. She hopes that the  lenders will grant her requested loan.

loans.use: To purchase a supply of feed and additonal piglets

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
At the age of 40, Leticia has been engaged in a livestock business, specifically raising ducks, for almost two years. Wanting to expand her business into a hog raising business, she has decided to borrow a PHP 7,000 loan from KIVA lenders. She will use the funds to buy hogs, as well as additional ducks, to raise. Her net monthly income in the duck raising business is PHP 1,000, which is very essential for their daily needs. She wants to expand her business to produce more income. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her loan.

Leticia is married to Jimmy A., who works as a carpenter in their village. Their marriage had been blessed with two children: Jake Anthony, four years old, and Christian Jay, three years old. The family resides in the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural and plain area. She wants her children to have a better future, that's why Leticia and her husband work hard to support their family.

loans.use: Additional capital for her duck raising  and for business expansion.

loans.name: Chilhaa

texts.en:
N. is 50 years old and lives by herself in the Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. She lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. N. operates a business in her town sewing clothes. She started her business in 2005, out of a rented booth, and now her working capital exceeds 700,000 tugrugs (~492 USD). In the past, she has gotten a loan from Xac bank, one of the largest banks in Mongolia, and has paid back the loan in full and on time. She would like to own a workshop in the future where she can sew her clothes. N. is requesting a loan of 700,000 tugrug  (~492 USD) in order to purchase fabric and finishing materials for her business.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and finishing materials for her business

loans.name: Shinehuu

texts.en:
S. is 33 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a house in the Gobi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her son, 12, attends a local secondary school while her daughter, 2, still stays at home. With the help of her husband, S. operates a grocery business in her town. She began her business in 2000 with a small shop and now her working capital exceeds 10,000,000 tugrug (~7000 USD). She travels to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, twice per month in order to purchase goods for her business. 

Since beginning her business, she has been able to purchase a car and a microbus as well as hire two salespeople for the shop. She has received two loans from Khaan bank in the past and has proven herself to be a trustworthy customer by paying back the loans in full and on time. She is a very hardworking person who wants to keep growing her business in the future. S. is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~1400 USD) loan in order to purchase a large amount of products for her shop.

XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.

To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of products for her shop.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Mrs. Hen U., 51 years old, and her husband, Mr. Nai Sok, 52 years old, have been married since 1975 and have 6 children: 2 sons and 4 daughters. Unfortunately, one of the children died. Two children are married and live outside the family home and the other two are garment factory workers. The family lives along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
Hen and her husband have been growing rice for 30 years. They grow the rice on their farmland in the village. Hen doesn’t have enough capital to develop her rice farm. This is why she is applying for her first loan of $700 to purchase fertilizer, pesticide and to pay the fees for plowing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Imelda Rene

texts.en: Mrs. L. is from the town of Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is married, and blessed with five adult children. Mrs. L. owns and operates a business selling used clothes in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for more than eight years, earning Php 8,000 monthly net income. She also has a remittance from her daughter from abroad as another source of income. Now, Mrs. L. is obtaining her 4th loan in the amount of Php 4,000 which will be used as additional capital for her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Nov H., 50, is married and has five children. Three of his children are enrolled in a local high school. He resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with his wife (pictured) and children. He is a village chief, earning an income of approximately US $5 per day. This is his first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. His wife, Soleang, is a housewife. Mr. H. and his family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, H. is asking for a loan of US $500 to purchase a motorbike for one of his children to travel to school easily. By doing so, H. hopes that his family will be able to cut back on public transportation expenses.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Chhet

texts.en: Chhet L. was born in 1980. She is a married woman and blessed with a young school-aged child. Her 33-year-old husband, Chanthol, works as a local merchantman. He also orders produce in bulk and deals in retail to the market seller. To make a living, Chhet L. has built a pigpen behind her house where she raises many pigs for a profit. Due to the fact that the rice harvest is approaching, Chhet L. is requesting a loan for her husband to use as capital in order to buy rice at the cheapest price from the farmers. They propose to sell when the rice is commanding the highest price.

loans.use: To buys rice at cheapest price from farmers and they propose to sell it when the rice is commanding highest price

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is 26 years old. She is married to Joel, her partner in managing their electronic shop in their village in Quezon, San Isidro. According to Evelyn, through hard work and patience, she and her husband can uplift their way of living.  Evelyn would like to request financial assistance from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP 5,000.  This will be of great help towards maintaining their repair shop and to purchase the necessary materials for repairing televisions and other kinds of appliances. Evelyn hopes that her loan will be granted so their income will increase and that they will be able to save for their future.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase materials needed for their repair shop.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Living a life full of challenges is not easy for Felomina B., 52 years old. She manages a water refilling station in their village. Additionally she has a typical retail store, and a livestock business. Her major source of income is farming. Each crop harvest, she has a net income of PHP 5,000.00. From her retail store and water refilling, she has a net income of PHP 3,000.00 per month. She wants to request a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.00 for additional capital. She will use the funds to maintain her businesses, especially for her water refilling station. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her loan as soon as possible.

She is married to Felizardo B., and they are blessed with two children. Both of the children are already married, the eldest is a tricycle driver and the youngest is a domestic helper abroad. Sometimes, Felomina gets a remittance from her daughter, and even her son helps her in her business. She says that she feels so blessed because she has a lot of friends who have always supported her throughout her life.

loans.use: Additional capital for her water refilling business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda A. is a beautician and manicurist in the village of San Jose, Santiago City. She is thankful because her business is improving. However, the income she generates is not enough considering the high cost of commodities. So, she would like to apply for a loan to use as additional capital in her business. She will utilize the loan for buying more equipment for her beauty salon. She is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000. This amount she is requesting will serve as a big help in developing her business.

Luzviminda is married to Floyd, who is farmer. They have six children: Leonard-28 years old; Nebrado Gill-26 years old; Merly-24 years old; Mariza-21 years old, all of them are high school graduates;f ollowed by Danilo-20 years old, a college student; and Mary jane-13 years old, a high school student. The couple hopes that their two youngest children will earn a college diploma.

loans.use: additional capital for business improvement.

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Mr. Vutha P., 26 (not in the picture, but his wife is available instead), and his wife, Mrs. Thet Chay, 23, live in a small village along National Road Number Five. about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. There were married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both children are in school. 

Vutha has been a motor taxi driver for over 6 years. His wife used to be a garment factory worker, but she now stays at home to take care of their children. Part of the house where they live is breaking down so Vutha is requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to in order to make the repairs.

loans.use: To repair some parts of the house where he lives.

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Mrs. Solita V. and her husband live harmoniously in a village located at Barangay Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. They are gifted with five children, two males and three females. Despite their education, they aim to improve their status of living. They help each other earn a living and support the schooling of their children. As a result of their patience and sacrifice, three of their children graduated from college and presently work abroad and the other two are busy managing their respective businesses.

Despite her age, Solita wants to continue to manage her small eatery while her husband manages their parcel of land by planting rice and vegetables. Every week, she earns a net income of PHP800, which they use for their daily needs and save for their future. She wants to improve her small business so she can earn a higher income. Thus, she applied for a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP5,000 to improve her small business and to maintain their crop production.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her small eatery

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe R. is from Ozamiz City. She is 47 years old, is married, and has two adult children. Fe owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for twenty-five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Fe is now requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients needed for her snack-vending business

loans.name: Relita

texts.en:
She is a resident of Marcos, Roxas, Isabela and a loving mother of four children: Apolonio Jr, Juliet, Gilbert, and Judith. Judith is on her third year in college and the others are already college 
graduates while others stopped from their studies due to lack of financial resources.  

Relita is married to Apolonio Sr, a farmer. Farming is their main source of income however, their income from their farm is not enough so she decided to engaged in hog raising business.  In this way, she can assist her husband in providing the basic needs of their family especially that their income from their farm is seasonal.  Sometimes, she and her husband are working as laborers in others farm to earn additional income.

She is now asking for a business capital of PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders that she needed to purchase feeds supply for the growth of their hogs.

loans.use: To buy feeds for their hogs

loans.name: Vutha

texts.en:
Mr. Vutha P., 26 (not in the picture, but his wife is pictured instead), and his wife, Mrs. Thet Chay, 23, live in a small village along National Road Number Five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. 

Vutha has been a motor taxi driver for over six years. His wife used to be a garment factory worker, but she now stays at home to take care of their children. Part of their house has fallen down so Vutha is requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to make the repair.

loans.use: To repair his house.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly P. is from the village of San Isidro Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 20 years old. Merly is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Merly owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Merly has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merly is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Merly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Hun S., 26, is single. He resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia with his family. He operates his car as a taxi from the city to other provinces in the country, earning approximately US $13 per day. This is his first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Mr. S. and his family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to have his car repaired so that he will be able to satisfy his customers’ demand and attract more customers to use his transportation services.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia M. manages a variety store and she raises hogs. She is married to Alberto. The couple is blessed with five children: Alvin, 26 years old, is an elementary school graduate; Lizelle, 24 years old, is a high school graduate; Irene, 22 years old, is a high school graduate; Alberto, 18 years old, is an elementary school graduate; and Abegail, 16 years old, is currently enrolled in high school. 

Virgilia would like to buy additional groceries but her income is not enough due to the expenses of her hog raising business. So, for this reason, she would like to borrow PHP5,000 for the improvement of her store and maintenance of her hog raising business. She will be very thankful if the KIVA lenders will grant this loan.

loans.use: Additional capital for business expansion

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen raises hogs in their village in Quezon, San Isidro. She is married to Noel who is a construction worker. They are blessed with four children: Carol, 15 years old, is a high school graduate; Teresa, 13 years old, is a high school student; Areceli, 11 years old, is an elementary school student and Angeline is four years old. The couple would like to improve their way of living by improving her hog raising business.  

Carmen would like to borrow a loan of PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders. She plans to use the loan to purchase feed for the growth of her hogs.  This will be a big help to her, especially to meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the hogs

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Bread delivery and hog raising are Henry's main sources of income. His daily net income is Php 500.00. He wants to take a loan of PHP 9,000.00 because he will use it for the additional needs of his business. He wants to buy more bread to sell to gain more income. He is also a part time electrician in their baranggay. According to him, he will do his best in order to meet his family needs and he will pursue his businesses in order to have a bountiful and productive life.
He has been married to Rosal C. for almost six years now, and they are blessed with three children. Hansel, 14, is a second year high school student;  John Rey, 11, is in grade four; and Veronica, 9, is in grade two. They reside in the village of Calaocan, Cabatuan, Isabela, a rural area. Their house is near the Day Care School and the national highway. He hopes that KIVA lenders will grant his loan to pursue his business to become profitable.

loans.use: To buy more bread to sell

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Miss Socheat S., age 24, is single (not in the picture because she was busy with her work, but her mother is pictured instead), lives with her sister,  brothers and widowed mother in a small village outside of Phnom Penh City.  
 
Socheat has been a garment factory worker for five years. Her mother stays at home. Socheat is applying for her first loan of $500 to help her sister purchase materials for her business selling Chinese noodles.

loans.use: To purchase materials for selling Chinese noodles

loans.name: Khlok

texts.en: Khlok S. has been in the farming business for years. She plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $3 per day. Her husband (he appears in the photo) earns a living as an ox trader. He always goes to buy oxen in the rural areas from farmers and re-sells those oxen to gain income. This couple has been married for years and has three children. Two of the children are married and one is a teenager attending school. Khlok S. sees that her husband’s business is profitable and she hopes to sustain it by accumulating a larger quantity of oxen using a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To accumulate a larger quantity of oxen

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma A. is from the village of Kiburiao , Quezon Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Gemma is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal  products from AVON like cosmetics, lotions and other items in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophea S., age 34 and her husband, Mr. Chamroeun Yan, age 39, have been married since 1992 and have two young sons. The family lives in a small village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.   

Sophea has been selling clothes for 10 years. She buys supplies of clothes from the Phnom Penh market for resale in the local market. Her husband has been selling watches for 10 years as well. She does not own her own shop, so she has to spend a lot of money to pay for rential costs. It is difficult for her to manage her income to support her family. 

Sophea is requesting a loan of 1,000USD to purchase her own shop to sell clothing.

loans.use: To purchase a shop to sell clothing.

loans.name: Lonh

texts.en: Lonh L., 42 years old, lives in the province of Siem Reap, Cambodia, where she owns and runs a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year, and she was taught how to grow rice by her grandfather. She is a good mother of five children. Three of them are married and live separately, while the other two are going to school and also work on the farm. Her husband is a blacksmith and helph meet a little more of the family's needs,. Lonh L. will use her first loan to purchase piglets to raise additional income and the rest of the loan will supply her  farming business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and supplies for her farming business

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Mr. Noun P., 40 and his wife, Mrs. Thorn Hean, 47, have been married since 1983 and have 4 daughters. Three of them work in a garment factory and one stays at home. They live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn City.  
 
Noun has been a construction worker for about 8 years. He works in his village and nearby villages. His wife stays at home and does housework. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: To repair his house.

loans.name: Theng

texts.en:
Mr. Theng Y., 45, and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Chhoeng, 40, live along national road number one, about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2003 and have one young daughter. His wife was available for the photo. 

Theng has been driving a motor taxi (Tuk Tuk) in Phnom Penh since 2005, while his wife stays at home and does housework. He wants to buy another newer motorbike for commuting. He is requesting a loan of $1200 to make the purchase.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Uk S., 36, is a village woman living in Siem Reap Province. She is a local crop farmer, growing rice, vegetables, and some fruit on her own farmland. To help meet the family's daily expense needs, her husband uses his own motorcycle to provide a taxi service and is earning approximately $5 a day. Uk S. has two school-aged kids. Recently, Uk S.'s husband can't earn much income because his old taxi has broken down and he can not pick up his passengers. To solve the problem, Uk S. applied for a loan to buy a new motorcycle which will enable for her husband to continue providing his service.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle which will enable her husband to continue his taxi service

loans.name: Abdul Hameid

texts.en: Abdul Hameid is the son of S. M.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40, and is married with 4 children. He runs a business selling construction supplies, and needs an individual loan of 30,000 AFN to purchase more materials in order to advance and bring some changes to his business. He would like to say that the Kiva process is really effective for people in Afghanistan because they are really in need of support.

loans.use: For expanding business

loans.name: Suy

texts.en: Suy N., age 37, is married to Hong Hol, 39, and they are villagers living in Siem Reap Province. They own a larger size farm where they plant green beans to earn a living. In addition, this couple have always bought the nearby neighbor’s beans to resell and gain additional income. The family lives with two teenage children, who attend the local high school. Suy N. would like to use the kiva loan as capital in order to purchase green bean from other growers and resell them to raise income.

loans.use: To collect green bean from other growers and resell them to raise income

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben S., 59, is a widow who lives with three of her children in the Kandal province. Since 2000, she has been selling fried bananas to earn a living and is able to make about US$5 of profit every day. She is aided by three of her children who are garment factory workers. Ben S. is asking for a loan of US$500 to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: Reinvest in her fried banana business.

loans.name: Yong

texts.en:
Mrs. Yong S., 57 and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Pha, 60, live along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1970 and have 8 children: 4 sons and 4 daughters. Three of them were married and live outside the family home and one son is a garment factory worker. 

Yong has been selling groceries for 2 years. She buys grocery items from Korki market for resale in front of her house. Her husband has been a farmer for 30 years. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng H., 55, is married and lives with her four children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers who make a combined income of around US$1.60 each day. Three of her children work as well. Two of her children are garment factoriey workers and one is a construction worker. The agriculture industry has really suffered in Cambodia over the past year, as the climate has had unfavorable conditions and inflation has been high. Eng H. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase construction tools for her children. With this purchase the family believes that it can increase its income and raise the standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase construction tools.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem T. is 33 years old and sells fruit in the Kampong Cham province. Her business has been around for about six years and she makes US $7 every day. Selling fruit has been a difficult business as there is high inflation and weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. 

She is asking for a loan of US $500 to invest into her own fruit business and increase her stock of fruits to sell. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will be able to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To invest into her own fruit business.

location.town: Tboung Kmum district, Kampong Cham province, Cambo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more soap, salt and vitenge in bulk.

loans.name: Faridullah

texts.en:
This is Faridullah, son of M. N.. He lives in the 6th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 27, single, and lives with his 5 other  family members. 

Faridullah is a tinsmith. This occupation has been passed down to him from his grandfather, and he has been working in his shop since he was a child.  He is a responsible, hard-working man who supports his family members with the income from his work. 

Faridullah would like to mention that Kiva loans are useful; that is why he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 AFN, which he will use to expand his business and to buy the necessities of his trade.

loans.use: to expand his business and to buy the necessities of his trade

loans.name: Bou
