loans.use: Purchase supplies of DVD's and CD's for resale

loans.name: Shine In Allah Group

texts.en: Mariama is forty three years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Mariama is a trader. She trades in cereals. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Shine in Allah. Most of the group members are traders. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Mariama is second from the right in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy supplies of cereal for resale

loans.name: Jean Damascene

texts.en:
Jean Damascene is 27 years old and is single. He lives in the Gasabo district where he has had a haircutting salon since 2007. With two successful years in this business he now employs three people in his salon working from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Jean Damascene, with the idea of increasing his salon in size as well as adding some new equipment, is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. If successful, he will be able to hire more employees to work in his salon as well as bringing in more profits than ever.

With this profit, Jean Damascene hopes to build a more secure future for himself.

loans.use: To buy some new equipment and supplies

loans.name: Hakikat

texts.en:
R. Hakikat is a very responsible and hard working girl. Four years ago, she started working as a seamstress working in a local workshop. Hakikat has a big family and that was the reason she has started her own business. She makes traditional woman dresses. She asks for a loan of $800 USD that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and cover her customers' demands. Help this family with improving the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Hakikat’s business. They sincerely thank you for it.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing fabrics to make traditional women dresses.

loans.name: Allah Bekwaana Group

texts.en: Asanatu is forty two years old. She is married and has given birth to one girl. Her daughter is in school. She lives with her husband and daughter in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Asanatu is a food vendor. She sells porridge. Asanatu is the leader of a trust bank group called Allah Bekwaana. Most of the group members are either into trading and farming activities. The group requests a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Asanatu, the group leader is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her food preparation business

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Agartha A. is married to a driver and they have three children. She has received junior high education. Agartha has been selling cloth, glasses, and shoes at Elmina since 2001. She supports her husband in paying the utility bills and the children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more glasses and cloth to sell. Agartha hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more glasses and cloth to sell

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 33 years old and is married with two children aged 2 and 4 years old. He lives in the Kayonza district where he has been working as a wholesaler, selling a wide variety of goods depending upon his clients' needs and wants. As his photo indicates, his shop is full of different items. This is his thirteenth year in that business working from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day. 

Innocent is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his shop through adding some new goods for wholesaling: specifically soap and shoes. If his strategy is successful and attracts customers, he hopes to earn more profits, which will help him to build a more secure future for his family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes and soap

loans.name: Di Woho Ni Group

texts.en:
Doris is 50 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a trader in second-hand clothes.

Doris (pictured middle) is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Di woho ni’, meaning 'be disciplined'. Most of the group members are engaged in trading or farming activities. The group members are requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: Muhaiyo

texts.en:
S. Muhaiyo is a married woman with a great drive to better herself, and this positive outlook on life has led her to make progress, little by little. For the past seven years she has been continuously devoted to animal sales. This business activity has led to much satisfaction because it allows her to provide for a considerable amount of the household income. Now Muhaiyo is planning to expand her business and buy more cows. It is for this reason that she is requesting a loan of $1500 USD. She kindly thanks you for your generosity.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle

loans.name: Prayer Is The Key Group

texts.en:
Salomey is 50 years old, married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a trader who runs a cold store.

Salomey (pictured middle) is the leader of a trust bank group called "Prayer is the key". Most of the group members are involved in trading activities. The group members are requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk

loans.name: C4559 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 27 years old and is married with two children. She lives in the Gasabo district which is a forty-five minutes drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. In her hometown, she is the president of a group called Tuzamurane. This relatively new group of entrepreneurs has operated the business of selling a variety of vegetables and since 2008 and their business is open from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Tuzamurane group is now requesting their first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding their business through purchasing a variety of vegetables and fruits for sale. They really believe that they will attract more customers as well as increase sales and profits. If this loan allows this strategy to succeed, the group plans to reinvest in their business and build more secure futures for their families.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Adelaide

texts.en:
Adelaide N. is married to an education officer and they have three children. She has received junior high education.

Since 1999 Adelaide has worked as a seamstress and sold lining, stiffener, shoulder pads and so on, at Elmina. Adelaide uses her income to support her husband in paying the utility bills and children's school fees. Adelaide will use her loan to purchase to buy more linen, zips, etc. for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adelaide plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: To purchase more linen, zips, etc. for sale

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Y. Nargiz is 29 years old. Her elder son is 7 and already goes to school. Nargiz sells make-up and cosmetics. Her husband has another  shop in a different market. Nargiz has been in the business for 4 years already. This is her first loan however, and she is quite sure that she will be able to repay it in a timely manner. Nargiz dreams of expanding her business, opening a new own store and establish contacts with the constant suppliers of well-known producers. Nargiz and her husband are working hard in order to have sufficient funds to educating their kids so that they will be in high demand for good jobs in the future. Now Nargiz requests $800 US Dollars in order to purchase new make-up, such as lipstick, mascara, powders, skin creams, etc. She wants to enlarge her range of goods. Nargiz would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to repay the loan in time.

loans.use: Increase her stock of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Queen Estherkade Group

texts.en: Theresa is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to four children and all are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Theresa is a trader. She sells slippers. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Queen Esther. Most of the group members are either into trading or farming activities. The group requestsa loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Theresa, the group leader is in the middle of the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy supplies of slippers

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 27 years old and is married with two children aged 1 and 4 years old. She lives in the Kayonza district approximately an hour and a half drive from Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. It is in this district where Chantal has had a shop selling a variety of goods since 2002 as the photo indicates. Chantal starts her business at 5 a.m. and finishes at 9 p.m. every day.

Chantal is requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her shop through purchasing some additional goods for sale. She hopes that this will attract more customers to her shop as there seems to be demand for these items she plans to purchase.

If successful, any profits from this strategy Chantal will use to build a more secure future for her children.

loans.use: To purchase some additional goods to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married with two children. She runs a small food store in the town of Mukachevo. Olga started her business 2 years ago. She chose the food business because there will always be a high demand for her inventories. During the last two years Olga's family's income has increased since she began to make enough money with her business.

Olga would like to borrow 4,000 UAH to increase the assortment of ther stock. Olga is a hard working and honest person. She plans to continue developing her business and increase her family income.

loans.use: to increase the assortment and size of her stock

loans.name: Bakhtier

texts.en:
G. Bakhtier is 38 years old. He is married and has four adorable children of school age. Bakhtier’s wife is not working. She keeps house and takes care of their children. Bakhtier has a very large family. In addition to his wife and kids, he is supporting his parents and sister. To be able to do this, Bakhtier is running a business. He sells perfumery for women and men, deodorants, air fresheners, shaving cream, and more. All the goods are supplied from Almaty, Kazakhstan. Today, Bakhtier is requesting $1500 US dollars, as he is planning to expand his business and increase his capital. Bakhtier would like to thank all supporting him and promises to pay the loan in time. Your support will really help him. Be an important part of the growth of Bakhtier’s business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods for increasing his range of products

loans.name: Mawu Pe Mo Group

texts.en: Benjamin is thirty-six years old. He is married and has two children, both in school. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. He manufactures metal pots. Benjamin is the leader of a trust bank group called "Mawu pe mo," meaning "God’s way." Most of the group members are into trading activities. The group is requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Benjamin is the one standing in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Maame Esi

texts.en: Maame Esi W. is married and has two children. She has received a junior-high education. Maame Esi sells provisions such as sugar, toffees, powdered milk, and so on in Elmina, which she has been doing since 2002. Her husband is a businessman. Maame Esi uses her income to support her husband in the payment of utility bills and the school fees of the children. Maame Esi will use the loan to purchase provisions in bulk to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame Esi plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: Maame Esi will use the loan to purchase provisions in bulk to sell

loans.name: Education Group

texts.en:
Zaya Wallah is the leader of 'Education' group. There are four members in this group. Zaya Wallah is a married man; he lives with four daughters in district 11, Kabul, Afghanistan. They are in university and Zaya Wallah wants to take a loan for his business of fruit selling. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop.

A. Ghafor and M. Omeir want to take a loan for their business of carpet weaving. They want to expand and progress their business. .M. Shekab wants to take a loan for his general store. He wants to make his shop larger. They have requested a group loan of 28,000 Afghani.

They want to thank AFSG in Afghanistan and all Kiva lenders who help poor people in Afghanistan.

loans.use: Expand and grow their businesses

loans.name: Umarali

texts.en:
K. Umarali is 40 years old. He is married with three children. Umarali sells men's clothing. Thirteen years ago he started as a seller. Gradually, he saved some money, sold his car, and started his own business. Now he is a very experienced entrepreneur and manages his business trying to keep his clients happy. The business is successful and generates a stable income for the family. Today Umarali is requesting $800 US dollars for the purchase of new men's clothing to sell. Umarali thanks everyone supporting him and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase new men's clothing to sell

loans.name: Pillars Of Tomorrow Group

texts.en: Elizabeth is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in foodstuff. Elizabeth is the leader of a trust bank group called Pillars of Tomorrow. Most of the group members are either into trading or farming activities. The group is requesting a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. Elizabeth, the group leader, is the first from the right in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Joyce Angelina

texts.en: Joyce Angelina M. is married to a banker and has three children. She has been through commercial school. Since 1999 Joyce Angelina has been selling second-hand textiles, such as towels, bedspreads and curtains, at Elmina market. She uses her profits to support her husband in paying the utility bills and children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bails of second-hand textiles. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To buy bails of second-hand textiles

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
K. Dilbar is 49 years old and lives with her husband. She sells men's clothing in the central market of Dushanbe city. She works every day, starting very early in the morning, so that she can get ahead and achieve her goal of having her children successfully finish school and enter university.

Thanks to the support of her husband and her own effort, Dilbar has been able to expand her business, which began with little inventory and in a small space, into a bigger space with a larger clientele. With her loan of $800 USD, Dilbar will buy a greater variety of clothing styles, for a variety of occasions, and also meet some specific customer requests.

loans.use: To purchase new men's clothing

loans.name: Liily

texts.en: Liily is 25 years old, single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in Kade, a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Liily has been a trader in artificial hair for the last three years. She sells it from a shed in the community's market square, and also treks to other communities to sell on their market days. She also supplies artificial hair to hairdressers in her community. Liily wants a loan facility to procure goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy artificial hair in bulk

loans.name: Edria

texts.en: Edria E. is married to a trader and has two children. She has received tertiary education. Since 2009 Edria has been selling hair weaves, body creams, hair relaxers and so on, at Elmina market. She supports her husband in paying the utility bills and school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more hair and body products to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To buy more hair and body products for resale

loans.name: Alfiya

texts.en:
M. Alfiya is 46 years old. She is married with two children. She owns a specialized fabrics store in the central market in Dushanbe City. Because the national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and very important item of the dowry of any girl, demand is consistently high. She is one of the leading fabrics vendors in the market in which she works. 

Alfiya is very persistent and determined in all of her business endeavors, which have helped support her and her family for 5 years. Moreover, Alfiya is a skilled entrepreneur. When she started this trade, she decided to implement basic concepts of integrity and hard work in her business to reach ultimate success. This laid a firm foundation for winning results and Alfiya has obviously been a successful small entrepreneur. However, she doesn’t want to stop. She would like to continue seeing her venture grow. Consequently, she is currently requesting a loan of $1,100 USD, which she will use to increase her assorted inventory and possibly open a new vending location in the future.

loans.use: purchasing new types of fabric

loans.name: Only Jesus Group

texts.en:
Hagar is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in an apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming and commercial town in the Eastern region of Ghana. 

Hagar is a trader; specifically, she trades in second hand clothes. Hagar is the leader of a trust bank group called Only Jesus. Most of the group members are into trading and or farming activities. The group is requesting a loan so that they can procure goods in bulk in order to expand their businesses. Hagar, the group leader, is second from left in the photograph. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: purchasing stock

loans.name: Sadridin

texts.en:
Sadridin is a very hardworking and responsible entrepreneur. He lives with his family in Dushanbe, Tajikistan. He is the loving father of 6 children. Sadridin works in the central city market selling men’s clothing, jeans, jackets and shirts. His business is characterized by stability and consistent growth. He has been working in the market for 2 years. His business has been the main source of income for his whole family. Currently, Sadridin is requesting a loan of $800 USD, with which he will purchase inventory from wholesalers and thus increase the assortment of merchandise in his store. We believe that Sadridin’s drive for success will help this young entrepreneur's business thrive. By lending, you can become an important part of the growth of Sadridin’s shop.

loans.use: purchasing men’s clothing, jeans, jackets and shirts from wholesalers

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en:
S. Robiya is 44 years old. She is married with three children. She began this business because the salary of her husband was not enough for their needs. Robiya is selling different kinds of accessories for hair and cosmetics for women and girls in the local market. She is dreaming of expanding her business, opening her own store and establishing contacts with the constant suppliers of well-known products. With this purpose, today Robiya requests 3500 Somoni in order to increase the range of goods she sells. This amount would help her accomplish her goals in a short time. She would like to thank everybody supporting her and promises to pay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 46-year-old trader. She is married with five children; three are currently attending school through the help of government free compulsory education. Her husband is a farmer, specifically on a palm nuts plantation, and a trader. It is her daily dream to provide a quality education for her children to give them a better future life. She owns and operates a grocery shop with items like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, evaporated milk, etc. She is also into the sale of foodstuffs like vegetables, spices etc. but she is constrained with funds to make business progress. She is appealing for your loan help. She wants to use the loan to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. With increased stock of different varieties, she hopes to make more income to provide for the educational needs of her children. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy evaporated milk, rice, canned foods and drinks, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 35 years old. He is married with two kids.  He is a general photographer and has been in business for the last 14 years now. He owns a photography and video shop called DK photo studios, where his clients pose for their photographs. He also moves to occasions like parties and concerts to take photographs of his clients. He requests a loan to buy additional tools and materials like digital camera, flash, video camera, reflecting umbrella etc. to expand his operations. He deems it as an opportunity to make business progress through the loan assistance.

loans.use: To buy additional tools and materials like digital camera, flash, video camera etc.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is 50 years old. She is widowed and the mother of five children. All her children are fully independent and live on their own. She works hard to support herself and her business. She is a supplier of local palm fruits and palm oil. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes like frying fish, local soaps and pastries. She produces and supplies to food vendors to prepare their meals. She also sells the palm fruits to those who need them for further processing. However, her production is on the lower side as a result of low working capital to buy stock in bulk. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of palm fruits. She believes the loan will enable her to make more profit as we enter the Christmas festivities. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy bulk supply of palm oil and palm nuts fruits.

loans.name: Amanfrom Ebenezer Group

texts.en:
Florence is 50 years old. She is married and the mother of four children. All her children are currently independent. She is a very hard working woman and works hard to support her business and in taking care of herself. She trades in flip-flops, Ghana-made slippers, shoes and sandals for both sexes. She takes delivery of stock from Accra in Ghana. She purchases them in different sizes, colors and designs so that her customers can make their choice. She mostly sells them through hawking, which is house to house selling, and sometimes in the community market. She has no regret with this business because it has given her lots of experience in marketing and sales. In spite of her age, she is able to sell more within a day. She requests your loan assistance to buy stock in bulk. She would be grateful for your support as we approach the Christmas festivities.

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Amanfrom Ebenezer’. She is the one standing in the middle in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers, respectively. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy flip-flops and Ghana made slippers in bulk

loans.name: Anthonia

texts.en: To earn a livelihood, Anthonia sells local gin. She has been in this business for a long time.  She hopes to increase her earnings in the future and be able to better provide for her children’s education. She is 39 years-old and married with five children. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more local gin to sell. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She says thanks to all her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase gin to sell.

loans.name: The Light Of God Group

texts.en:
Kate is a 53 year-old married mother of three children. All her children are adults except the youngest who is still in school. To support her household, she has been selling cereals such as local rice and maize in the community market to her loyal customers. She says selling these products is very lucrative and she has been in business for twenty years now. With her rich experience in selling, she is very popular in the areas where she trades her goods. She takes delivery of stock from the farming communities and this prevents her from using intermediaries who sell to her at higher prices. Therefore, she wants the loan to expand her inventory to enable her to make a good income to support her family especially the one in school. She hopes to repay the loan in time.

Kate is the leader of a trust bank group called "The Light of God". She is the one standing second from left in the group photograph. The members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan. The group will be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cereals.

loans.name: Efosa

texts.en: Efosa has been in the photography business for the past five years. Although It is currently the high season for his photography services, Efosa hopes to render more services during and after the high season. His greatest joy is the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He plans to purchase a generator and also to renovate his studio with the N50,000 loan he is requesting. He says thanks to all his Kiva lenders. He is 32 years old and single without children. Efosa hopes to get married some day.

loans.use: To purchase a generator and also to renovate his studio

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 35 years old, married and the mother of three children. All of her children are currently in school. She works very hard to support her business and her children in school. She trades in flip-flops and Ghana-made slippers, shoes and sandals for both sexes. She takes delivery of stock from Accra. She purchases them in different sizes, colors and designs so that her customers can make their choice. She mostly sells them through hawking (house to house selling), and sometimes in the community market. She has no regrets regarding her business choice because it has given her lots of marketing and sales experience. In spite of keen competition in the market she manages to make plenty of sales every day. She is requesting Kiva loan assistance to buy stock in bulk. She would be grateful for the support of Kiva lenders as the festive Christmas season approaches.

loans.use: To buy flip-flop and Ghana-made slippers in bulk from Accra.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance is 38-years old, married and the mother of five children. Four of her children attend school, while her last born is still breastfeeding. Constance trades in rice cereals, lace items useful in room and office decorations, textiles, and clothing. For lack of adequate working capital, she buys a few items and sells through hawking. She believes that, with her nine years of experience in sales, she will be able to grow her business to the expected level. With this loan, she wants to purchase lace items, rice cereals, and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen loves cooking and that is why she commercialized her culinary skill by owning a restaurant. She makes mouthwatering Nigerian foods like amala (yam porridge) and fufu (dumplings made of cassava, yam, plantain, or rice) that are served with stews and soups including ewedu (jute leaves), egusi (melon seed), or ogbolo (dika nut). She has been in this business for a long time.

Helen is 38 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a musician. All her children are in school. Helen hopes for a loan of N90,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 52 years old and is married with six children between 25 and 35 years of age. None of her children goes to school. She owns a five-roomed house where she resides with 10 people. Amina takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and eats three meals a day. Amina incurs additional transport costs to and from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda.

Amina works in Owino market, which is in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a stall selling second-hand shoes at both retail and wholesale levels. Amina works seven days a week and has an average of 20 customers a day. Her major business challenges include defaulters, the ever-increasing prices of second-hand shoes, and the rainy season, which hinders her customers ability to reach her. Amina’s monthly expenses include monthly market dues of 40000UGX. She has been in this business for over six years and with MCDT for seven years, servicing her fourteenth loan working with the same group mates. Amina joined MCDT because it was near her home and also was giving loans to poor women .She wants to use this loan to buy more pairs of second-hand shoes. She aspires to a larger business on the wholesale level only.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand shoes

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 45 years old, divorced, and the mother of two children. All her children are in school through the proceeds from her business. She has been sewing for 15 years and has rich experience in customer service and just in time (JIT) delivery to her customers. She is a specialist in female clothing and sews various styles that give her customers a new look. She sews school uniforms, church attire, kaba and slit (tailored top and long skirt), wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc.

Comfort wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. (She mostly buys her raw materials from Togo.) Through her dedication and hard work, she has eight apprentices whom she is giving quality training for their future occupation. She hopes to increase her savings to provide her children with quality education. She needs the loan within this season so that she can increase her profit as customers order their Christmas dresses from her.

loans.use: To buy increased  of sewing supplies.

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en:
Abdel Karim is a 30-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. Abdel Karim sells all kinds of birds. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase bird food and different bird breeds. This is his second loan cycle and he has paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his business.

Abdel Karim is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties because he took after his father’s work. Abdel Karim wants to improve his income and he plans on expanding.

loans.use: To purchase bird food and different bird breeds.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen is 45 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is a pastor. She makes a living selling foodstuffs such as yams. Her goal is to be an even more important distributor of foodstuffs to her community in the future. She is a friendly woman and is very skilled at attracting more customers to her stall. This is the high season for her business, and has applied for this loan to buy more supplies and meet the demands of her customers. She extends her thanks to all Kiva supporters.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en: Rosina is 56 years old, married and the mother of six children. Five of her children are in school. She works hard to help her husband support their family while also taking care of their home. Rosina makes a living producing and selling palm oil, which she makes from palm nuts. Palm oil is popular in her area because it is used to prepare many local dishes such as fried fish and pastries, as well as soap. She sells her supplies to food vendors, and also uses it to make her own special dish, rice with gravy. She would like to increase her output of palm oil, but is limited by a lack of funds. Rosina has applied for this loan to buy more palm fruit, rice, vegetables and equipment. She believes this loan will allow her to put money aside to continue to educate her children, and would very much appreciate your assistance.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts to use in making palm oil.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en: Kate is 42 years old, married and has five children. Her husband makes a living selling building materials, and she sells fufu in Benin City, Edo state.  Fufu is a form of fermented cassava that is the main lunch dish in Nigeria and is usually served with popular soups such as egusi, banga and ewedu. She has been in this line of work for a long time, and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for a loan to buy more cassava, and extends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more cassava

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 27 years old and lives in Tripoli, Lebanon. She owns a shop where she sells women’s clothing, such as dresses, skirts, t-shirts, tops and accessories. She has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy merchandise for the winter season and the holidays. Salma has been a microcredit client for the last five years and has always paid back her loans on time. Previous loans helped her improve her shop by diversifying her supplies and meeting the needs of more customers. 

Salma is popular because she has lots of experience and treats her clients well. Many are friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had difficulty securing supplies, but her business has done well and she is committed to continue expanding it.

loans.use: To buy winter and holiday merchandise to sell to her customers

loans.name: Lord Of Lord Group

texts.en:
A. is 31 years old, married and the father of two children, both of whom are in school. He makes a living selling oranges and smoked fish. He started this business three years ago at local community market. He buys his fish in the Accra region of Ghana and is known for the quality of his products, which is why many people buy from him. Demand for his products has increased, but he lacks capital to meet that demand. He is applying for a loan to increase his output. His dream is to give his children a quality education from the proceeds from the business, and he would be grateful for your support.

A. leads a trust bank group called ‘Lord of LORD' and is the one standing in the middle in the photograph. Most of the members of this group are traders, food vendors and farmers. They guarantee each others' loans, and would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy fruits such as oranges, smoked fish and dried fish.

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 39-year-old man who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Walid has been working as a car painter since 1994. He also sells spare parts for cars. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase spare parts for cars. This is his third cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve his work. Walid is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Walid decided on doing his business because he likes his work. In the future, he plans on expanding by selling more spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase car spare parts.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope is 26 and married with one child aged 18 months. She rents a one-room house where she is staying with three people .Hope doesn’t take care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water and gets three meals a day. She incurs additional transport costs to and from shopping at Natete, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She works in a semi-urban area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a stall selling milk in Mengo Mackay. She sells at both retail and wholesale. Hope works seven days a week. She receives an average of 30 customers a day. Her major business challenges include defaulters, the ever increasing price of milk and the rainy season which hinders her customers from reaching her .Hope’s monthly expenses include monthly rent of 40000/=. She has been in this business for over three years and with MCDT for two years, servicing her third loan working with the same group mates. Hope joined MCDT because it was near her home and because it was easy to work with them. She wants to use this loan to buy more jerry cans of milk. She aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more jerry cans of milk

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Mr. M. Emmanuel S. is a carpenter and owns a workshop in Ibanda town along Jubilee Street. He is 54 years old. He is requesting a loan to purchase more timber for his carpentry workshop. He really aspires to obtain a large-scale carpentry workshop to sell a wide range of furniture in the same location and attract an awesome number of customers. He has been running this business for over 25 years. He is married and blessed with four children who are grown-ups now. He is a hardworking businessman who is trying to set up a retail shop for the wife too.

loans.use: To purchase more timber for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith lives in Edo State, Nigeria. She sells groceries and drinks at retail prices to her customers to earn a living. She is a hard working woman and she is determined to lift her business with this Kiva loan. She is 42 years old and married with four children. Her husband is an engineer and he also supports the home. She hopes for a loan of N60,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell
